original: 'brel pa dang ni rjes mthun thabs //

analyzed: skyes bu'i don ni rjod byed ngag / dpyad par bya bar 'os pa yin //

analyzed: gzhan yang gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi nang nas 'di gang yin zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ni zab mo'i don mdor ston pas na mdo'i sde yin no //

original: de lta na 'di'i dgos pa ni gang yin //
analyzed: de lta na 'di'i dgos pa ni gang yin //

original: bsdus pa'i don ni gang yin /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni gang yin /

analyzed: tshig gi don dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / brgal ba'i lan ni gang yin zhes brjod par bya ste ;

analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: rnam par bshad pa'i rig pa las /

analyzed: mdo don smra ba dag gis ni // dgos pa bsdus pa'i don bcas dang // tshig don bcas dang mtshams sbyar bcas //
translated: The expounders of sutra🔽should explain with purpose, condensed meaning,🔽the meaning of the words, the connection,

original: brgal lan bcas pas bsnyad par bya //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: brgal lan bcas pas bsnyad par bya // zhes bshad pa yin no zhe na /

original: 'dir brjod par bya ste /🔽de bzhin @203a * //
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ste / de bzhin @203a * //
translated: Here it should be said:🔽The condensed meaning is this:

original: gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba ni gsum ste /
translated: The secret of all tathagatas is threefold:

original: sku'i gsang ba dang / gsung gi gsang ba dang / thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: sku'i gsang ba dang / gsung gi gsang ba dang / thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
translated: the secret of body, the secret of speech, and the secret of mind.

original: gsang ba rnams 'dus shing tshogs pa gang la yod pa ni gsang ba 'dus pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: gsang ba rnams 'dus shing tshogs pa gang la yod pa ni gsang ba 'dus pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ste /
translated: The Bhagavat Vajradhara is the Gathering of Secrets, since the secret ones are gathered and assembled in him.

original: de la de dag rag las pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de dag rag las pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are dependent on him.

original: de la mdor bsdu na //
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na //

original: sku'i gsang ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i gsang ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: the secret of body is the Bhagavat Vairochana, etc.

original: gsung gi gsang ba ni spyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gi gsang ba ni spyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The secret of speech is Locana, etc.

original: thugs kyi gsang ba ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thugs kyi gsang ba ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa ste /
translated: The secret of mind is Yamantaka, etc.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa rjod par byed pa'i gzhung la yang nye bar btags nas ming de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa rjod par byed pa'i gzhung la yang nye bar btags nas ming de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The text that expresses the Gathering of Secrets is also designated by that name,

original: si ta phrogs pa'i snyan dngags bzhin no //
analyzed: si ta phrogs pa'i snyan dngags bzhin no //
translated: like the poetry of the abduction of Sita.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it will be explained:

original: sku gsung thugs ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: The three, body, speech, and mind,

original: gsang ba zhes ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes ni bstan pa yin //
translated: are taught to be the secret.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba //
translated: The so-called all buddhas

original: tshogs pa 'dus pa yin par bshad //🔽ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa 'dus pa yin par bshad //🔽ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: are explained to be the assembly.

original: shes rab dang thabs dag gi snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dag gi snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The union of wisdom and means.

original: rab tu sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: rab tu sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Application is yoga.

original: nye bar song bas na thabs te /
analyzed: nye bar song bas na thabs te /
translated: Approaching is means.

original: sems zhes rab tu 'jug pa'o //🔽de nyid dngos po'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: sems zhes rab tu 'jug pa'o // de nyid dngos po'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: The mind is engaged.🔽That is the characteristic of reality.

original: de de kho na'i ngo bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de kho na'i ngo bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of thatness.

original: de yang gyur pa po ma gtogs par gyur pa med pas sems nyid de /
analyzed: de yang gyur pa po ma gtogs par gyur pa med pas sems nyid de /
translated: And that is mind itself, since there is no transformation apart from the transformer.

original: thabs de nyid zhi gnas dang skyes bu dang ye shes kyang yin no //
analyzed: thabs de nyid zhi gnas dang skyes bu dang ye shes kyang yin no //
translated: That means is also serenity, insight, and gnosis.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i ye shes ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i ye shes ni shes rab ste /
translated: Wisdom is the gnosis of unreality.

original: phul du byung ba'i shes pa yin pas so //
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i shes pa yin pas so //
translated: Because it is the highest knowledge.

original: 'dir rang bzhin med pa la yang shes rab ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rang bzhin med pa la yang shes rab ces bya ste /
translated: Here, unreality is also called wisdom,

original: rig pa dang rig bya dbyer med pas so //
analyzed: rig pa dang rig bya dbyer med pas so //
translated: because the knower and the known are inseparable.

original: de kho na nyid bye brag tu mthong bas na lhag mthong yin la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bye brag tu mthong bas na lhag mthong yin la /
translated: Since one sees reality distinctly, it is insight.

original: sdug par gyur pas na dga' ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug par gyur pas na dga' ba ma yin te /
translated: Since it is not pleasant, it is not joy.

original: shes rab dang rig pa dang shes bya yang yin no //
analyzed: shes rab dang rig pa dang shes bya yang yin no //
translated: It is also wisdom, knowledge, and the knowable.

original: thabs dang shes rab de dag gnyis su med pa ni rab tu sbyor ba ste rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab de dag gnyis su med pa ni rab tu sbyor ba ste rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The non-duality of those means and insight is the application, which is yoga.

original: rgyud ni rgyun te /
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyun te /
translated: A continuum is a stream.

original: de yang rgyu'i rgyud dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud dang / thabs kyi rgyud do //
analyzed: de yang rgyu'i rgyud dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud dang / thabs kyi rgyud do //
translated: Moreover, it is a causal continuum, a resultant continuum, and a method continuum.

original: de la rigs kyi dbye ba ni rgyu'i rgyud do //
analyzed: de la rigs kyi dbye ba ni rgyu'i rgyud do //
translated: Among them, the classification of spiritual families is the causal continuum.

original: rigs kyi dbye ba las 'bras bur gyur pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'bras bu'i rgyud do //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye ba las 'bras bur gyur pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'bras bu'i rgyud do //
translated: The classification of the resultant continuum is the classification of the great Vajradhara, who is the result of the classification of the spiritual families.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu grub par bya ba'i phyir sngags dang / phyag rgya dang / dkyil 'khor la @203b sogs pa'i rkyen ni thabs kyi rgyud yin no //
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu grub par bya ba'i phyir sngags dang / phyag rgya dang / dkyil 'khor la @203b sogs pa'i rkyen ni thabs kyi rgyud yin no //
translated: The conditions of mantra, seal, maṇḍala, and so forth are the method continuum, because the result is accomplished from the cause.

original: rnal 'byor gtso bor gyur pa'i rgyud ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gtso bor gyur pa'i rgyud ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud do //
translated: A tantra in which yoga is primary is a yoga tantra.

original: de ston par byed pa nyid yin pas na gzhung la yang 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa nyid yin pas na gzhung la yang 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since it teaches that, the treatise is also called that.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: shes rab thabs kyi snyoms 'jug pa //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi snyoms 'jug pa //
translated: The meditative equipoise of insight and means

original: rnal 'byor zhes ni bya bar bshad //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes ni bya bar bshad //
translated: is explained to be called “yoga.”

original: gang zhig dngos med shes rab ste //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos med shes rab ste //
translated: Wisdom is the absence of entity,

original: thabs ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thabs ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: And method is the characteristic of entity.

original: rgyun ni rgyud ces bya bar grags //
analyzed: rgyun ni rgyud ces bya bar grags //
translated: The continuum is known as the tantra.

original: rgyun de rnam pa gsum 'gyur te //
analyzed: rgyun de rnam pa gsum 'gyur te //
translated: That continuum is threefold:🔽The basis, the nature, and the abandonment,

original: gzhi dang de bzhin rang bzhin dang // spong du med par rab tu phye //
analyzed: gzhi dang de bzhin rang bzhin dang // spong du med par rab tu phye //
translated: Which is distinguished as not to be abandoned.

original: rang bzhin sbyang bya'i rgyu yin te //
analyzed: rang bzhin sbyang bya'i rgyu yin te //
translated: The nature is the cause of the purified.

original: de bzhin spang med 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin spang med 'bras bu'o //
translated: Similarly, the not to be abandoned is the result.

original: gzhi ni thabs zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: gzhi ni thabs zhes bya ba ste //
translated: The basis is called the method.

original: gsum gyi rgyud ni don bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gsum gyi rgyud ni don bsdus pa'o //
translated: The tantra of the three is the summary of the meaning.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: gang gi phyir gsang ba 'dus pa 'di ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud yin pa de'i phyir rnal 'byor gyi rgyud gzhan dang thun mong du gyur pa ni 'di'i gtso bo'i dgos pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsang ba 'dus pa 'di ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud yin pa de'i phyir rnal 'byor gyi rgyud gzhan dang thun mong du gyur pa ni 'di'i gtso bo'i dgos pa ste /
translated: Because this Guhyasamaja is a yoga tantra, therefore, the commonality with other yoga tantras is its principal purpose.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyud do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyud do //
translated: It is the resultant tantra.

original: thun mong ma yin pa ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di nyid las gsang ba 'dus pa'i tshul du 'bras bu grub pa'i phyir srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ni mi zad pa dang mi nyams pa bla na med
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di nyid las gsang ba 'dus pa'i tshul du 'bras bu grub pa'i phyir srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ni mi zad pa dang mi nyams pa bla na med
translated: The extraordinary is that because the result is accomplished in the manner of the Guhyasamāja Tantra, Bhagavān Vajradhara does not abide in either existence or peace, and is unsurpassed, inexhaustible, and undiminished.🔽

original: pa'i chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i thar pa chen po'i bde ba yin te /
analyzed: pa'i chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i thar pa chen po'i bde ba yin te /
translated: The uncommon is that, because the result is accomplished in the manner of the Guhyasamāja Tantra, Bhagavān Vajradhara, who does not abide in existence or peace, is the great bliss of liberation that is the unexcelled mastery over all inexhaustible and undiminishing phenomena.

original: de bas na 'di ni skyes bu'i don gyi mchog tu gyur pa yin pas na dgos pa'i gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni skyes bu'i don gyi mchog tu gyur pa yin pas na dgos pa'i gtso bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, since this is the supreme purpose of persons, it is the principal purpose.

original: de ni rang nyid la tha dad pa mi mnga' na yang thabs kyi dbye bas tha dad par tha snyad du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang nyid la tha dad pa mi mnga' na yang thabs kyi dbye bas tha dad par tha snyad du byas pa yin no //
translated: Although he himself is not different, he is conventionally made different by the divisions of the method.

original: de la gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i thabs ni thabs gzhan de dag thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i thabs ni thabs gzhan de dag thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /
translated: The method called “Guhyasamāja” is superior to all other methods.

original: shin tu bde ba dang / shin tu myur ba nyid du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu bde ba dang / shin tu myur ba nyid du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes the attainment of the state of Great Vajradhara in a very happy and very quick way.

original: de bas na des thob pa'i 'bras bu gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba yang 'bras bu thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na des thob pa'i 'bras bu gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba yang 'bras bu thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa yin par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the result that is attained by it, called the Guhyasamaja, is also explained as being the best of all results.

original: rgyu'i rgyud dang thabs kyi rgyud ni dgos pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i thabs yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyud dang thabs kyi rgyud ni dgos pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i thabs yin te /
translated: The causal continuum and the method continuum are the means that are in accordance with the purpose.

original: de dag thos pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis nyams su blang bar nus pa nyid yin la de dag gis nyams su blangs pas dgos pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽thabs kyang gnas ji lta ba bzhin du gsang @204a * //
analyzed: de dag thos pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis nyams su blang bar nus pa nyid yin la de dag gis nyams su blangs pas dgos pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro // thabs kyang gnas ji lta ba bzhin du gsang @204a * //
translated: They are able to be practiced by means of the characteristics of hearing, reflection, and so forth, and the purpose is accomplished by practicing them.

original: ba rnams 'dus pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ba rnams 'dus pa nyid yin no //
translated: The method is also the gathering of the secrets just as they are.

original: 'brel pa ni tshig dang ngag rnams don gcig la bsdu ba'i phyir ltos pa sngon du song ba can gyi phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni tshig dang ngag rnams don gcig la bsdu ba'i phyir ltos pa sngon du song ba can gyi phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa ste /
translated: The connection is the mutual assistance that has the dependence of gathering the words and the speech into one meaning.

original: lnga pa dgu pa nyid dag dang // bcu bdun pa dang bcu gsum pa //
analyzed: lnga pa dgu pa nyid dag dang // bcu bdun pa dang bcu gsum pa //
translated: the seventeenth and the thirteenth,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: and so on.

original: de yang phyis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang phyis bstan par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: dgos pa smras zin to //
analyzed: dgos pa smras zin to //
translated: The purpose has already been stated.

original: bsdus pa'i don kyang 'brel ba bstan pa nyid las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don kyang 'brel ba bstan pa nyid las shes par bya'o //
translated: The summary meaning should be understood from the teaching on the connection.

original: tshig gi don dang mtshams sbyar ba dang brgal ba'i lan rnams kyang gnas skabs ji lta ba nyid du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don dang mtshams sbyar ba dang brgal ba'i lan rnams kyang gnas skabs ji lta ba nyid du bshad par bya'o //
translated: The meanings of the words, the connection, and the replies to objections should be explained according to the circumstances.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsnyen bkur ba yin pa'i phyir thos pa ma lus pa yang dag par bsags pa yin pa dang / thos pa 'dzin pa'i mchog yin par 'jig rten na grags pa yin pas nyan thos kyi sde snod sdud par byed pa ni 'phags pa kun dga' bo yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsnyen bkur ba yin pa'i phyir thos pa ma lus pa yang dag par bsags pa yin pa dang / thos pa 'dzin pa'i mchog yin par 'jig rten na grags pa yin pas nyan thos kyi sde snod sdud par byed pa ni 'phags pa kun dga' bo yin no //
translated: Thus, because he was a servant of the Tathagata, he had completely accumulated all learning, and because he was known in the world as the foremost in retaining what he had heard, the noble Ananda was the compiler of the Sravaka Canon.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi sdud pa po ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje yin te de ni bskal pa bzang po'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku dang chos kyi tshogs srung ba'i dbang du byas pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi sdud pa po ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje yin te de ni bskal pa bzang po'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku dang chos kyi tshogs srung ba'i dbang du byas pa dang /
translated: Likewise, the compiler of the bodhisattva canon is Bhagavat Vajrapani, who is the protector of the form bodies and assemblies of Dharma of the tathagatas of this fortunate eon.🔽The entrustment of the teachings is found in the Vajrapani Empowerment Sutra and so on, and in the seventeenth chapter of the Vajrapani Empowerment Sutra,

original: phyag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i mdo las bstan pa gtad par 'byung ba dang / le'u bcu bdun pa las /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i mdo las bstan pa gtad par 'byung ba dang / le'u bcu bdun pa las /
translated: it says:

original: rdo rje chos zhes bya ba dang / chos kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po zhes bstan pa gang yin pa der yang phyag na rdo rje nyid la de skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje chos zhes bya ba dang / chos kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po zhes bstan pa gang yin pa der yang phyag na rdo rje nyid la de skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: The one called Vajradharma and the one called King of Lords of Dharma are also Vajrapani himself, who is taught in that way.

original: rdo rje theg pa ni rdo rje chos dang rdo rje chos kyi dbang phyug yin la /
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa ni rdo rje chos dang rdo rje chos kyi dbang phyug yin la /
translated: The Vajrayana is Vajradharma and the lord of Vajradharma,

original: de yang de la gtad pa yin pa'i phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang de la gtad pa yin pa'i phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: and because it is entrusted to him, he is called that.

original: de bas na 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod mtha' dag byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis bsdus par gyur pa na sdud pa po dang / ston pa po dang / chos kyi bdag nyid kyi che ba yin par shes par bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod mtha' dag byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis bsdus par gyur pa na sdud pa po dang / ston pa po dang / chos kyi bdag nyid kyi che ba yin par shes par bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the entire Bodhisattva Canon is collected by a single Bodhisattva, it should be understood as the greatness of the compiler, the teacher, and the nature of the Dharma, and not otherwise.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na zhes kyis la chos bsdu bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na zhes kyis la chos bsdu bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One also said, Monks, the Dharma should be collected with 'Thus have I heard' and so on.

original: de bas na sdud par byed pa phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sdud par byed pa phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the compiler Vajrapāṇi said Thus have I heard and so on.

original: de yang ston pa po rang nyid mngon par @204b rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos rnams ston par mdzad la ston pa las thos nas sdud pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang ston pa po rang nyid mngon par @204b rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos rnams ston par mdzad la ston pa las thos nas sdud pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, after the teacher himself fully awakened, he taught the Dharma, and after hearing it from the teacher, it was collected.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdud pa por ston par byed de /
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdud pa por ston par byed de /
translated: Therefore, by this heard it shows the compiler.

original: thos pa yin gyi bdag gis mngon par rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ni shin tu dad par bya ba ma yin pa de bas na /🔽mngon sum du thos pa nyid ni bdag gis zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: thos pa yin gyi bdag gis mngon par rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ni shin tu dad par bya ba ma yin pa de bas na / mngon sum du thos pa nyid ni bdag gis zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning is: I have heard it, but I have not realized it myself.🔽The transmission of the hearing from one to another is not very credible, therefore, he says, I have heard it directly from the Master himself.

original: bdag nyid kyis ston pa po las de thos kyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ston pa po las de thos kyi /
translated: The meaning is: I have heard it directly from the Master himself, not from someone else,

original: gzhan gyis sam /
analyzed: gzhan gyis sam /
translated: or from someone else than him.

original: de las kyang gzhan pa las thos nas bdag ston pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽mngon sum du thos su zin kyang rnam pa thams cad dran pa med pa'am //
analyzed: de las kyang gzhan pa las thos nas bdag ston pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // mngon sum du thos su zin kyang rnam pa thams cad dran pa med pa'am //
translated: The meaning is: I am not a teacher who has heard it from someone else.

original: bsnan pa dang phri bas ni yang dag pa'i sdud pa por mi 'gyur ba de bas na yang dag pa nyid yin pa ni 'di skad ces bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bsnan pa dang phri bas ni yang dag pa'i sdud pa por mi 'gyur ba de bas na yang dag pa nyid yin pa ni 'di skad ces bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: Even if he has heard it directly, if he does not remember it in all its aspects, or if he has added or subtracted anything, he is not a true compiler, therefore, he says, I have heard it correctly.

original: yi ge dang tshig dang / ngag 'di dag nyid kyis gleng gzhi dang skabs la sogs pa'i rim pa'i rnam pa 'di nyid kyis bdag gis thos nas ji lta ba bzhin du bsdus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yi ge dang tshig dang / ngag 'di dag nyid kyis gleng gzhi dang skabs la sogs pa'i rim pa'i rnam pa 'di nyid kyis bdag gis thos nas ji lta ba bzhin du bsdus pa yin gyi /
translated: By these very letters, words, and phrases, in this very order of nidāna, avadāna, etc., I have heard and compiled just as it is.

original: gzhan du thos nas gzhan du bsdus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du thos nas gzhan du bsdus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: I have not heard elsewhere and compiled elsewhere.

original: brjed pa'am / bsnan pa la sogs pa'i bab col gyi skyon yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjed pa'am / bsnan pa la sogs pa'i bab col gyi skyon yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no fault of forgetfulness, addition, etc.

original: de ltar byas na 'di skad ces bya ba'i sgra nyid kyi gleng gzhi dang / skabs dang mdo nye bar bsdu ba la sogs pa'i dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'di skad ces bya ba'i sgra nyid kyi gleng gzhi dang / skabs dang mdo nye bar bsdu ba la sogs pa'i dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If it is done in this way, one should understand that the very words evam mayā śrutam, the nidāna, avadāna, etc., and the compilation of the sūtra, etc. are permitted by the Blessed One.

original: de bas na bstan pa dang mthun pa'i yul du bcom ldan 'das res 'ga' bzhugs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i 'khor 'dus pa la sogs pa ni gleng gzhi yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bstan pa dang mthun pa'i yul du bcom ldan 'das res 'ga' bzhugs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i 'khor 'dus pa la sogs pa ni gleng gzhi yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One sometimes resides in a place that accords with the teaching, and the assembly that gathers in accordance with that is the nidāna.

original: de ni dus gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni dus gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That is, at one time, etc.

original: dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das bzhugs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das bzhugs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should supply, “the Bhagavat was dwelling. ”

original: dus ni dus tshod do //
analyzed: dus ni dus tshod do //
translated: Time is the occasion.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la //
translated: Bhagavat means “possessing fortune. ”

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa drug ni skal ba ste /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa drug ni skal ba ste /
translated: The six perfections of lordship, etc., are fortune.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa ste //🔽drug po de la ldan zhes bya //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa ste // drug po de la ldan zhes bya //
translated: Lordship, good form, glory, fame, wisdom, and perfection of effort,

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: these six are called “possessions. ”

original: skal ba de 'di la mnga' bas na bcom ldan 'das @205a * //
analyzed: skal ba de 'di la mnga' bas na bcom ldan 'das @205a * //
translated: He is called “Bhagavat” because he possesses that fortune.

original: so ; /'di ltar dbang phyug nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: so ; /'di ltar dbang phyug nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, lordship is not being under the control of another.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: That is the perfection of the Bhagavat,

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has abandoned all obscurations together with their instincts.

original: shes bya thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du rtag tu thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mnga' bas na ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du rtag tu thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mnga' bas na ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with perfect knowledge, because he always possesses unobstructed knowledge of all knowable things in all modes.

original: yon tan thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa nyid kyis phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sgra rnam par grags pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa nyid kyis phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sgra rnam par grags pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with perfect fame, because he is the basis of all good qualities, and his fame is renowned in all directions.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'dod pa rnams kyis bstan par bya ba yin pas na dpal phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'dod pa rnams kyis bstan par bya ba yin pas na dpal phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with perfect glory, because he is the one to be taught by those who desire mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: dpe med pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyis brgyan pa'i sku mnga' bas na gzugs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpe med pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyis brgyan pa'i sku mnga' bas na gzugs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with a perfect body, because he possesses a body adorned with the major and minor marks that are without compare.

original: rnam pa thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don gyi bya ba la ldog pa mi mnga' bas na brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don gyi bya ba la ldog pa mi mnga' bas na brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with perfect effort, because he never turns back from the task of benefiting all sentient beings in every way.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das gang zhig yin zhe na //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das gang zhig yin zhe na //
translated: Here, who is the Lord?

original: dus der ston pa po bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i skur grags pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: dus der ston pa po bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i skur grags pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: At that time, the teacher was Vajradhara, who is renowned as the Bhagavat Shakyamuni.

original: bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gnas par mdzad do //
analyzed: bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gnas par mdzad do //
translated: Abiding means remaining.

original: bzhugs pa'i tshig ni mnyam par 'jog pa la yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i tshig ni mnyam par 'jog pa la yang 'jug ste /
translated: The word abiding also means to be in equipoise.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddha is always in equipoise.

original: de bas na 'di dang bcom ldan 'das sbyar na sangs rgyas kyi bzhugs pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na 'di dang bcom ldan 'das sbyar na sangs rgyas kyi bzhugs pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, when this is applied to the Bhagavat, it teaches the four types of abiding of a buddha.

original: lhag ma ni ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The rest is to be applied as appropriate.

original: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku'i phrin las gang ci yang rung ba de ni de rnams kyi spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku'i phrin las gang ci yang rung ba de ni de rnams kyi spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Among those, whatever physical activity of the buddhas is their abiding in conduct.

original: gsung gi phrin las gang ci yang rung ba de ni chos 'chad pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gi phrin las gang ci yang rung ba de ni chos 'chad pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Whatever verbal activity is their abiding in teaching the dharma.

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par mdzad pa dang / rang bzhin gyis mnyam par gzhag pa'i thugs kyi phrin las gang ci yang rung ba de ni ting nge 'dzin gyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par mdzad pa dang / rang bzhin gyis mnyam par gzhag pa'i thugs kyi phrin las gang ci yang rung ba de ni ting nge 'dzin gyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Whatever deeds of mind there are, whether of meditative concentration or natural meditative equipoise, those are the deeds of meditative concentration.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis sems can rnams la gzigs pa dang / lha rnams nye bar bsdu bar mdzad pa'i thugs kyi phrin las gang yin pa de ni nang du yang dag 'jog gis bzhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis sems can rnams la gzigs pa dang / lha rnams nye bar bsdu bar mdzad pa'i thugs kyi phrin las gang yin pa de ni nang du yang dag 'jog gis bzhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever deeds of mind there are, whether of looking at sentient beings with the eye of a buddha or of gathering the gods, those are the deeds of meditative equipoise.

original: gang na bzhugs she na /
analyzed: gang na bzhugs she na /
translated: Where does he dwell?

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi @205b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽chos rnams ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs shing mkhyen pa 'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi @205b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / chos rnams ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs shing mkhyen pa 'am /
translated: Therefore, it is said “in the hearts of all tathāgatas” and so on.🔽The tathāgatas are those who have realized and know things as they are,

original: de rnams de bzhin du ston par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams de bzhin du ston par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: or they are those who teach them as they are.

original: sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: The tathāgatas are the buddhas.

original: gshegs pa ni mkhyen pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ram //
analyzed: gshegs pa ni mkhyen pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ram //
translated: “Gśegs pa” means “to know.”

original: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis gta'i ltar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis gta'i ltar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is made in the manner of a definition.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs de rnams kyi snying po ni don dam pa stong pa nyid de //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs de rnams kyi snying po ni don dam pa stong pa nyid de //
translated: The essence of those bodies, speech, and minds of all the Tathagatas is ultimate emptiness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gru gsum nam mkha' lta bu ste //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gru gsum nam mkha' lta bu ste //
translated: For that very reason, it is a triangle like space.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: gru gsum du ni bsgom par bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gru gsum du ni bsgom par bya // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it should be meditated as a triangle.

original: rdo rje btsun mo ni rig pa bcu'o //
analyzed: rdo rje btsun mo ni rig pa bcu'o //
translated: The vajra queen is the ten knowledges.

original: de rnams kyi bha ga ni padma'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bha ga ni padma'o //
translated: Their bhaga is the lotus.

original: de nyid snying po yin gyi 'di dag bud med nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid snying po yin gyi 'di dag bud med nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: That itself is the essence, but they are not women.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: snying po de nyid nu ma dang bzhin ras la sogs pa'i yan lag gi bye brag gi sgo nas rab tu phye ba yin te /🔽gang zhig dngos med nyid shes rab //
analyzed: snying po de nyid nu ma dang bzhin ras la sogs pa'i yan lag gi bye brag gi sgo nas rab tu phye ba yin te / gang zhig dngos med nyid shes rab //
translated: That essence is distinguished by the specific parts of breasts, faces, and so on.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which knows non-entityness is wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang / thugs kyi snying po yang de yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang / thugs kyi snying po yang de yin la /
translated: It is the essence of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas,

original: rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga yang yin pas na de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga yang yin pas na de skad ces bya ste /
translated: and it is also the bhaga of the Vajra Queen.

original: chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “the seal of the source of phenomena.”

original: der bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa ni chos 'byung ba'i nang du chud pa'i gzhal yas khang du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: der bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa ni chos 'byung ba'i nang du chud pa'i gzhal yas khang du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The Bhagavat resides there, which means that he is in the celestial mansion contained within the source of phenomena.

original: dper na grong khyer na gnas pa'i phyug po bya ba ni grong khyer gyi nang du gtogs pa'i khang bzangs na zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: dper na grong khyer na gnas pa'i phyug po bya ba ni grong khyer gyi nang du gtogs pa'i khang bzangs na zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: For example, the phrase “the wealthy man who lives in the city” means that he is in the mansion that is contained within the city.

original: de ci'i phyir der bzhugs she na //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir der bzhugs she na //
translated: Why does he reside there?

original: gsang ba 'dus pa bshad par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir de'i skal ba dang ldan pa drang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa bshad par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir de'i skal ba dang ldan pa drang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach that he will explain the Guhyasamaja, in order to lead those who are suitable vessels for it.

original: gang dang thabs cig bzhugs she na //
analyzed: gang dang thabs cig bzhugs she na //
translated: With whom does he reside?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He mentions “the Bodhisattva, the great being.”

original: byang chub ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste //
analyzed: byang chub ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste //
translated: Enlightenment is unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: phul du byung bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phul du byung bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the realization of the highest.

original: sems dpa' ni bsam pa ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' ni bsam pa ste /
translated: Heroic mind is the intention.

original: de yang 'dir thob pa'i phyir mngon par sems pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dir thob pa'i phyir mngon par sems pa'o //
translated: And here it is the heroic mind that attains.

original: 'di rnams la byang chub sems dpa' yod pas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams la byang chub sems dpa' yod pas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: Because they have the heroic mind of enlightenment, they are called bodhisattvas.

original: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni 'di rnams la sems dpa' chen po yod pas na sems dpa' chen po ste /🔽sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das bzla ba'i bsam pa yod @206a * //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni 'di rnams la sems dpa' chen po yod pas na sems dpa' chen po ste / sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das bzla ba'i bsam pa yod @206a * //
translated: They are called great heroes because they have great heroic minds.

original: pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they have the intention to lead all sentient beings to nirvana.

original: bcas pa'i don gyi sbyor ba ni gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: bcas pa'i don gyi sbyor ba ni gsum pa yin te /
translated: The third is the application of the meaning of the compound.

original: de rnams dang thabs cig tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams dang thabs cig tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means together with them.

original: ji snyed cig dang zhe na /
analyzed: ji snyed cig dang zhe na /
translated: How many?

original: brjod kyis mi lang ba'i yang brjod kyis mi lang ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brjod kyis mi lang ba'i yang brjod kyis mi lang ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It says, “incalculable times an incalculable number.”

original: grangs kyi mtha' brjod kyis mi lang ba dang / de'i mtshan nyid can yang brjod kyis mi lang ba ste /
analyzed: grangs kyi mtha' brjod kyis mi lang ba dang / de'i mtshan nyid can yang brjod kyis mi lang ba ste /
translated: The limit of their number is inexpressible, and their characteristic is also inexpressible.

original: 'di dag tsam mo zhes bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di dag tsam mo zhes bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: They cannot be shown to be just this many.

original: gang dag brjod kyis mi lang ba de dag dang / brjod kyis mi lang ba'i grangs de dag 'di tsam yin no zhes bya bar brjod par yang mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang dag brjod kyis mi lang ba de dag dang / brjod kyis mi lang ba'i grangs de dag 'di tsam yin no zhes bya bar brjod par yang mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that those which are inexpressible cannot be said to be just this many, that number being inexpressible.

original: de ltar na grangs kyis bgrang du med pa de dag dpes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na grangs kyis bgrang du med pa de dag dpes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate those which cannot be counted by number with an example,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: he says, “The number of buddha-fields in the ten directions,” and so on.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ji snyed par dus gcig na sangs rgyas gcig nyid 'byung ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ji snyed par dus gcig na sangs rgyas gcig nyid 'byung ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing ste /
translated: A buddha-field is the world-realm in which a single buddha appears at one time.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: It is a trichiliocosm.

original: de yang gling bzhi pa dang / nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / ri rab dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten bye ba phrag brgya gang yin no //
analyzed: de yang gling bzhi pa dang / nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / ri rab dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten bye ba phrag brgya gang yin no //
translated: The universe of a single four-continent world, a sun and moon, Mount Meru, the gods of the realm of desire, and the Brahma world of a billion worlds.

original: de ltar na gling bzhi pa la sogs pa re re zhing stong gang yin pa de ni stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams so //🔽stong chung du stong ni /🔽stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: de ltar na gling bzhi pa la sogs pa re re zhing stong gang yin pa de ni stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams so // stong chung du stong ni / stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: Thus, each of the four continents, etc., is a world system of one chiliocosm.🔽A thousand of these is a dichiliocosm.

original: stong gnyis pa stong ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams te /
analyzed: stong gnyis pa stong ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams te /
translated: A thousand of these is a trichiliocosm.

original: mnyam du 'jig cing mnyam du chags so //
analyzed: mnyam du 'jig cing mnyam du chags so //
translated: They are destroyed and formed together.

original: de skad du yang /🔽gling bzhi pa dang nyi zla dang // ri rab dang ni 'dod lha dang // tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong la ni //
analyzed: de skad du yang / gling bzhi pa dang nyi zla dang // ri rab dang ni 'dod lha dang // tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong la ni //
translated: It is said:🔽The four continents, the sun and moon,

original: stong ni spyi phung yin par 'dod //🔽de stong la ni stong gnyis pa //
analyzed: stong ni spyi phung yin par 'dod // de stong la ni stong gnyis pa //
translated: Mount Meru, the gods of the realm of desire, and the Brahma world of a thousand worlds🔽are called a chiliocosm.🔽A thousand of these is a dichiliocosm.

original: bar ma'i 'jig rten khams yin no //
analyzed: bar ma'i 'jig rten khams yin no //
translated: A thousand of these is a trichiliocosm.

original: de stong la ni stong gsum ste //
analyzed: de stong la ni stong gsum ste //
translated: One thousand of those is a “small chiliocosm,”🔽and one thousand of those is a “second middling dichiliocosm.”🔽One thousand of those is a “great trichiliocosm.”

original: mnyam du 'jig cing chags pa yin //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mnyam du 'jig cing chags pa yin // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The “great trichiliocosm” is one hundred times the “great chiliocosm.”🔽The “great chiliocosm” is one hundred times the “middling dichiliocosm.”🔽The “middling dichiliocosm” is one hundred times the “small chiliocosm.”🔽The “small chiliocosm” is one hundred times the “world system of the four continents.”🔽The “world system of the four continents” is one hundred times the “world system of the three thousand continents.”🔽The “world system of the three thousand continents” is one hundred times the “world system of the one thousand continents.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi ri rab nyid bye ba brgya phrag gcig ste /🔽de rnams kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul de snyed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi ri rab nyid bye ba brgya phrag gcig ste / de rnams kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul de snyed de /
translated: The “world system of the one thousand continents” is one hundred times the “world system of the one continent.”🔽The “world system of the one continent” is one hundred times the “world system of the four continents.”🔽The “world system of the four continents” is one hundred times the “world system of the one continent.”

original: de dang grangs mtshungs pa'o //🔽khyad par med par bstan pa rnams kyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dang grangs mtshungs pa'o // khyad par med par bstan pa rnams kyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir / 'di lta ste /
translated: The “world system of the one continent” is one hundred times the “world system of the four continents.”🔽The “world system of the four continents” is one hundred times the “world system of the one continent.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dam tshig rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'dir skyes pa dang bud med kyi lha rnams ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dam tshig rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'dir skyes pa dang bud med kyi lha rnams ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin te /
translated: The “world system of the one continent” is one hundred times the “world system of the four continents.”🔽The “world system of the four continents” is one hundred times the “world system of the one continent.”

original: de bas na zhi gnas dang bcas @206b pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / de'i rnam pa can gyi yang dag pa'i ye shes ni lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na zhi gnas dang bcas @206b pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / de'i rnam pa can gyi yang dag pa'i ye shes ni lhag mthong ngo //
translated: The “world system of the one continent” is one hundred times the “world system of the four continents.”

original: de'i phyir theg pa chen po'i de kho na nyid ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa chen po'i de kho na nyid ni gnyis te /
translated: The “world system of the four continents” is one hundred times the “world system of the one continent.”

original: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Suchness and perfect pristine awareness.

original: de kho na nyid de ni mi zad pa'i rin po che yin pas na rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid de ni mi zad pa'i rin po che yin pas na rdo rje ste /
translated: That reality is a diamond, since it is an inexhaustible jewel.

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za ba'i mthar thug pa'i lha rnams ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za ba'i mthar thug pa'i lha rnams ni rdo rje'o //
translated: Therefore, the deities who are definitely the ultimate are diamonds.

original: 'di las thams cad thob par 'gyur bas na dam tshig go //
analyzed: 'di las thams cad thob par 'gyur bas na dam tshig go //
translated: Since everything is obtained from this, it is a commitment.

original: dam tshig kyang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas na dam tshig rdo rje ste kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: dam tshig kyang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas na dam tshig rdo rje ste kun du bzang po'o //
translated: Since it is both a commitment and a diamond, it is a commitment diamond, which is Samantabhadra.

original: sku ni gnas te sa nyid gnas yin pas na sku ste /
analyzed: sku ni gnas te sa nyid gnas yin pas na sku ste /
translated: The body is the abode, since it is the very abode of the earth.

original: sa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: sa'i snying po'o //
translated: The earth-womb is the body.

original: gsung ni chos rnams 'dzin pa'i phyir phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: gsung ni chos rnams 'dzin pa'i phyir phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: Speech is Vajrapani, since it holds the teachings.

original: thugs ni nam mkha'i snying po ste /
analyzed: thugs ni nam mkha'i snying po ste /
translated: The mind is Akashagarbha,

original: sems kyi rin po che mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rin po che mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: since he possesses the jewel of the mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni 'jig rten dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni 'jig rten dbang phyug ste /
translated: Concentration is Lokeśvara,

original: sems brtan par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems brtan par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since it stabilizes the mind.

original: sgrib pa las rgyal bar byed pas na rgyal ba ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa las rgyal bar byed pas na rgyal ba ste /
translated: Since it causes victory over obscurations, it is a victor.

original: sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'o //
translated: Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin.

original: sa la sogs pa dang / chos mthun pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa ni spyan dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma ste //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dang / chos mthun pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa ni spyan dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma ste //
translated: Earth and so forth are Pṛthivī, Māmakī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and Tārā, respectively, because they are similar to earth and so forth.

original: de dag gi go rims bzhin du sems tsam nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / gnyis zad par sdud pa'i phyir dang / mnyam pa nyid nyams su myong ba'i phyir dang / bsgom pas smin par byed pa'i phyir dang / thams cad du skyong bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi go rims bzhin du sems tsam nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / gnyis zad par sdud pa'i phyir dang / mnyam pa nyid nyams su myong ba'i phyir dang / bsgom pas smin par byed pa'i phyir dang / thams cad du skyong bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are, respectively, the holders of mind only, the gatherers of the two, the experiencers of sameness, the ripeners through meditation, and the protectors of all.

original: nam mkha' ni 'byung ba lnga pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni 'byung ba lnga pa'o //
translated: Space is the fifth element.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje 'chang ste /
translated: It is Vajradhara.

original: de yang dkyil 'khor pa'i lha skyes pa dang bud med kyi gzugs can rnams stong pa nyid kyi shes rab dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i rig pa dang / thabs dang ldan pa dag ste /
analyzed: de yang dkyil 'khor pa'i lha skyes pa dang bud med kyi gzugs can rnams stong pa nyid kyi shes rab dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i rig pa dang / thabs dang ldan pa dag ste /
translated: It is the deities of the maṇḍala, both male and female, who have the form of wisdom and gnosis of emptiness, innate awareness, and method.

original: lha re rer so sor nges par bstan pa ni sbyor ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: lha re rer so sor nges par bstan pa ni sbyor ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: The teaching of each deity individually is due to the particular application.

original: de dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag kyang /
translated: And they are

original: dam tshig rdo rje sogs drug dang // sa la sogs pa rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: dam tshig rdo rje sogs drug dang // sa la sogs pa rnam pa lnga //
translated: the six beginning with Samaya-vajra, and the five beginning with Earth.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa'o //🔽de bas na tshig bzhi po 'am /
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa'o // de bas na tshig bzhi po 'am /
translated: This is what is said.🔽Therefore, it is reasonable to say that the four wrathful ones are taught by the four lines

original: tshig gcig gis khro bo bzhi po dag kyang bstan to zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis khro bo bzhi po dag kyang bstan to zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: or by the one line.

original: de dag brtan pa nyid dang / bsam gtan dang / ri mo'i dkyil 'khor dag las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag brtan pa nyid dang / bsam gtan dang / ri mo'i dkyil 'khor dag las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are taught in the Sthira, the Dhyana, and the Citra-mandala.

original: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they have that nature.

original: dpe med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / gnas dang / mtha' yas pa'i longs spyod kyi gzugs la sogs pa de dag thams cad la gzugs la sogs pa'i sgrar 'dir bshad de /
analyzed: dpe med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / gnas dang / mtha' yas pa'i longs spyod kyi gzugs la sogs pa de dag thams cad la gzugs la sogs pa'i sgrar 'dir bshad de /
translated: The form of the incomparable Buddha-body, and the infinite enjoyments of form, etc., are all called form, etc. here.

original: de rnams kyang @207a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyang @207a * //
translated: And they are

original: mchod pa'i lha mo drug yin la /
analyzed: mchod pa'i lha mo drug yin la /
translated: the six offering goddesses.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i tshul du brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i tshul du brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are described here in the manner of Bodhisattvas,

original: lha mo rnams la yang skyes pa'i rtags kyis ming du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: lha mo rnams la yang skyes pa'i rtags kyis ming du byas pa yin no //
translated: The goddesses also have names that are masculine in form.

original: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “and so forth” in the root text refers to🔽the following.

original: 'di dag gtso bor gyur pa dang ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gtso bor gyur pa dang ste /
translated: They are the chief ones,

original: gtso bor gyur pa yang rtag tu nga'i dkyil 'khor la /
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa yang rtag tu nga'i dkyil 'khor la /
translated: and they are always the chief ones in my maṇḍala,

original: de dag dkyil 'khor pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dkyil 'khor pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the very ones who form the maṇḍala.

original: khro bo'i dkyil 'khor ni rtag tu ba ma yin te /
analyzed: khro bo'i dkyil 'khor ni rtag tu ba ma yin te /
translated: The wrathful maṇḍala is not always present,

original: srung ba'i don nam 'gog pa'i don du res 'ga' bsgom par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srung ba'i don nam 'gog pa'i don du res 'ga' bsgom par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be visualized only occasionally, either for the purpose of protection or for the purpose of restraint.

original: de bas na 'dir 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa drug ni ma gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa drug ni ma gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the six deities beginning with Kāmarāja are not mentioned here.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po la ni nges pa yod pa ma yin te /🔽res 'ga' ni gcig pu nyid dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po la ni nges pa yod pa ma yin te / res 'ga' ni gcig pu nyid dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo yin te /
translated: There is no fixed rule regarding the lord of the maṇḍala,🔽because sometimes the Blessed One himself is the sole lord of the maṇḍala,

original: de yang 'dir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: and this is the context here.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gdul bar bya ba yin pas gsang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gdul bar bya ba yin pas gsang ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas are not secret, because they are the ones to be trained.

original: de bas na thabs cig tu bzhugs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de bas na thabs cig tu bzhugs pa bstan nas /
translated: Therefore, having shown that they dwell together,🔽the Tathāgatas who are the subduers dwell together in the secret,

original: 'dul bar mdzad pa po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa ni gsang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dul bar mdzad pa po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa ni gsang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because of the fact that they are to be kept secret.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyis smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyis smos pa yin te /
translated: The Tathāgatas and so forth are mentioned later.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings dang mnyam par bshad cing bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings dang mnyam par bshad cing bstan pa ste /
translated: They are explained and taught as being equal to the realm of space.

original: de yongs su gang ba'i grangs rnyed dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yongs su gang ba'i grangs rnyed dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of their number is obtained is that they are completely filled.

original: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis g-yo bar mi nus pas na mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis g-yo bar mi nus pas na mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: Because they cannot be moved by afflictions and discursive thoughts, they are immovable,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are by nature the pristine wisdom of various kinds of purity.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku bsdus pas rnam par snang mdzad pa nyid kyis na rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku bsdus pas rnam par snang mdzad pa nyid kyis na rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Since they are the embodiment of the bodies of the Buddhas of the three times, they are Vairocana, the illuminator.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsang ba gsum mnyam pa'i sems bskyed pa'i rin po che ni /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsang ba gsum mnyam pa'i sems bskyed pa'i rin po che ni /
translated: The jewel of the generation of the mind of enlightenment, which is the equality of the three secrets of the Buddhas of the three times,

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
translated: is the intuition of equality.

original: de las don thams cad grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las don thams cad grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all goals are accomplished from that.

original: de nyid kyi tog gi mtshan nyid 'di la mnga' bas na rin po che dpal lo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tog gi mtshan nyid 'di la mnga' bas na rin po che dpal lo //
translated: Since he has the nature of the crest-jewel of that, he is the jewel glory.

original: rin po che las so sor rtog pa'i snang ba dpag tu med pa'i rgyur gyur pas na /
analyzed: rin po che las so sor rtog pa'i snang ba dpag tu med pa'i rgyur gyur pas na /
translated: Since the jewel is the cause of the infinite light of discernment,

original: 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: he is the infinite light.

original: 'od tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'od tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is “infinite light.”

original: sna tshogs pa'i don gyi las rnams don yod par mdzad pas na gdon mi za ba ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i don gyi las rnams don yod par mdzad pas na gdon mi za ba ste /
translated: Since he accomplishes the various meaningful actions without fail, he is the unfailing.

original: don yod @207b par grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don yod @207b par grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is “accomplisher of the unfailing.”

original: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gtso bor gyur pa dang ste /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gtso bor gyur pa dang ste /
translated: The phrase “and so forth” refers to those who are foremost among them,

original: lnga po nyid ni dkyil 'khor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga po nyid ni dkyil 'khor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the five are the circle of the mandala.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i dbyings dang mnyam pa nyid du rab tu ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i dbyings dang mnyam pa nyid du rab tu ston par byed do //
translated: “Thus” shows that they are equal to the realm of space.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni yongs su gsal bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni yongs su gsal bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “For example” means “in order to make it clear.”

original: til gyi gang bu zhes bya ba ni til 'bru'i gang bu ste /
analyzed: til gyi gang bu zhes bya ba ni til 'bru'i gang bu ste /
translated: “Sesame seed” means a sesame seed pod.

original: dper na de til rnams kyis shin tu bcer te yongs su gang ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du shin tu gang bar snang bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni kun nas snang bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dper na de til rnams kyis shin tu bcer te yongs su gang ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du shin tu gang bar snang bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni kun nas snang bar gyur pa ste /
translated: Just as it is completely filled with sesame seeds, in the same way, all the tathāgatas appear to completely fill the entire realm of space.

original: de bas na 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rtogs pa'i gdul bya rnams kyis mthong bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis nam mkha' bar mtshams med par gang na byang chub sems dpa' de snyed dam /
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rtogs pa'i gdul bya rnams kyis mthong bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to // gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis nam mkha' bar mtshams med par gang na byang chub sems dpa' de snyed dam /
translated: Thus, it is said that they appear to be completely present in all world systems, seen by those disciples who are ready to be trained.🔽If the tathāgatas completely fill the space without any gaps, where are the bodhisattvas and the sentient beings?

original: sems can rnams kyi go skabs ga la yod ;
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi go skabs ga la yod ;
translated: Where is the space for them?

original: gal te gang gis da ltar mthong ba 'am gang nas gang du 'ong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang gis da ltar mthong ba 'am gang nas gang du 'ong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “By whom is it seen now, or from where will it come?”

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyis dbang bsgyur ba'i mthu ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyis dbang bsgyur ba'i mthu ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin la /
translated: The power of mastery of those Buddhas and Bodhisattvas is inconceivable.

original: ston pa khyad par can du gyur pa yin pa gang gis na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mtha' yas pa dang / bdag nyid chos 'byung gi phyag rgya mtha' yas pa gcig gi nang du gdul bya 'god pa med pa nyid kyis yongs su gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir 'di la thos pa mang po dang ldan pa rnams la ngo mtshar du gyur pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: ston pa khyad par can du gyur pa yin pa gang gis na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mtha' yas pa dang / bdag nyid chos 'byung gi phyag rgya mtha' yas pa gcig gi nang du gdul bya 'god pa med pa nyid kyis yongs su gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir 'di la thos pa mang po dang ldan pa rnams la ngo mtshar du gyur pa ci yang med do //
translated: Since the Teacher is special, there is nothing at all that is amazing to those who have much learning, because they see with their own eyes the infinite Buddhas and Bodhisattvas and themselves in an infinite Dharma-source mandala, without the need to place disciples inside.

original: de ltar na de tsam nyid ni rgyud kyi gleng gzhi yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na de tsam nyid ni rgyud kyi gleng gzhi yin la /
translated: Thus, just that is the nidana of the tantra.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni rgyud kyi lus yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni rgyud kyi lus yin no //
translated: The other parts are the body of the tantra.

original: de la le'u dang po ni thabs las byung ba'i rgyud yin te /
analyzed: de la le'u dang po ni thabs las byung ba'i rgyud yin te /
translated: In that regard, the first chapter is the tantra that arises from method.

original: bcom ldan 'das thabs las byung ba'i mchog gsang ba 'dus pa ni des bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thabs las byung ba'i mchog gsang ba 'dus pa ni des bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Bhagavat's supreme secret, which arises from means, is the Guhyasamaja, because it is taught by him.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it will be explained:

original: dpal ldan sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i gnas //
analyzed: dpal ldan sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i gnas //
translated: The abode of the glorious one, the lord of all buddhas, the great vajra holder,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thabs byung ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thabs byung ba //
translated: arises from the means of all buddhas.

original: de nyid chos kyi chos nyid yin //🔽zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //🔽gnyis pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nyid chos kyi chos nyid yin // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro // gnyis pa nas brtsams te /
translated: That itself is the reality of the Dharma.

original: le'u bcu drug ni thabs kyi rgyud yin no //
analyzed: le'u bcu drug ni thabs kyi rgyud yin no //
translated: The second chapter up to the sixteenth chapter are the means tantra.

original: 'di ltar thabs ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar thabs ni bzhi ste /
translated: Thus, there are four means:

original: bsnyen pa dang / nye bar sgrub pa dang // @208a * //
analyzed: bsnyen pa dang / nye bar sgrub pa dang // @208a * //
translated: approach, near attainment,

original: sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa chen po'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa chen po'o //
translated: attainment, and great attainment.

original: de la dga' ba can gyi le'u bzhi ni sgrub pa chen po ste /
analyzed: de la dga' ba can gyi le'u bzhi ni sgrub pa chen po ste /
translated: Among them, the four chapters of the Joyful One are the great attainment,

original: de ston par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rdzogs ldan gyi le'u bzhi ni sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // rdzogs ldan gyi le'u bzhi ni sgrub pa yin no //
translated: because they are the teachers of that.🔽The four chapters of the Complete are the attainment.

original: gnyis ldan gyi le'u bzhi ni nye bar sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ldan gyi le'u bzhi ni nye bar sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The four chapters of the Two are the near attainment.

original: gsum ldan gyi le'u bzhi ni bsnyen pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum ldan gyi le'u bzhi ni bsnyen pa yin no //
translated: The four chapters that have the three are the approach.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: lnga pa dang ni dgu pa dang / bcu dang bdun dang bcu gsum pa //🔽sangs rgyas byang chub sems rnams kyis //
analyzed: lnga pa dang ni dgu pa dang / bcu dang bdun dang bcu gsum pa // sangs rgyas byang chub sems rnams kyis //
translated: The fifth, the ninth, the tenth, the seventh, and the thirteenth🔽Are the great accomplishments

original: bstan pa dag ni sgrub pa che //
analyzed: bstan pa dag ni sgrub pa che //
translated: Taught by the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: bzhi pa dang ni bcu drug pa //
analyzed: bzhi pa dang ni bcu drug pa //
translated: The fourth, the sixteenth,

original: brgyad pa de bzhin bcu gnyis pa //
analyzed: brgyad pa de bzhin bcu gnyis pa //
translated: The eighth, and likewise the twelfth

original: slob dpon spyi yi las dang ni //
analyzed: slob dpon spyi yi las dang ni //
translated: Are the general activities of the master

original: dngos grub brtul zhugs sdom pa yin //
analyzed: dngos grub brtul zhugs sdom pa yin //
translated: And the vows of the spiritual practice of spiritual powers.

original: drug pa dang ni gnyis pa dang // bcu pa dang ni bcu bzhi pa //
analyzed: drug pa dang ni gnyis pa dang // bcu pa dang ni bcu bzhi pa //
translated: The sixth, the second, the tenth, and the fourteenth🔽Are the vows of fierce activity, attachment,

original: drag spyod rjes su chags pa dang // nye bar sgrub pa sdom pa'o //
analyzed: drag spyod rjes su chags pa dang // nye bar sgrub pa sdom pa'o //
translated: And close practice.

original: bdun pa dang ni gsum pa dang // bcu dang gcig dang bcu dang lnga //🔽dngos grub zhing dang ltas dang ni //
analyzed: bdun pa dang ni gsum pa dang // bcu dang gcig dang bcu dang lnga // dngos grub zhing dang ltas dang ni //
translated: The seventh, the third, the tenth, the eleventh, and the fifteenth🔽Are the field of spiritual powers, the signs,

original: bsnyen pa sgrub pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa sgrub pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: And the vows of the approach and accomplishment.

original: zhes 'og nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'og nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is taught below by the transcendent lords.

original: 'dir sgrub pa che zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir sgrub pa che zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, “great practice” means “great practice” in meaning.

original: sgrub pa'i sdom pa'o zhes tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa'i mtha' mar gang gsungs pa de tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i mthar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i sdom pa'o zhes tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa'i mtha' mar gang gsungs pa de tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i mthar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The vow of practice, which is stated at the end of the fourth verse, should be seen at the end of the second verse.

original: bcu dang bdun zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bcu dang bdun zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: “Ten and seven” means the seventeenth.

original: drug ces bya ba ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: drug ces bya ba ni drug pa'o //
translated: “Six” means the sixth.

original: bcu dang gcig ces bya ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bcu dang gcig ces bya ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: “Ten and one” means the eleventh.

original: bcu dang lnga zhes bya ba ni bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bcu dang lnga zhes bya ba ni bco lnga pa'o //
translated: “Ten and five” means the fifteenth.

original: le'u bcu bdun po 'di dag ni rtsa ba'i rgyud du byang chub rdo rjes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: le'u bcu bdun po 'di dag ni rtsa ba'i rgyud du byang chub rdo rjes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: These seventeen chapters are stated in the Root Tantra by Bodhivajra.

original: le'u bco brgyad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa rgyud phyi ma yin te /
analyzed: le'u bco brgyad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa rgyud phyi ma yin te /
translated: The eighteenth chapter is stated by all the Tathagatas and is the continuation of the Tantra,

original: des rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi tshig don sbas pa gsal bar byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: des rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi tshig don sbas pa gsal bar byed pa nyid do //
translated: which clarifies the hidden meaning of the words of the Root Tantra.

original: de bas na 'dir le'u bzhi bzhis thabs re re nye bar sdud pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir le'u bzhi bzhis thabs re re nye bar sdud pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, here, each method is summarized in four chapters.

original: le'u bzhi tshan bzhis thabs bzhi dang / dang pos thabs las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: le'u bzhi tshan bzhis thabs bzhi dang / dang pos thabs las byung ba yin te /
translated: The four sets of four chapters are the four methods, and the first is the method of origination.

original: bcu bdun po 'di dag gis ni thabs dang thabs las byung ba dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: bcu bdun po 'di dag gis ni thabs dang thabs las byung ba dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: These seventeen chapters are the methods and the method of origination,

original: bco brgyad pas ni de nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bco brgyad pas ni de nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: and the eighteenth chapter elucidates them.

original: de ltar na le'u bco brgyad po dag gis thabs dang thabs las byung ba dang bcas pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang bcas pa bsdus pa yin pas na rgyud 'di le'u rnams @208b kyi 'brel ba dang bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na le'u bco brgyad po dag gis thabs dang thabs las byung ba dang bcas pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang bcas pa bsdus pa yin pas na rgyud 'di le'u rnams @208b kyi 'brel ba dang bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: Thus, since the eighteen chapters include the methods, the method of origination, and the elucidation, this tantra has the meaning of the connection and the summary of the chapters.

original: de la gtso bo yin pas le'u dang po'i brjod par bya ba ni thabs las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de la gtso bo yin pas le'u dang po'i brjod par bya ba ni thabs las byung ba yin la /
translated: Therein, since it is the principal one, the topic of the first chapter is the method of origination.

original: de'i zhar las byung ba sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa chen po yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i zhar las byung ba sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa chen po yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: And the means of accomplishment and the great means of accomplishment are taught as a consequence of that.

original: de ltar na 'dir bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba 'dus pa ni thabs las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba 'dus pa ni thabs las byung ba yin te /
translated: Thus, here the Bhagavān, the Guhyasamāja of all tathāgatas, is the method of origination.

original: sgrub pa de rnams dang / de dag gi gsang ba rnams ro gcig pa can du rang nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: sgrub pa de rnams dang / de dag gi gsang ba rnams ro gcig pa can du rang nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa yin la /
translated: One should understand that one has realized the great accomplishment, which is of one taste with those accomplishments and their secrets.

original: rang nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par rtogs nas sgrub pa chen po de dag rab tu rnam par phye ste gzhan dag la yang dag par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par rtogs nas sgrub pa chen po de dag rab tu rnam par phye ste gzhan dag la yang dag par ston pa yin no //
translated: Having realized that, one should teach it to others, having fully distinguished those great accomplishments.

original: de ltar na rang dang gzhan gyi dbye bas gsang ba 'dus pa 'di ni rnam pa gnyis yin pa de'i phyir med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pas na thabs las byung ba brjod par bya ba'i don du le'u dang por thabs gnyis po yang brjod par bya🔽ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rang dang gzhan gyi dbye bas gsang ba 'dus pa 'di ni rnam pa gnyis yin pa de'i phyir med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pas na thabs las byung ba brjod par bya ba'i don du le'u dang por thabs gnyis po yang brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, since this Guhyasamaja is twofold, divided into one's own and others' purposes, the two methods are mentioned in the first chapter as the topics to be expressed, since they are indispensable.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das ni gleng gzhi dang 'dra bar sgrub pa yang rang gi ngo bo nyid du ston par mdzad pa yin gyi tshig tu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das ni gleng gzhi dang 'dra bar sgrub pa yang rang gi ngo bo nyid du ston par mdzad pa yin gyi tshig tu ni ma yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat teaches the accomplishment, which is like the nidana, as his own nature, not in words.

original: sdud par byed pas kyang de bzhin du mthong zhing sngar ston pa'i byin gyi rlabs nyid kyis ji ltar snang ba'i tshig dang / yi ge 'di nyid kyis sdud par byed pa yin pa ni de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad chen po zhes bya ba nas zhal gsum pa lta bur de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gzigs par gyur to zhes bya🔽ba'i bar du rgyas par bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: sdud par byed pas kyang de bzhin du mthong zhing sngar ston pa'i byin gyi rlabs nyid kyis ji ltar snang ba'i tshig dang / yi ge 'di nyid kyis sdud par byed pa yin pa ni de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad chen po zhes bya ba nas zhal gsum pa lta bur de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gzigs par gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par bsdus pa yin no //
translated: From Then the Bhagavat, the Tathagata Great Vajra Vairocana up to the Tathagatas all saw him as if he had three faces, is the extensive compilation.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi phun sum tshogs pa'i de ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi phun sum tshogs pa'i de ma thag pa'o //
translated: Then means immediately after the perfect introduction.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni sh'akya thub pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje can no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni sh'akya thub pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje can no //
translated: Bhagavat means the Vajra possessor who has the nature of Shakyamuni.

original: de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ste rig pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ste rig pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Tathagatha means he who has realized suchness, meaning he is endowed with knowledge.

original: rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad chen po zhes bya ba la de nyid kyi tshe rang gi byang chub yang dag par ston par mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
