analyzed: rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad chen po zhes bya ba la de nyid kyi tshe rang gi byang chub yang dag par ston par mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The great Vajra Vairocana means that at that time, he is Vairocana because he reveals his own enlightenment.

original: rnam pa lnga dag gis de yang dag par ston par mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad chen po'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga dag gis de yang dag par ston par mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad chen po'o //
translated: He is the great Vairocana because he reveals that in five aspects.

original: de nyid kyis de 'di yang yin la rdo rje 'chang gi skur kun du ston par mdzad pas na rdo rje yang yin pa'i phyir rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad chen po ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis de 'di yang yin la rdo rje 'chang gi skur kun du ston par mdzad pas na rdo rje yang yin pa'i phyir rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad chen po ste /
translated: He is the great Vajra Vairocana because he is that and he is a vajra since he reveals the body of Vajradhara.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / dang po'i rdo rje dang / dang @209a * //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / dang po'i rdo rje dang / dang @209a * //
translated: The moon disc, the original vajra, and the vajra-palm gesture are the three aspects of his body.

original: po'i snying po dang / de'i 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / sngags kyi skur rab tu sbyor ba zhes bya ba rnam pa lngas zhal gsum dang phyag drug pa'i dpal mchog dang po'i sku thugs kar zla ba dang rdo rje dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyis byin gyis brlab pa'i tshul du byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: po'i snying po dang / de'i 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / sngags kyi skur rab tu sbyor ba zhes bya ba rnam pa lngas zhal gsum dang phyag drug pa'i dpal mchog dang po'i sku thugs kar zla ba dang rdo rje dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyis byin gyis brlab pa'i tshul du byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i don
translated: The meaning is that the body of glorious original exalted body with three faces and six arms arises in the manner of blessing the reality of the mantra at the heart, with the moon, vajra, and mantra, by means of the five topics: the essence of the mantra, the light rays of the mantra, the summoning of all the transcendent ones, the entry of all the transcendent ones, and the application of all the transcendent ones to the mantra body.

original: to // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags chen po ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho gas thams cad zhu bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: to // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags chen po ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho gas thams cad zhu bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The great passion of all transcendent ones is the melting of all the transcendent ones by the ritual that will be explained below.

original: tshul ni de'i thabs te dpal mchog dang po rang gi gnyug ma'i rig ma dang sbyor bar ldan pa'i snying ga'i sngags kyi 'od zer gyi sgo las phyogs bcur khyab pa'i sngags kyis lha thams cad spro ba'o //
analyzed: tshul ni de'i thabs te dpal mchog dang po rang gi gnyug ma'i rig ma dang sbyor bar ldan pa'i snying ga'i sngags kyi 'od zer gyi sgo las phyogs bcur khyab pa'i sngags kyis lha thams cad spro ba'o //
translated: The method is the means for that, which is the emanation of all the deities by the mantra that pervades the ten directions from the door of the light rays of the mantra at the heart, endowed with the union of glorious original exalted body with one’s innate knowledge consort.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rab tu gsal ba yin te ming 'di nyid du rab tu grags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rab tu gsal ba yin te ming 'di nyid du rab tu grags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “also” is very clear, meaning that this very name is well known.

original: ting nge 'dzin la zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa ste sems nang du 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa ste sems nang du 'jog pa'o //
translated: “ In samādhi” means in equipoise, placing the mind inwardly.

original: snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du mdzad nas so //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du mdzad nas so //
translated: “ Having entered” means having actualized.

original: bkod pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs so //
analyzed: bkod pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs so //
translated: “ Array” means collection.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni phyogs bcur son pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni phyogs bcur son pa rnams so //
translated: “ Them” means those in the ten directions.

original: zhugs par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas lnga'i sku rang gi sku la sogs pa la bsdus nas de'i sku la sogs pa dang dbyer mi phyed par 'jog par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhugs par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas lnga'i sku rang gi sku la sogs pa la bsdus nas de'i sku la sogs pa dang dbyer mi phyed par 'jog par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ He causes them to enter” means that having gathered the bodies of the five buddhas into his own body and so on, he places them inseparably from his own body and so on.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i bdag po yin te de la zhugs pas de bdag por gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i bdag po yin te de la zhugs pas de bdag por gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the lord of the vajra body and so on, because having entered him, they become his property.

original: yongs su mnyes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rig pa thams cad la nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: yongs su mnyes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rig pa thams cad la nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir ro /
translated: In order to please them means in order to enjoy all the knowledge.

original: nyid kyi sku zhes pa ni rang nyid kyi sku'i khyad par ro //🔽mngon par sprul nas te phyung nas so //
analyzed: nyid kyi sku zhes pa ni rang nyid kyi sku'i khyad par ro // mngon par sprul nas te phyung nas so //
translated: One's own body means the special nature of one's own body.🔽Having manifested means having brought forth.

original: mngon par byung bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid 'thon par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byung bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid 'thon par gyur pa'o //
translated: Having emerged means having come forth from them.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis bkar ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis bkar ba'o //
translated: There means by implication.

original: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad de de'i spyan yin gyi nam mkha'i spyan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad de de'i spyan yin gyi nam mkha'i spyan ni ma yin no //
translated: Buddha means Vairocana, whose eye it is, not the eye of space.

original: dam tshig ni don yod bar grub pa ste de'i sgrol ma yin gyi padma'i sgrol ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dam tshig ni don yod bar grub pa ste de'i sgrol ma yin gyi padma'i sgrol ma ni ma yin no //
translated: Commitment means Amoghasiddhi, whose Tara it is, not the lotus Tara.

original: kun du gnas par gyur pa ni yang dag par gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun du gnas par gyur pa ni yang dag par gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: Abiding means dwelling.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: der zhes bya ba gsungs te rdo rje 'chang de'i rig pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba gsungs te rdo rje 'chang de'i rig pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There means in the knowledge of that Vajradhara, is the meaning.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid de kho @209b na nyid ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid de kho @209b na nyid ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reality of form and so on is the vajra of form and so on.

original: ci'i phyir dgu po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dgu po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Why are there just nine?

original: 'di ltar bcu'i nang du bsdu bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcu'i nang du bsdu bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Because they are included within the ten.🔽The wheel of wisdom is included

original: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul nyid kyis //🔽ye shes 'khor lo can rnams bsdu //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul nyid kyis // ye shes 'khor lo can rnams bsdu //
translated: by the method of great passion.

original: lha mo dgu ni spros nas su //
analyzed: lha mo dgu ni spros nas su //
translated: The nine goddesses are emanated

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i lus la dgod //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i lus la dgod //
translated: and placed in the body of the one to be accomplished.

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: rig bya dang rig pa gnyis su med par byas pa'i phyir de nyid ni bcom ldan mi bskyod pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rig bya dang rig pa gnyis su med par byas pa'i phyir de nyid ni bcom ldan mi bskyod pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Because the object of knowledge and the knower are made nondual, that is the Bhagavān Akṣhobhya.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs de rnams kyi snying po yang yin zhing rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga yang yin no zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs de rnams kyi snying po yang yin zhing rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga yang yin no zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o //
translated: The essence of all the bodies, speech, and minds of the tathāgatas is also the bhaga of the vajra queen.

original: rdo rje btsun mo ni rig pa bcu'o //
analyzed: rdo rje btsun mo ni rig pa bcu'o //
translated: The vajra queen is the ten awarenesses.

original: de rnams kyi bha ga ni ro gcig par gyur pa rnams kyi ro gcig par gyur pa'i padma ste de dag gi de'i lte ba'i dbus na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bha ga ni ro gcig par gyur pa rnams kyi ro gcig par gyur pa'i padma ste de dag gi de'i lte ba'i dbus na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Their bhaga is the lotus of those who have become of one taste, which is to say, the one taste of those who have become of one taste. The meaning is that it is in the center of the hub of that.

original: dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la aa ya ni yang dag par rtogs pa ste ye shes sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la aa ya ni yang dag par rtogs pa ste ye shes sems dpa'o //
translated: The maṇḍala of the great commitment is as follows: āya means realization, which is the gnosis being.

original: sa ma ni bskyed par bya ba don du mtshungs par byon pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sa ma ni bskyed par bya ba don du mtshungs par byon pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Sama means that which is generated, which is to say, that which has come for the sake of the same purpose.

original: byang chub sems dpar bya ba'i phyir gang zhig byon pa de dam tshig chen po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar bya ba'i phyir gang zhig byon pa de dam tshig chen po'o //
translated: That which has come for the sake of generating the bodhicitta is the great commitment.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor ni gzhal yas khang ngo //
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor ni gzhal yas khang ngo //
translated: Its maṇḍala is the immeasurable mansion.

original: rdul med pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rdul med pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without dust, which is to say, without outflows.

original: gru bzhi zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi rim pa ste /
analyzed: gru bzhi zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi rim pa ste /
translated: It has four corners, which is to say, the outer perimeter.

original: nang gi rim pa ni zlum po nyid yin no //
analyzed: nang gi rim pa ni zlum po nyid yin no //
translated: The inner perimeter is circular.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni lha mo bzhi yongs su gyur pa las sprul pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni lha mo bzhi yongs su gyur pa las sprul pa'o //
translated: The consecration is the emanation from the complete transformation of the four goddesses.

original: gsal ba ni dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ni dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is clear, which is to say, stainless.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni dam tshig chen po'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni dam tshig chen po'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Its own nature is the nature of the Great Commitment.

original: sna tshogs gzugs kyis zhes bya ba ni sgo dang rta babs dang kha khyer gyi lha mo rnams dang ka ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs can no //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs kyis zhes bya ba ni sgo dang rta babs dang kha khyer gyi lha mo rnams dang ka ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs can no //
translated: With various forms is the goddesses of the doors, archways, and ledges, and the various forms of the pillars, etc.

original: sangs rgyas sprin te 'phro bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sprin te 'phro bas so //
translated: The cloud of Buddhas is the emanation.

original: kun du khyab pa ni sna tshogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun du khyab pa ni sna tshogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The pervasiveness is the variety.

original: 'od zer 'phro ba mang po ni 'od zer gyi dra ba ste mgyogs pa'i shugs kyis kun du khyab pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer 'phro ba mang po ni 'od zer gyi dra ba ste mgyogs pa'i shugs kyis kun du khyab pa'o //
translated: The many emanations of light is the net of light rays, which pervades everywhere with the speed of the wind.

original: des kun du 'khrugs pa ni khyab pa'o //
analyzed: des kun du 'khrugs pa ni khyab pa'o //
translated: The turbulence is the pervasion.

original: gsal ba la sogs dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni zla ba lnga dang zla ba dang nyi ma'o //
analyzed: gsal ba la sogs dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni zla ba lnga dang zla ba dang nyi ma'o //
translated: The mandala of the bright ones, etc., is the five moons, the moon, and the sun.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po ste de'i'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po ste de'i'o //
translated: The of all the Tathagatas is of the Great Vajradhara.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yin zhe na de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa ste gnas ni thar ba'i grong khyer yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin @210a * //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yin zhe na de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa ste gnas ni thar ba'i grong khyer yin pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin @210a * //
translated: How is it of all the Tathagatas? It is their nature, because the place is the city of liberation.🔽The great mandala of all the Tathagatas.

original: gshegs pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor chen po zhes bya ba la de bzhin ni rang gi lha ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gshegs pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor chen po zhes bya ba la de bzhin ni rang gi lha ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Tathagatas are as their own deities.

original: aa ga ta ni byon pa'o //
analyzed: aa ga ta ni byon pa'o //
translated: Agatas are those who have come.🔽All are the aspects, the groups, and the retinues, and they are as their own deities.

original: thams cad ni rnam pa dang tshogs dang 'khor rnams te de rnams rang gi lha ji lta ba bzhin du byon pa 'di la yod pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig chen po'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la /
analyzed: thams cad ni rnam pa dang tshogs dang 'khor rnams te de rnams rang gi lha ji lta ba bzhin du byon pa 'di la yod pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig chen po'o // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la /
translated: All the Tathagatas are also the great commitments.🔽The mandala of all the Tathagatas is also the great commitment.

original: dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor yang yin te de dang lhan cig tu 'ongs pa'i rigs lnga'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor yang yin te de dang lhan cig tu 'ongs pa'i rigs lnga'o //
translated: The five families who have come together with that,

original: mchog tu bsdus pa las byung ba'i lha lnga ste /
analyzed: mchog tu bsdus pa las byung ba'i lha lnga ste /
translated: the five deities who have arisen from the supreme gathering,

original: de gnyi ga dbus su zhes bya ba nang gi rim par bkod pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga dbus su zhes bya ba nang gi rim par bkod pa'o //
translated: both of those in the center, arranged in the inner circle.

original: 'dir rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed pa la ni de'i ye shes sems dpa' bkug ste /
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed pa la ni de'i ye shes sems dpa' bkug ste /
translated: Here, in the generation of Vajrasattva, the gnosis being is summoned and🔽placed on the moon seat in the center.

original: dbus kyi zla ba'i gdan la bkod pa de'i dkyil 'khor chen po pa rnams lha mo lngar bsdus te /
analyzed: dbus kyi zla ba'i gdan la bkod pa de'i dkyil 'khor chen po pa rnams lha mo lngar bsdus te /
translated: The great mandala is condensed into the five goddesses.

original: gos dkar mo gnyis gcig tu byas pas dga' ma bzhir byas te ngos bzhi'i zla ba la dgod do ;
analyzed: gos dkar mo gnyis gcig tu byas pas dga' ma bzhir byas te ngos bzhi'i zla ba la dgod do ;
translated: The two Pandaravasini goddesses are made into one, making four goddesses, which are placed on the moon seats in the four directions.

original: / gzhan rnams la yang ye shes sems dpa' dbus su bkod la dkyil 'khor chen po rgyal ba lngar bsdus la /
analyzed: / gzhan rnams la yang ye shes sems dpa' dbus su bkod la dkyil 'khor chen po rgyal ba lngar bsdus la /
translated: In the other mandalas, the gnosis being is placed in the center, and the great mandala is condensed into the five conquerors.

original: de nas gcig ni 'khor lo'i bdag po la bstims la bzhi ni ngos bzhi'i so so'i gdan la dgod do //
analyzed: de nas gcig ni 'khor lo'i bdag po la bstims la bzhi ni ngos bzhi'i so so'i gdan la dgod do //
translated: Then one is dissolved into the lord of the mandala, and the four goddesses are placed on their individual seats in the four directions.

original: phyag rgya bzhi yis yongs bskor ba //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi yis yongs bskor ba //
translated: The mandala is surrounded by the four seals.

original: dkyil 'khor der ni brtag par bya //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor der ni brtag par bya //
translated: The mandala should be visualized there.

original: bdag nyid dbus su gnas byas la //
analyzed: bdag nyid dbus su gnas byas la //
translated: Having placed oneself in the center,

original: 'khor lo can kun bsdu bar bya //
analyzed: 'khor lo can kun bsdu bar bya //
translated: all the wheel possessors are gathered.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in the tantra.

original: de bas na ye shes sems dpa' de la byang chub kyi sems rnam pa lngas dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ye shes sems dpa' de la byang chub kyi sems rnam pa lngas dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the consecration of the five aspects of the Thought of Enlightenment should be given to that Knowledge Being.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir bcom ldan 'das ni byang chub kyi sems ston par mdzad pa nyid yin pas na byang chub kyi sems rdo rje zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir bcom ldan 'das ni byang chub kyi sems ston par mdzad pa nyid yin pas na byang chub kyi sems rdo rje zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, here the Lord is the one who teaches the Thought of Enlightenment, and so he is called the Vajra of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po thugs la zhugs pa 'di yang byang chub kyi sems zhi ba yin te nang du chud pa nyid kyis phyi'i don stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po thugs la zhugs pa 'di yang byang chub kyi sems zhi ba yin te nang du chud pa nyid kyis phyi'i don stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, etc. This entry of the five Tathagatas into the mind is also the peaceful Thought of Enlightenment, because it is the emptiness of external objects by its very internalization.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zil gyis mnan pa ni zhu ba'i tshul gyis ro gcig par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zil gyis mnan pa ni zhu ba'i tshul gyis ro gcig par gyur pa ste /
translated: The subjugation of all Tathagatas is the oneness of the Tathagatas by the method of melting.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'di ni dngos dang dngos med zad pa po de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'di ni dngos dang dngos med zad pa po de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This Thought of Enlightenment is the exhaustion of entity and non-entity, and the samadhi which has that as its object is called that.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje ste mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje ste mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the vajra, because it is indivisible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams @210b cad ni dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa'i ye shes sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams @210b cad ni dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa'i ye shes sems dpa'o //
translated: All the Tathagatas are the gnosis beings together with their maṇḍalas.

original: de'i bdag po ni nor bu'i bum pas dbang bskur bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag po ni nor bu'i bum pas dbang bskur bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Their lord is the one who consecrates with the jewel vase.

original: gang la snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa'i nges par 'byung ba ni snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu zhes bya ste de lta bur gyur ma thag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa'i nges par 'byung ba ni snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu zhes bya ste de lta bur gyur ma thag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The emergence in the second moment of meditative equipoise is called “immediately upon meditative equipoise,” meaning “immediately upon becoming such.”

original: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad ni padma thams cad do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad ni padma thams cad do //
translated: The entire realm of space is all the lotuses.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ni sku gsum mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ni sku gsum mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: The vajra of all the Tathāgatas is the sameness of the three bodies.

original: de nyid ston ka'i zla ba ltar dkar ba zhu bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston ka'i zla ba ltar dkar ba zhu bar gyur pa'o //
translated: That itself is melted, becoming white like the autumn moon.

original: de'i ngo bo ni des yongs su gang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni des yongs su gang ba'o //
translated: Its nature is completely filled with that.

original: gnas par gyur pa ni rnam par gnas pa ste de ltar na dbang bskur ba dang po'o //
analyzed: gnas par gyur pa ni rnam par gnas pa ste de ltar na dbang bskur ba dang po'o //
translated: The state of abiding is the state of remaining, and thus it is the first consecration.

original: nam mkha' thams cad ni padma de dag nyid thams cad do //
analyzed: nam mkha' thams cad ni padma de dag nyid thams cad do //
translated: The entire space is all those lotuses.

original: de'i dbyings ni zhu ba de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dbyings ni zhu ba de nyid do //
translated: Its realm is that very melting.

original: de gnas pa ni kun nas gnas pa ste de dag nang du yang zhugs pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gnas pa ni kun nas gnas pa ste de dag nang du yang zhugs pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Its abiding is the abiding of all, because they enter into it.

original: sems can thams cad ces bya ba ni rang dang bdag po'o ;
analyzed: sems can thams cad ces bya ba ni rang dang bdag po'o ;
translated: All sentient beings means oneself and others.

original: / de ltar na dbang bskur ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: / de ltar na dbang bskur ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Thus, the consecration is the second.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bde ba dang yid bde ba ni go rims bzhin du lus kyi dang sems kyi tshor ba bde ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bde ba dang yid bde ba ni go rims bzhin du lus kyi dang sems kyi tshor ba bde ba'o //
translated: The bliss and mental joy of all the Tathagatas is the physical and mental feelings of bliss, respectively.

original: de thob pa ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de thob pa ni rnyed pa'o //
translated: The attainment of that is the acquisition.

original: gyur to zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa ste rang gi lus zhu ba las byung ba'i 'od kyis de rnams kyang zhu bar gyur pa 'di ni dbang bskur ba gsum pa ste /
analyzed: gyur to zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa ste rang gi lus zhu ba las byung ba'i 'od kyis de rnams kyang zhu bar gyur pa 'di ni dbang bskur ba gsum pa ste /
translated: The transformation is the completion. The light that arises from the melting of one's body causes their melting as well. This is the third consecration.

original: zhu ba ni shes rab yin pa de nyams su myong zhing rnyed pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: zhu ba ni shes rab yin pa de nyams su myong zhing rnyed pa ni ye shes so //
translated: The melting is the experience of the wisdom, and the acquisition is the intuition.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i don gyi gsum pa ste de rnams kyis de thob par gyur pas rdo rje sems dpa' byin gyis brlabs pa ste lhan cig tu gyur pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i don gyi gsum pa ste de rnams kyis de thob par gyur pas rdo rje sems dpa' byin gyis brlabs pa ste lhan cig tu gyur pa'i don to //
translated: The third case is the blessing of Vajrasattva, which means that they attained that state by the blessing of Vajrasattva, that is, they became one with him.

original: rdo rje dang rdo rje sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste der byin gyis brlabs pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje dang rdo rje sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste der byin gyis brlabs pas so //
translated: Vajra and Vajrasattva are Vajrasattva, and he was blessed there.

original: de la rdo rje dang rdo rje ni ma dang pha ste byin gyis brlabs pa ni de dag zhu ba'i 'od kyis rdo rje dag kyang zhu bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la rdo rje dang rdo rje ni ma dang pha ste byin gyis brlabs pa ni de dag zhu ba'i 'od kyis rdo rje dag kyang zhu bar gyur pa'o //
translated: There, the vajra and the vajra are the father and mother, and the blessing is that they melt by the light of their melting.

original: sems dpa' byin gyis brlabs pa ni zhu ba'i 'od spros pas sems can thams cad la dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' byin gyis brlabs pa ni zhu ba'i 'od spros pas sems can thams cad la dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The blessing of the sattva is that all sentient beings are consecrated by the light of the melting.

original: de la bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams bsdus pa las gyur pa'i zhu ba ni gtso bo'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: de la bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams bsdus pa las gyur pa'i zhu ba ni gtso bo'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: There, the melting of the deities with their lords is the principal bodhicitta.

original: chos thams cad sdud par byed pa'i yab yum zhu bar gyur pa ni stong pa @211a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad sdud par byed pa'i yab yum zhu bar gyur pa ni stong pa @211a * //
translated: The melting of the father and mother who gather all phenomena is the emptiness of the moon.

original: nyid dang dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: nyid dang dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: It is the awakening mind inseparable from the nature of the deity.

original: sems rnams dbang bskur ba ni snying rje dbyer med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: sems rnams dbang bskur ba ni snying rje dbyer med pa'i sems so //
translated: The consecration of the mind is the mind inseparable from compassion.

original: de ltar na chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i rang bzhin du rnam pa lnga'i rang bzhin du gnas pas sgrib pa dag cing nam mkha' lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems chen po dbus ma'i gdan la gnas par bsams
analyzed: de ltar na chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i rang bzhin du rnam pa lnga'i rang bzhin du gnas pas sgrib pa dag cing nam mkha' lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems chen po dbus ma'i gdan la gnas par bsams
translated: Thus, since it is the nature of the realm of phenomena, it is the great space-like awakening mind, which is pure of obscurations and abides in the center seat with the nature of the five aspects.

original: la de la byang chub tu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: la de la byang chub tu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on awakening in that.🔽And it is explained:

original: de yang / thams cad rdo rje'i dngos byas la //
analyzed: de yang / thams cad rdo rje'i dngos byas la //
translated: Having made everything into the substance of vajra,

original: de 'og byang chub bsgom par bya'o //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'og byang chub bsgom par bya'o // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: one should meditate on awakening.

original: ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one meditate?

original: lha mo bzhis glu bzhis bskul ba'i rjes thogs la zhub bsdus pa las byung ba rang gi gdan la gnas pa'i rang gi lha'i sa bon las de'i mtshan ma rnam par bsgom la de'i lte bar sa bon de nyid phra mo nor bu'i snying po'i thig le dang
analyzed: lha mo bzhis glu bzhis bskul ba'i rjes thogs la zhub bsdus pa las byung ba rang gi gdan la gnas pa'i rang gi lha'i sa bon las de'i mtshan ma rnam par bsgom la de'i lte bar sa bon de nyid phra mo nor bu'i snying po'i thig le dang
translated: In the center of that, one should imagine that very seed syllable endowed with a subtle drop in the heart of a jewel.

original: ldan pa bsams te nor bu de nyid las dkyil 'khor pa'i sprin thams cad kun du spros la /
analyzed: ldan pa bsams te nor bu de nyid las dkyil 'khor pa'i sprin thams cad kun du spros la /
translated: From that very jewel, one should emanate the entire cloud of the maṇḍala.

original: de rnams zla ba dang rdo rje dang sngags la yang dag par bsdus te yongs su gyur pa las rang gi lha'i gzugs su bsgom pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams zla ba dang rdo rje dang sngags la yang dag par bsdus te yongs su gyur pa las rang gi lha'i gzugs su bsgom pa nyid do //
translated: Those [emanations] are completely gathered into the moon, vajra, and mantra, and one should meditate on the transformation into the form of one's deity.

original: 'di dag nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach precisely these, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then,” and so on.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni lha mo bzhis bskul ba'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni lha mo bzhis bskul ba'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: “ Then” means immediately after the four goddesses' urging.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Tathāgata is so called because he has realized the suchness free from obscurations.

original: byang chub kyi sems rdo rje zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa dang bral zhing dag pa nam mkha'i dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rdo rje zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa dang bral zhing dag pa nam mkha'i dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The so-called vajra of the spirit of enlightenment is the nature of the realm of space, which is pure and free from obscurations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje ni byang chub kyi sems de nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje ni byang chub kyi sems de nyid do //
translated: The vajra of the body, speech, and mind of all Ones-Gone-Thus is just that spirit of enlightenment.

original: de'i dam tshig ni bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni bsdus pa'o //
translated: Its commitment is its collection.

original: de'i 'byung ba ni rang gi gdan la gnas pa'i sa bon te 'di las byung bas na zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'byung ba ni rang gi gdan la gnas pa'i sa bon te 'di las byung bas na zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its emergence is the seed that abides in its own seat, because it is taken as the source of this.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The meditative stabilization that focuses on that is called that.

original: rig pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rig pa'i skyes bu'i gzugs kyang de yin la bla na med pa nyid kyi phyir chen po yang yin pas na'o //
analyzed: rig pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rig pa'i skyes bu'i gzugs kyang de yin la bla na med pa nyid kyi phyir chen po yang yin pas na'o //
translated: It is the form of the person endowed with awareness, and it is great because it is unsurpassed.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni dam tshig chen po'i gzugs can te sku gnyis ka yang zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa snyoms par 'jug pa rang gi lha'i gzugs @211b can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni dam tshig chen po'i gzugs can te sku gnyis ka yang zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa snyoms par 'jug pa rang gi lha'i gzugs @211b can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase this means the form of the Great Commitment, and the meaning of the phrase the two Bodies, each with three faces and six arms, in union, in the form of one's own deity is that.

original: chen po nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngags kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba gsungs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngags ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de mi bskyod pa la sogs pa nas bgegs mthar byed kyi bar
analyzed: chen po nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngags kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba gsungs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngags ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de mi bskyod pa la sogs pa nas bgegs mthar byed kyi bar
translated: The phrase by the blessing of the mantras of all Tathagatas means that the Great One is the basis of the blessing of all the mantras of all the Tathagatas, and the meaning of the phrase the mantras of all Tathagatas is that all the Buddha natures, from Akshobhya up to Vighnantakrt,

original: du'o // de rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs ni rten yin te de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang de skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du'o // de rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs ni rten yin te de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang de skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are the blessing, the basis, because they are the nature of that, and because they are the producers of that.🔽The phrase blessed means emanated, and the meaning of the phrase the four songs of the goddesses' exhortations to the essence is that the four goddesses, Lochana and so on, exhort the essence, the Great Hero, with four songs.

original: byin gyis brlabs so zhes bya ba ni sprul par gyur pa ste lha mo rnams kyis bskul ba'i glu bzhis snying po bskul ba dang / dus gsum rdo rje'i rang bzhin sems //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs so zhes bya ba ni sprul par gyur pa ste lha mo rnams kyis bskul ba'i glu bzhis snying po bskul ba dang / dus gsum rdo rje'i rang bzhin sems //
translated: The phrase the mind, the nature of the three vajras of the three times means that the mind is the nature of the three vajras of the three times.

original: ye shes bzhin du lus bsgom mo //
analyzed: ye shes bzhin du lus bsgom mo //
translated: One should meditate on the body as if it were gnosis.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: zhal gsum pa ni skabs su bab pa'i byang chub chen po'i phyag rgyar gyur pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: zhal gsum pa ni skabs su bab pa'i byang chub chen po'i phyag rgyar gyur pa'i sku'o //
translated: The three faces are the body that is the seal of the great enlightenment that is the present occasion.

original: lta bur ni de ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: lta bur ni de ltar snang ba'o //
translated: Like that is the appearance.

original: de gzigs par gyur pa ste nges par dngos po thams cad du snang bar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de gzigs par gyur pa ste nges par dngos po thams cad du snang bar ni ma yin te /
translated: That is seen, but not all things are seen,

original: sangs rgyas ma yin pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ma yin pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the domain of those who are not Buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni 'khor gyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni 'khor gyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so //
translated: All the Tathagatas, means the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas of the retinue.

original: ci'i phyir spyod yul ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir spyod yul ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the domain?

original: 'di ltar dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i sku ni byang chub chen po yin la de yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i sku ni byang chub chen po yin la de yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin te /
translated: In this way, the body of the Lord of the Mandala is the great enlightenment, and that is the essential body of the Buddhas.

original: de ni mchog tu ngo mtshar du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ro gcig par gyur pa'i tshogs chen po bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad las nges par grol ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni mchog tu ngo mtshar du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ro gcig par gyur pa'i tshogs chen po bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad las nges par grol ba yin te /
translated: It is the great assembly of the most wondrous qualities of the Buddha, which are of one taste, definitely liberated from all obscurations together with their habitual tendencies.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dpal rdo rje rtse mo las /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje rtse mo las /
translated: In the glorious Vajra Peak Tantra:

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje can rnams ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje can rnams ni //
translated: The Buddhas, the Vajra Holders,

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sku yis byung //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku yis byung //
translated: Arise through the nature body.

original: rmad byung chos kyi rgyud chen po //🔽thar pa'i mchog tu rtag pa yin //
analyzed: rmad byung chos kyi rgyud chen po // thar pa'i mchog tu rtag pa yin //
translated: The great tantra of the wondrous Dharma

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Is the supreme liberation that is permanent.

original: de bas na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yul ma yin gyi rnam pa thams cad du shes bya thams cad la rtag tu thogs pa med par gzigs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yul ma yin gyi rnam pa thams cad du shes bya thams cad la rtag tu thogs pa med par gzigs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul yin par 'dod do //
translated: Thus, this is not the domain of the bodhisattvas, but is asserted to be the domain of the Buddhas, who always see all objects of knowledge without obstruction.

original: 'di byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang yul nyid ma yin nam 'di rnams las sangs rgyas gzhan ma yin la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams nyid 'dir dkyil 'khor ba dang 'khor rnams yin no //🔽de bas na 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi yul @212a * //
analyzed: 'di byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang yul nyid ma yin nam 'di rnams las sangs rgyas gzhan ma yin la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams nyid 'dir dkyil 'khor ba dang 'khor rnams yin no // de bas na 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi yul @212a * //
translated: Is this not also the domain of the bodhisattvas? The buddhas are not other than these, and the circle of the retinue here is the very qualities of the buddhas.

original: yin na / ji ltar 'khor rnams kyi yul ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yin na / ji ltar 'khor rnams kyi yul ma yin zhe na /
translated: Thus, if this is the domain of the buddhas, how is it not the domain of the retinue?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang dkyil 'khor pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nyid yin la 'khor rnams ni nges pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang dkyil 'khor pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nyid yin la 'khor rnams ni nges pa med pa yin no //
translated: This is so, but the circle is the very qualities of the buddhas, while the retinue is indefinite.

original: lhag ma ni bcu bdun pa dang bco lnga pa las 'chad par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: lhag ma ni bcu bdun pa dang bco lnga pa las 'chad par 'gyur ro//
translated: The rest will be explained in the fifteenth and seventeenth chapters.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das ni thog ma'i sangs rgyas yin la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zin pas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das ni thog ma'i sangs rgyas yin la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zin pas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi dgos so zhe na /
translated: If the Blessed One is the primordial buddha, and since he is already fully enlightened, he does not need to be fully enlightened again.

original: 'di ni ston pa'i mngon par byang chub ston pa yin gyi mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ston pa'i mngon par byang chub ston pa yin gyi mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the manifestation of the Teacher's enlightenment, but not the full enlightenment.

original: sgrub pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: sgrub pa bshad zin to //
translated: The accomplishment has been explained.

original: sgrub pa chen po rtsom pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te skad cig ma de la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po rtsom pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te skad cig ma de la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: In order to begin the great accomplishment, he said, Then, etc. Since he is fully enlightened in that moment, he is Vairocana.

original: thugs ka nas zhes bya ba ni thugs ka'i mtshan ma la gnas pa'i sa bon las so //
analyzed: thugs ka nas zhes bya ba ni thugs ka'i mtshan ma la gnas pa'i sa bon las so //
translated: From his heart means from the seed syllable located in the sign of his heart.

original: byung ste zhes bya ba ni spros pa'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: byung ste zhes bya ba ni spros pa'i tshul du'o //
translated: Having emerged means in the manner of emanation.

original: ched du brjod pa 'di zhes bya ba ni lus las byung ba'i rlung ste ji ltar de rang gi ngang gis byung ba de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyi rmad du byung ba'i chos thugs su chud pa'i dgyes pas kun nas bslang pa'i tshig kyang yin pa de
analyzed: ched du brjod pa 'di zhes bya ba ni lus las byung ba'i rlung ste ji ltar de rang gi ngang gis byung ba de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyi rmad du byung ba'i chos thugs su chud pa'i dgyes pas kun nas bslang pa'i tshig kyang yin pa de
translated: This utterance means the wind that arises from the body. Just as that arises by its own nature, in the same way, the words that are motivated by the joy of the noble ones' realization of the marvelous Dharma

original: bas na rlung dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ched du brjod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bas na rlung dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ched du brjod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the similarity of the wind to the Dharma, it is called the “utterance. ”

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “ This” refers to what is about to be explained.

original: ched du brjod do zhes bya ba ni brjod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ched du brjod do zhes bya ba ni brjod par gyur pa'o //
translated: “ Utterance” means that which is uttered.

original: ci'i phyir de dag nyid ched du brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag nyid ched du brjod ce na /
translated: Why are they uttered?

original: de'i thugs ka nas byung ba nyid kyis de'i chos rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i thugs ka nas byung ba nyid kyis de'i chos rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are realized to be the Dharma of that very [wind] by its arising from the heart.

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
translated: “ Amazing” means “astonishing. ”

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i'o //
translated: “ Of all the Buddhas” means of the Guhyasamāja.

original: byang chub sems las rab byung ba //
analyzed: byang chub sems las rab byung ba //
translated: “ Arisen from the mind of enlightenment”

original: zhes bya ba ni zhal gsum pa dang phyag drug pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub pa'i ngo bor byung bar gyur pa'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gsang //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhal gsum pa dang phyag drug pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub pa'i ngo bor byung bar gyur pa'o // de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gsang //
translated: means that it has arisen in the form of enlightenment, in the manner of having three faces, six arms, and so forth.🔽“ Secret of all the Tathāgatas”

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang 'brel ba'i gsang ba gsum mo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang 'brel ba'i gsang ba gsum mo //
translated: means the three secrets connected with all the Tathāgatas.

original: rab tu mi rtog ces bya ba ni spros pa dang mtshan ma thams cad du snang ba dang bral ba nyid kyis de bzhin du ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rab tu mi rtog ces bya ba ni spros pa dang mtshan ma thams cad du snang ba dang bral ba nyid kyis de bzhin du ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: The phrase utterly non-conceptual means that it is not even an object of conceptual thought, because it is of one taste with that, due to the absence of the appearance of all conceptual elaborations and signs.

original: rnyog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma bag chags dang @212b bcas pa zad pa'i phyir mchog tu dang ba'i thugs kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma bag chags dang @212b bcas pa zad pa'i phyir mchog tu dang ba'i thugs kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The phrase unpolluted means that it is the nature of the highest clarity, because it is the exhaustion of all obscurations, along with their traces.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yin pa de bas na phyag mtshan lnga 'dzin par mdzad pa'i phyir phyag drug pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yin pa de bas na phyag mtshan lnga 'dzin par mdzad pa'i phyir phyag drug pa'o //
translated: Since he is all the Tathagatas, he is six-armed because he holds the five emblems of the Tathagatas.

original: gang gi phyir gsang ba gsum mda' ba de bas na zhal gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsang ba gsum mda' ba de bas na zhal gsum pa'o //
translated: Since he is the three secrets, he is three-faced.

original: gang gi phyir rab tu mi rtog cing rnyog pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir rig pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rab tu mi rtog cing rnyog pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir rig pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Since he is utterly non-conceptual and unpolluted, he is endowed with knowledge.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa'i chos la 'dod pa skyed par byed pa'i ched du brjod pa thos pa'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa'i chos la 'dod pa skyed par byed pa'i ched du brjod pa thos pa'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: means in the context of arousing desire for the Dharma, immediately after hearing the expression.

original: yang 'dus nas zhes bya ba ni sngar ni sku'i 'dus pa mdzad pa yin la da ni gsol ba gdab pa'i don du dgongs pa gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: yang 'dus nas zhes bya ba ni sngar ni sku'i 'dus pa mdzad pa yin la da ni gsol ba gdab pa'i don du dgongs pa gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'dus pa yin no //
translated: Again, having assembled means that previously there was the assembly of the body, and now there is the assembly characterized by the single thought for the purpose of supplicating.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyang de yin la rdo rje yang yin pas na byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ste rdo rje 'chang gi rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyang de yin la rdo rje yang yin pas na byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ste rdo rje 'chang gi rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is both the spirit of enlightenment and a vajra, it is the spirit of enlightenment vajra, because it has the form of Vajradhara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa ni mchod pa'i snying ga'i sngags las byung ba'i gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa ni mchod pa'i snying ga'i sngags las byung ba'i gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams so //
translated: The worship of all the Ones-Gone-Thus is the goddesses such as Rūpavajrā that arise from the heart-mantra of worship.

original: de rnams kyis spros pa'i dam tshig ni 'da' bar mi bya ba dang bla na med pa'i gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'phro ba'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de rnams kyis spros pa'i dam tshig ni 'da' bar mi bya ba dang bla na med pa'i gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'phro ba'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The commitments of those are not to be transgressed, and they are of the nature of the emission of various forms, sounds, and so on, which are unsurpassed.

original: de nyid ni de kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni de kho na nyid yin no //
translated: That itself is reality.

original: rin po che ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i de kho na nyid de gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rin po che ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i de kho na nyid de gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The jewel is the reality that is especially exalted, because it is the nature of nondual great bliss.

original: de rnams kyi sprin ni nam mkha'i khyab pa'i bkod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sprin ni nam mkha'i khyab pa'i bkod pa'o //
translated: The cloud of those is the array that pervades the sky.

original: phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni phyag byas nas so //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni phyag byas nas so //
translated: Having bowed down, means having made obeisance.

original: 'di skad ces bya ba ni ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba ni ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what was said, means what will be explained.

original: 'dus pa gsang ba las byung ba //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyis zhes bya ba la 'di gsang ba rnams kyis byung bas na de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus pa gsang ba las byung ba // de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyis zhes bya ba la 'di gsang ba rnams kyis byung bas na de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Arisen from the secret assembly🔽Of all the transcendent ones.🔽It is called that because it arose from the secret of those.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means the reality of the assembly of the secret of all transcendent ones.

original: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The vajra is the Tathagatas.

original: de rnams kyi snying po ni nor gyi mchog ste chos thams cad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi snying po ni nor gyi mchog ste chos thams cad do //
translated: Their essence is the supreme wealth, which is all dharmas.

original: de rnams kyis btus pa ni bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis btus pa ni bsdus pa'o //
translated: They are collected in it.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni don dam pa ste thar pa'i mchog ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni don dam pa ste thar pa'i mchog ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: That itself is the ultimate, which is the meaning of supreme liberation.

original: bshad du gsol zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rnam par ston pa ste rnam par phye nas gsungs shig pa'o //🔽gsang ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams kyi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag @213a * //
analyzed: bshad du gsol zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rnam par ston pa ste rnam par phye nas gsungs shig pa'o // gsang ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams kyi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag @213a * //
translated: Please explain means please teach, please reveal perfect enlightenment, please expound.

original: pa la sogs pas mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa la sogs pas mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: Secret means not understood by others through direct perception, inference, etc.

original: gal te 'di ltar gsang ba de ji ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bka' stsol bar mdzad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar gsang ba de ji ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bka' stsol bar mdzad pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is like this, how is it that the Lord also teaches it?

original: rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be taught by way of its own nature.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: de'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus yang dag par bsdus pa phyag rgya chen po kun nas yang dag par ston pa'i sgo nas yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus yang dag par bsdus pa phyag rgya chen po kun nas yang dag par ston pa'i sgo nas yin te /
translated: The sambhogakaya, which is the natural outflow of the dharmakaya, is the one that is gathered in the great seal, which is the door of the teaching of the great seal.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it says:

original: dpal rdo rje rtse mo'i rgyud las /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje rtse mo'i rgyud las /
translated: In the glorious Vajra Peak Tantra:

original: de nas ngo bo nyid sku las //
analyzed: de nas ngo bo nyid sku las //
translated: Then, from the svabhavikakaya,

original: slar yang longs spyod rdzogs skur byung //
analyzed: slar yang longs spyod rdzogs skur byung //
translated: Again, the sambhogakaya appears.🔽And:

original: zhes bya ba dang / gsang ba'i rol mo'i 'khor lo yang //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / gsang ba'i rol mo'i 'khor lo yang //
translated: The wheel of the secret play

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mchog gis //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mchog gis //
translated: Is the supreme sambhogakaya.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang /
translated: And also:

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sku las ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku las ni //
translated: From the svabhavikakaya,

original: mig yor lta bur yang dag byung //🔽longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yi ni //
analyzed: mig yor lta bur yang dag byung // longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yi ni //
translated: The sambhogakaya appears like a reflection.🔽The dharma enjoyment of the sambhogakaya

original: chos kyi longs spyod 'di lta bur //
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod 'di lta bur //
translated: Is like this:

original: thams cad brjod med gnas pa med //
analyzed: thams cad brjod med gnas pa med //
translated: All is inexpressible and without location,

original: zhi phra shin tu blta dka' yin //
analyzed: zhi phra shin tu blta dka' yin //
translated: Peaceful, subtle, and very difficult to see.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su thugs brtse bas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su thugs brtse bas //
translated: Out of compassion for the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas rol mo ston par mdzad //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rol mo ston par mdzad //
translated: The buddhas display the play of the buddhas.

original: ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa'i sgo nas zhal gyis bzhes par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa'i sgo nas zhal gyis bzhes par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Excellent, excellent is the acceptance by way of praise.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
translated: The word however has the meaning of distinction.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i ming can gyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i ming can gyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: This is the Enjoyment Body, which has the name Guhyasamaja.

original: 'di dag gis thams cad de bzhin nyid du mthong bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de bden pa mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag gis thams cad de bzhin nyid du mthong bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de bden pa mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: Since all of them see everything as just suchness, they are all Tathagatas, that is, the Bodhisattvas who have seen the truth.

original: de rnams kyang the tshom skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag la bstan du zin kyang 'di'i che ba'i bdag nyid nges par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang the tshom skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag la bstan du zin kyang 'di'i che ba'i bdag nyid nges par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And they also generate doubt means that even though it is taught to them, they are still unable to ascertain its greatness.

original: 'dir the tshom ni ma nges pa tsam yin gyi the tshom nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir the tshom ni ma nges pa tsam yin gyi the tshom nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, doubt is just uncertainty, but it is not doubt itself,

original: de ni bden pa mthong bas spangs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bden pa mthong bas spangs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that has already been abandoned by seeing the truth.

original: gzhan rnams lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma mthong ba rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma mthong ba rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'o //
translated: What need is there to speak of others?

original: gal te bden pa ma mthong ba rnams la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ji ltar ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: gal te bden pa ma mthong ba rnams la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ji ltar ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: How does the Enjoyment Body appear to those who have not seen the truth?

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang cha 'dra bar ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang cha 'dra bar ston pa yin te /
translated: It appears to them in a form similar to the Enjoyment Body of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ston par mdzad pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ston par mdzad pa lta bu yin no //
translated: It is like the appearance of a pure Buddha land.

original: ngo mtshar du gyur pa ni gzhan dag dang rang @213b gis brtag par mi nus pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ngo mtshar du gyur pa ni gzhan dag dang rang @213b gis brtag par mi nus pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is a wonder because it cannot be imagined by others or by oneself.

original: rmad du gyur pa ni shin tu ngo mtshar du gyur pa ste bstan du zin kyang tshe ba'i bdag nyid nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmad du gyur pa ni shin tu ngo mtshar du gyur pa ste bstan du zin kyang tshe ba'i bdag nyid nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a marvel because it is a great wonder, for even when it is shown, it is not certain that it will be seen.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la ngo mtshar dang rmad du gyur pa mnga' ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la ngo mtshar dang rmad du gyur pa mnga' ba yin no //
translated: The Buddhas have a wonder and a marvel in regard to the qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'on kyang ngo mtshar dang rmad du gyur pa'i mig dang yan lag gi 'gyur ba thugs rje ston par mdzad pas na ngo mtshar du gyur rmad du gyur te gsol to //
analyzed: 'on kyang ngo mtshar dang rmad du gyur pa'i mig dang yan lag gi 'gyur ba thugs rje ston par mdzad pas na ngo mtshar du gyur rmad du gyur te gsol to //
translated: But since he displays compassion by means of the marvelous and wonderful changes of his eyes and limbs, he is the marvelous and wonderful one.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi the tshom thams cad gcod pa ni rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi the tshom thams cad gcod pa ni rdo rje 'chang ste /
translated: The one who cuts off all doubts of all tathāgatas is Vajradhara,

original: de'i go 'phang thob pa nyid kyis de rnams kyi the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i go 'phang thob pa nyid kyis de rnams kyi the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he cuts off all their doubts by attaining that state.

original: 'tshang rgya ba nyid ni de la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir de ni de rnams kyi bdag po yin la /
analyzed: 'tshang rgya ba nyid ni de la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir de ni de rnams kyi bdag po yin la /
translated: He is their lord because their enlightenment depends on him,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba rnam pa thams cad du ston par mdzad pa'i phyir chos kyi bdag po yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba rnam pa thams cad du ston par mdzad pa'i phyir chos kyi bdag po yin no //
translated: and he is the lord of the Dharma because he teaches the secrets of the tathāgatas in every way.

original: de nyid kyis na de dag gis phyag 'tshal nas gsol ba btab pa'o ;
analyzed: de nyid kyis na de dag gis phyag 'tshal nas gsol ba btab pa'o ;
translated: Therefore, they pay homage to him and make requests.

original: / de'i phyir kha cig tu ni sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i bdag po dang sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje zhes kyang brjod do //
analyzed: / de'i phyir kha cig tu ni sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i bdag po dang sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje zhes kyang brjod do //
translated: Therefore, in some places he is called the Lord of the Vajra of Body, Speech, and Mind, and in some places the Vajra of Body, Speech, and Mind.

original: gsol to zhes bya ba ni yang gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: gsol to zhes bya ba ni yang gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: He said means he spoke again.

original: gang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gis tshe zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gis tshe zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word what means at what time.

original: de zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word then means at that time.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos de nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos de nyid do //
translated: The reality of the Buddhas, the Tathagatas, is that.

original: de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ni de rnams gang las byung ba'i 'byung gnas te de yang rang gi rig pa'i chu skyes te lte ba'i nang du zhu ba spro ba dang bsdu ba las byung ba stan la gnas pa rang gi sa bon yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ni de rnams gang las byung ba'i 'byung gnas te de yang rang gi rig pa'i chu skyes te lte ba'i nang du zhu ba spro ba dang bsdu ba las byung ba stan la gnas pa rang gi sa bon yin no //
translated: The blessing of those is the source from which they arise, which is the lotus of one's own consciousness, melted within the navel, arising from the emanation and gathering, existing on the seat, which is one's own seed.

original: de mdzad pa ni bskyed pa ste de yang dag par bstan du gsol //
analyzed: de mdzad pa ni bskyed pa ste de yang dag par bstan du gsol //
translated: The performance of that is the generation, which should be taught.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni dkyil 'khor pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni dkyil 'khor pa thams cad do //
translated: The phrase the syllable of the reality of all Tathagatas and so on is stated; all Tathagatas are all the mandala deities.

original: de rnams kyi rdo rje dam tshig 'byung ba ni bkod pa'i khyad par te de'i don gyi tshig ni badzra dhrik ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rdo rje dam tshig 'byung ba ni bkod pa'i khyad par te de'i don gyi tshig ni badzra dhrik ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig go //
translated: The arising of the vajra commitment is the special arrangement, and the words of its meaning are the words vajra dhrk and so on.

original: spro ba dang bsdu ba dang rgyas btab pa dang nges par dgod pa zhes bya ba bzhi ni rdo rje dam tshig ste /
analyzed: spro ba dang bsdu ba dang rgyas btab pa dang nges par dgod pa zhes bya ba bzhi ni rdo rje dam tshig ste /
translated: The four, emanation, reabsorption, sealing, and stabilization, are the vajra commitment.

original: gsang ba rnams nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba rnams nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the means of accomplishing the secrets.

original: tshig gis zab pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid dang spro ba la sogs pas rgya che ba'i bdag nyid ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya @214a * //🔽bar dgongs so //
analyzed: tshig gis zab pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid dang spro ba la sogs pas rgya che ba'i bdag nyid ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya @214a * //🔽bar dgongs so //
translated: It is thought that the words vajra dhrk and so on teach the profound nature of the great, and the extensive nature of emanation and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bde ba dang yid bde ba gang yin pa de dag myong bar bgyi ba ni de'i rang bzhin dag de rnams kyis mthong ba dang bsgom pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bde ba dang yid bde ba gang yin pa de dag myong bar bgyi ba ni de'i rang bzhin dag de rnams kyis mthong ba dang bsgom pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The experience of the bliss and mental joy of all the transcendent lords is the nature of that, because they experience it through seeing and meditation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes ni lnga ste ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes ni lnga ste ;
translated: The gnosis of all the transcendent lords is fivefold:

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang // so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang // so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: mirror-like gnosis, the gnosis of equality, discriminating gnosis, all-accomplishing gnosis, and the gnosis of the pure reality realm.

original: mngon par shes pa drug ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug ste /
translated: The six superknowledges are:

original: lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang ; sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang ; sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: the divine eye, the divine ear, the knowledge of the minds of others, the recollection of former lives, the knowledge of magical abilities, and the knowledge of the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: de dag thob cing rnyed par bgyi ba de nyid ni 'bras bu ste de'i rgyu ni de'i don du'o //
analyzed: de dag thob cing rnyed par bgyi ba de nyid ni 'bras bu ste de'i rgyu ni de'i don du'o //
translated: The attainment and acquisition of those is the fruit, and the cause of that is for the sake of that.

original: bar gyi zhes bya ba mthar thug pa'i tshig gis ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsdus so //
analyzed: bar gyi zhes bya ba mthar thug pa'i tshig gis ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsdus so //
translated: The word “intermediate” is a term for the culmination, and it includes the resultant Buddha qualities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs te de rnams kyi rdo rje ni ro gcig par zhu ba ste de'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs te de rnams kyi rdo rje ni ro gcig par zhu ba ste de'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The body, speech, and mind of all the Ones-Gone-Thus are the vajra, which is the melting into one taste, and because of being just the nature of that, it is so called.

original: zhu ba de nyid ni rig pa dang bcas par dpal mchog dang po'i tshul du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba de nyid ni rig pa dang bcas par dpal mchog dang po'i tshul du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: That melting is the One-Gone-Thus because of having fully and completely awakened into the state of the glorious supreme first way of being endowed with awareness.

original: gsol ba btab pa mkhyen nas zhes bya ba ni gsol ba btab pa'i phyogs gcig gzigs nas te rig pa'i chu skyes kyi nang du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa 'byin par mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsol ba btab pa mkhyen nas zhes bya ba ni gsol ba btab pa'i phyogs gcig gzigs nas te rig pa'i chu skyes kyi nang du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa 'byin par mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having seen one part of the supplication, that is, having seen one part of the supplication, having emitted the consecration of all the Tathagatas into the lotus of knowledge, that is the meaning.

original: ye shes kyi sgron ma zhes bya ba ni don dam pa gsal bar byed pas na ye shes kyang yin la sgron ma yang yin pas na ye shes sgron ma ste shes bya lnga dang ye shes lnga gnyis su med pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste
analyzed: ye shes kyi sgron ma zhes bya ba ni don dam pa gsal bar byed pas na ye shes kyang yin la sgron ma yang yin pas na ye shes sgron ma ste shes bya lnga dang ye shes lnga gnyis su med pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste
translated: The lamp of knowledge is the aggregate of consciousness, which is the non-duality of the five objects of knowledge and the five kinds of knowledge.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: That is the Bhagavat Akshobhya.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The samadhi which has that as its object is also called that.

original: de nyid ni mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje zhes bya'o //
translated: That itself is called vajra because it is indivisible.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni padma'i nang na gnas pa'i sa bon las rigs spro ba'i tshul gyis mi bskyod pa sprul par bzhed pa'i rnam pa can gyi thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni padma'i nang na gnas pa'i sa bon las rigs spro ba'i tshul gyis mi bskyod pa sprul par bzhed pa'i rnam pa can gyi thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of entered into union is that he focused his mind one-pointedly on the aspect of intending to emanate Akshobhya by the method of emanating the family from the seed in the lotus.

original: zhe sdang gi rigs ni sngags kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams te de rnams kyi mchog ni nam @214b mkha' khyab par yongs su gang ba'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rigs ni sngags kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams te de rnams kyi mchog ni nam @214b mkha' khyab par yongs su gang ba'o //
translated: The family of anger is the mantrasamadhis, and their supreme is the complete filling of the sky.

original: de'i snying po bsdus pa ni bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i snying po bsdus pa ni bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The essence of that is Bhagavat Akshobhya.

original: de'i snying po ni de kho na nyid skul bar byed pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: de'i snying po ni de kho na nyid skul bar byed pa'i sngags so //
translated: The essence of that is the mantra that stimulates reality.

original: nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje las phyung ngo zhes bya ba la sku dang gsung dang thugs ni sems dpa' gsum mo //
analyzed: nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje las phyung ngo zhes bya ba la sku dang gsung dang thugs ni sems dpa' gsum mo //
translated: He brought forth from his vajra body, speech, and mind means that the three beings are the body, speech, and mind.

original: rdo rje ni ye shes sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni ye shes sems dpa'o //
translated: The vajra is the gnosis being.

original: phyung ba ni de dag dang lhan cig tu brjod pa'o //
analyzed: phyung ba ni de dag dang lhan cig tu brjod pa'o //
translated: Brought forth means that they are uttered together.

original: badzra dhrik ces bya ba la sogs pa'i snying po dag gi don ni go rims bzhin du le'u bco brgyad pa las ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: badzra dhrik ces bya ba la sogs pa'i snying po dag gi don ni go rims bzhin du le'u bco brgyad pa las ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the essence mantras beginning with vajradhrk will be taught in chapter eighteen.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'o /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'o /
translated: The body, speech, and mind of all the tathagatas is the lord of the mandala.

original: de'i rig pas bskyed pa'i skyes bu ni rig pa'i skyes bu ste lus can gyi rig pa'i padma'i nang du phyung ba'i ye shes lnga zhu ba gang yin pa de ni don dam pa nyid rig pas na rig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rig pas bskyed pa'i skyes bu ni rig pa'i skyes bu ste lus can gyi rig pa'i padma'i nang du phyung ba'i ye shes lnga zhu ba gang yin pa de ni don dam pa nyid rig pas na rig pa'o //
translated: The being generated by the knowledge of that is the knowledge being, and the one who is the melting of the five gnoses extracted from the lotus of the body of the knowledge being is the ultimate itself, and since it is known by knowledge, it is knowledge.

original: rig pa bsdus pa las bskyed pa'i rang gi stan la gnas pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid kyi sa bon ni skyes bu steng ni sngar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i sgrar gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa bsdus pa las bskyed pa'i rang gi stan la gnas pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid kyi sa bon ni skyes bu steng ni sngar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i sgrar gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The seed of the nature of mind generated from the gathering of the knowledge being and abiding on one's seat is the being. The above is the meaning of the previously mentioned term blessed by all tathagatas.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid bzhugs so zhes bya ba la ji ltar de nyid yin zhe na de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te zhe sdang gi rigs mchog gi sngags rnams de las spros te bsdus nas mi bskyod pa'i sku phyag rgya chen por byas pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid bzhugs so zhes bya ba la ji ltar de nyid yin zhe na de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te zhe sdang gi rigs mchog gi sngags rnams de las spros te bsdus nas mi bskyod pa'i sku phyag rgya chen por byas pa'i phyir ro
translated: How is he himself? Because he is their nature, since the mantras of the supreme family of anger are emanated from him, and having emanated, are gathered into the great seal body of Akshobhya.

original: // de bas na mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya chen po yang zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa thams cad kyi sku yin la sbyor ba yang de dang mtshungs pa'i shes rab kyi sku yin zhing /
analyzed: // de bas na mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya chen po yang zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa thams cad kyi sku yin la sbyor ba yang de dang mtshungs pa'i shes rab kyi sku yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, the great seal of Akshobhya is the body of all three faces and six arms, and the wisdom seal is also the body similar to that.

original: mchog gi mchog ni thugs kar nyi ma dang rdo rje dang nyi ma dang zhe sdang gi yi ge h'um ste de dag kun du snang bar gyur pa nyid kyis bzhugs so //
analyzed: mchog gi mchog ni thugs kar nyi ma dang rdo rje dang nyi ma dang zhe sdang gi yi ge h'um ste de dag kun du snang bar gyur pa nyid kyis bzhugs so //
translated: The supreme of the supreme is the sun, vajra, sun, and the letter hum of anger at the heart, which abide by being completely radiant.

original: phyag rgya chen po 'di ji lta bu sbyor ba ni ji lta bu yin zhe na nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i tshul du ste sku dang rtsa ba'i zhal ni nag po'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po 'di ji lta bu sbyor ba ni ji lta bu yin zhe na nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i tshul du ste sku dang rtsa ba'i zhal ni nag po'o //
translated: What is this Great Seal? What is the application? In the manner of black, white, and red, that is, the body and the principal face are black.

original: zhal g-yas pa ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: zhal g-yas pa ni dkar po'o //
translated: The right face is white.

original: zhal g-yon pa ni dmar po'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: zhal g-yon pa ni dmar po'i tshul du'o //
translated: The left face is in the manner of red.

original: gang du zhe na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la'o //
analyzed: gang du zhe na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la'o //
