translated: Where? In the vajra body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas. The Great Seal is the Lord of the mandala, who is the nature of all the Tathagatas, and the application is the vajra body, speech, and mind.

original: go rims bzhin du phyag rgya chen po dang sbyor ba dang mchog gi go 'phang dag la bzhugs pa ste mi snang bar 'gyur pa nyid @215a * //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du phyag rgya chen po dang sbyor ba dang mchog gi go 'phang dag la bzhugs pa ste mi snang bar 'gyur pa nyid @215a * //
translated: He abides in the Great Seal, the application, and the supreme state, respectively, and he abides in the manner of being invisible.

original: kyis bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyis bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he abides in the manner of being invisible.

original: gal te dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po nyid las 'byin pa yin na dkyil 'khor pa thams cad kyi rigs kyang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po nyid las 'byin pa yin na dkyil 'khor pa thams cad kyi rigs kyang de nyid yin te /
translated: If the Lord of the mandala is the one who emits the others, then his clan would be the same as all the others in the mandala.

original: bdag po'i dbye bas rigs kyi dbye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bdag po'i dbye bas rigs kyi dbye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And it would follow that the division of clans would be due to the division of Lords.

original: nyes pa 'di yod pa ma yin te rgyud 'dir skyed pa po ni rigs ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di yod pa ma yin te rgyud 'dir skyed pa po ni rigs ma yin no //
translated: This is not a fault, because in this tantra, the creator is not the clan.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: de'i rigs dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gti mug dang zhe sdang dang nga rgyal dang 'dod chags dang phrag dog gi rigs rnams yin la sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni zhe sdang yin te zhe sdang ni mchog dang po yin no zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: de'i rigs dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gti mug dang zhe sdang dang nga rgyal dang 'dod chags dang phrag dog gi rigs rnams yin la sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni zhe sdang yin te zhe sdang ni mchog dang po yin no zhes bya ba ni
translated: The Bodhisattvas who possess that clan are the clans of delusion, hatred, pride, desire, and jealousy, and the Buddhas are the clan of hatred, because hatred is the supreme first.

original: grub pa'i mtha' can no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' can no //
translated: This is the tenet of the Siddhāntists.

original: 'o na zhe sdang gi rigs kyi sngags kyi mchog de spros pa gang yin pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na zhe sdang gi rigs kyi sngags kyi mchog de spros pa gang yin pa de gang zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the emission of that supreme mantra of the clan of hatred?

original: la la ni mi bskyod pa nyid yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: la la ni mi bskyod pa nyid yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: Some believe that it is Akshobhya.

original: gzhan dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i tshogs khro bor gyur pa'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i tshogs khro bor gyur pa'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that the others are the wrathful forms of the assembly of the five transcendent ones.

original: gzhan ni khro bo'i rigs dpag tu med pa yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan ni khro bo'i rigs dpag tu med pa yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that they are the immeasurable clan of wrathful deities.

original: de bzhin du gti mug gi rigs la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gti mug gi rigs la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should say what is appropriate for the clan of delusion and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ni yang dag par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ni yang dag par rtog pa ste /
translated: The pledge of all transcendent ones is perfect realization.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: It is Vairochana, whose nature is the aggregate of form.

original: de 'byung ba ni bskyed pa ste de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de 'byung ba ni bskyed pa ste de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Its origination is its generation, and the samadhi focused on that is called by that name.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood by following the earlier [explanations].

original: dkar po nag po dmar po'i tshul du zhes bya ba ni sku dang rtsa ba'i zhal ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: dkar po nag po dmar po'i tshul du zhes bya ba ni sku dang rtsa ba'i zhal ni dkar po'o //
translated: The way of white, black, and red is that the body and the main face are white.

original: zhal g-yas pa ni nag po'o //
analyzed: zhal g-yas pa ni nag po'o //
translated: The right face is black.

original: zhal g-yon pa ni dmar po'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: zhal g-yon pa ni dmar po'i tshul du'o //
translated: The left face is the way of red.

original: spyan sngar bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni byung nas shar phyogs kyi padma dang zla ba la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: spyan sngar bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni byung nas shar phyogs kyi padma dang zla ba la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He resides in front means that he arises and resides on the eastern lotus and moon.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che'i 'byung ba zhes pa la rin po che'i rnam par 'byung bas na rin chen 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che'i 'byung ba zhes pa la rin po che'i rnam par 'byung bas na rin chen 'byung ba'o //
translated: Ratnasaṃbhava means the source of jewels, because jewels arise from him.

original: nor bu ni phra mo ste de yang sku dang thugs dang gsung phra mo mnyam pa nyid las byung ba'i phra mo yang yin la rdo rje dpal yang yin te /
analyzed: nor bu ni phra mo ste de yang sku dang thugs dang gsung phra mo mnyam pa nyid las byung ba'i phra mo yang yin la rdo rje dpal yang yin te /
translated: A gem is a small jewel, and it is also small because it arises from the sameness of the small body, mind, and speech. He is also a vajra glory.

original: de bas na tshor ba'i phung po'i ngo bo nyid kyi rin chen 'byung ldan te bsams ma thag tu don sna tshogs 'byor ba'i phyir yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na tshor ba'i phung po'i ngo bo nyid kyi rin chen 'byung ldan te bsams ma thag tu don sna tshogs 'byor ba'i phyir yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rigs so //
translated: Therefore, Ratnasaṃbhava is the essence of the aggregate of feeling, and he is a wish-fulfilling gem because he is the source of various objects as soon as they are thought of.

original: ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu dag gi g-yon dang g-yas kyi zhal dkar po dang nag po nyid du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu dag gi g-yon dang g-yas kyi zhal dkar po dang nag po nyid du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The left and right faces of yellow, red, and green are to be connected with white and black, respectively.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams @215b cad kyi 'dod chags chen po ni rig pa bzhi yongs su bsdus pa'i gsang ba'i tshogs de nyid la so sor kun du rtog pa ste de yang 'du shes kyi phung po'i bdag nyid kyi snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams @215b cad kyi 'dod chags chen po ni rig pa bzhi yongs su bsdus pa'i gsang ba'i tshogs de nyid la so sor kun du rtog pa ste de yang 'du shes kyi phung po'i bdag nyid kyi snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: The great passion of all the Tathagatas is the vision of each of those very secret assemblies which are the totality of the four knowledges. That is also Amitabha, who is the nature of the aggregate of perception.

original: rdo rje ni gsang ba'i dam tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje ni gsang ba'i dam tshig go //
translated: The vajra is the secret commitment.

original: de rnams kyi 'dod chags ni rigs rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'dod chags ni rigs rnams so //
translated: Their passion is the families.

original: 'dod chags de nyid ni kun du blta bas na gzigs pa ste de'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: 'dod chags de nyid ni kun du blta bas na gzigs pa ste de'i dbang phyug go //
translated: That passion is seen, and he is the lord of that.

original: kun tu spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug kyang yin la rig pa chen po'i bdag po yang yin no //
analyzed: kun tu spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug kyang yin la rig pa chen po'i bdag po yang yin no //
translated: He is also Avalokitesvara, the lord of great knowledge.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
translated: All the Tathagatas are the perfect realizations.

original: de rnams kyi gdon mi za ba'i dam tshig ni kun du 'go bas 'bras bu dang bcas pa ste de yang 'du byed kyi phung po'i bdag nyid kyi don yod par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gdon mi za ba'i dam tshig ni kun du 'go bas 'bras bu dang bcas pa ste de yang 'du byed kyi phung po'i bdag nyid kyi don yod par 'grub pa'o //
translated: Their commitment is the totality of the commitments, which is the fruit of the totality of the commitments. That is also Amoghasiddhi, who is the nature of the aggregate of compositional factors.

original: dam tshig ni kun nas rtogs pa yin la bkug pa ni 'bras bu nye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ni kun nas rtogs pa yin la bkug pa ni 'bras bu nye bar byed pa'o //
translated: The pledge is the complete realization, and the summoning is the bringing of the result near.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po'i sdom ni zhe sdang zhe bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te shes pa dang shes bya gcig tu gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po'i sdom ni zhe sdang zhe bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te shes pa dang shes bya gcig tu gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The summary of the five transcendent ones is stated by “hatred, etc.”, the aggregate of consciousness, which is the unity of the knower and the known, is Bhagavat Akṣhobhya.

original: de nyid kyis na tha dad du 'byed pa'i gnyen po yin pas gnyis la zhe sdang ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na tha dad du 'byed pa'i gnyen po yin pas gnyis la zhe sdang ba'o //
translated: Since that is the antidote for the differentiation of the two, it is “hatred”.

original: sems tsam nyid kyis ye shes don la mi dmigs pa ni gzugs kyi phung po'i bems po yin pas gti mug ste rnam par snang mdzad do//
analyzed: sems tsam nyid kyis ye shes don la mi dmigs pa ni gzugs kyi phung po'i bems po yin pas gti mug ste rnam par snang mdzad do//
translated: Since the object of intuition, which is the mere mind, is not perceived, the aggregate of form is “ignorance”, Vairocana.

original: de kho na nyid mtshan ma'i 'du shes kyi phung po 'dod chags te 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mtshan ma'i 'du shes kyi phung po 'dod chags te 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The aggregate of discriminations of reality is “passion”, Amitābha.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zhe sdang dang gti mug dang 'dod chags rnams nyon mongs pa yin pa bzhin du yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang dam tshig kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zhe sdang dang gti mug dang 'dod chags rnams nyon mongs pa yin pa bzhin du yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang dam tshig kyang ngo //
translated: Likewise, means just as hatred, delusion, and passion are defilements, so are the wish-fulfilling gem and the pledge.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu ni ye shes tsam du rig pa'i tshor ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu ni ye shes tsam du rig pa'i tshor ba'i phung po'o //
translated: The wish-fulfilling gem is the aggregate of feeling, known as mere intuition.

original: de yang nga rgyal dregs pa ste ngar rlom pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang nga rgyal dregs pa ste ngar rlom pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is pride, arrogance, the nature of self-conceit.

original: dam tshig ni 'du byed kyi phung po ste gtong ba dang yang dag par mtshon pa dang bdag nyid can zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas lhag ma mi mngon pas de nyid phrag dog go //
analyzed: dam tshig ni 'du byed kyi phung po ste gtong ba dang yang dag par mtshon pa dang bdag nyid can zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas lhag ma mi mngon pas de nyid phrag dog go //
translated: The pledge is the aggregate of karmic predispositions, characterized by giving, correct indication, and self-identity.

original: lngar gtogs pa 'di rnams ni rang rang gi sngags kyi lha rnams kyi rigs yin te rigs su gyur pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lngar gtogs pa 'di rnams ni rang rang gi sngags kyi lha rnams kyi rigs yin te rigs su gyur pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: These five are the families of their respective mantra deities, meaning that they are the families.

original: 'di ltar rigs ni dang po'i rgyud do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs ni dang po'i rgyud do //
translated: Thus, family is the first continuum.

original: rgyud kyang sngags rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: rgyud kyang sngags rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: And the continuum is the enlightenment spirit of the mantras.

original: de yang dbyer mi phyed pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings yin la dbye na rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de yang dbyer mi phyed pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings yin la dbye na rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Moreover, since it is indivisible, it is the basic element of the dharmadhātu without beginning or end. When divided, there are five aspects.

original: gnyis su @216a * //
analyzed: gnyis su @216a * //
translated: Moreover, since it is indivisible, it is the basic element of the dharmadhātu without beginning or end. When divided, it is fivefold.

original: rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi bas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi bas na zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because all conceptual thoughts are pacified.

original: chos dang chos nyid du snang ba nub pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par zad pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos nyid du snang ba nub pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par zad pa'o //
translated: It is the exhaustion of things and nonthings because the appearance of phenomena and the noumenon has subsided.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams gsang ba ro gcig pa nyid kyis na gtso bo'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams gsang ba ro gcig pa nyid kyis na gtso bo'o //
translated: It is the principal because the buddhas of the three times are of one taste in the secret.

original: yang dag pa la so sor rtog pa'i phyir stong pa nyid mi phyed pa'o ;
analyzed: yang dag pa la so sor rtog pa'i phyir stong pa nyid mi phyed pa'o ;
translated: It is indivisible emptiness because it is the discernment of reality.

original: / sna tshogs pa'i don mdzad pa'i phyir snying rje mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: / sna tshogs pa'i don mdzad pa'i phyir snying rje mi phyed pa'o //
translated: It is indivisible compassion because it performs various benefits.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: It is said:

original: thog ma tha ma med zhi ba //
analyzed: thog ma tha ma med zhi ba //
translated: Peace without beginning or end,

original: dngos dang dngos med zad pa'i gtso //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med zad pa'i gtso //
translated: The principal of the exhaustion of things and nonthings,

original: stong nyid snying rje mi phyed pa //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje mi phyed pa //
translated: Indivisible emptiness and compassion,

original: byang chub sems zhes bshad pa yin //🔽zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes bshad pa yin //🔽zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Is explained to be bodhicitta.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa lnga po 'di dag gti mug dang zhe sdang dang 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang phrag dog nyid yin pa de bas na rigs lnga po yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa lnga po 'di dag gti mug dang zhe sdang dang 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang phrag dog nyid yin pa de bas na rigs lnga po yin no //
translated: These five, Śākyamuni and so on, are ignorance, hatred, desire, pride, and envy, and therefore they are the five families.

original: 'dod dang thar pa rab sgrub pa //
analyzed: 'dod dang thar pa rab sgrub pa //
translated: Desire and liberation are well accomplished.

original: zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rang bzhin dang ldan pa sna tshogs la khyab pa'i sems ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rang bzhin dang ldan pa sna tshogs la khyab pa'i sems ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: The mind that pervades the various natures of desire, hatred, and ignorance is desire.

original: de yang don yod par grub pa ste 'bad pa dang bcas pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: de yang don yod par grub pa ste 'bad pa dang bcas pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: That is Amoghasiddhi, the omniscience that is accompanied by effort.

original: de las 'bad pa med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa ni thar pa'o //
analyzed: de las 'bad pa med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa ni thar pa'o //
translated: From that, the effortless omniscience is liberation.

original: de'i rab sgrub pa ni skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rab sgrub pa ni skyed pa'o //
translated: The well accomplishment of that is the generation.

original: mdor bsdu na rigs gsum du 'gyur te gti mug dang zhe sdang dang 'dod chags so //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rigs gsum du 'gyur te gti mug dang zhe sdang dang 'dod chags so //
translated: In brief, there are three families: ignorance, hatred, and desire.

original: 'dod chags ni shes rab ste de yang bla na med pa'i bde ba'i tshogs nyams su myong ba dang yongs su gcod pa dang kun du gtong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni shes rab ste de yang bla na med pa'i bde ba'i tshogs nyams su myong ba dang yongs su gcod pa dang kun du gtong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po gsum mo //
translated: Passion is wisdom, which is the three aggregates characterized as the experience, the determination, and the relinquishment of the accumulation of the unsurpassed bliss.

original: de la gti mug ni don dmigs su med pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la gti mug ni don dmigs su med pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid do //
translated: Among these, delusion is the emptiness gate of liberation, since it is the non-apprehension of objects.

original: zhe sdang ni smon cing mngon par zhen pa'i gnyen po yin pas smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni smon cing mngon par zhen pa'i gnyen po yin pas smon pa med pa'o //
translated: Aversion is the wishlessness, since it is the antidote to the will and the adherence.

original: 'dod chags gsum ni bdag dang gzhan du 'byed pa'i mtshan ma der nub pas mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags gsum ni bdag dang gzhan du 'byed pa'i mtshan ma der nub pas mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: The three passions are the signlessness, since the sign of the differentiation of self and other is submerged in them.🔽Thus, one should understand the colors and faces of the five and three families, which are situated in this way, in accordance with the principles of the colors and faces.

original: de ltar gnas pa'i rigs lnga dang rigs gsum gyi de kho na nyid la sku mdog dang zhal gyi rigs pa rnams kyang mnyen par gyis shig / gang gi phyir rmongs pas don la mi dmigs pa'i phyir sems 'ba' zhig snang la 'ba' zhig pa nyid ni dag🔽pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa'i rigs lnga dang rigs gsum gyi de kho na nyid la sku mdog dang zhal gyi rigs pa rnams kyang mnyen par gyis shig / gang gi phyir rmongs pas don la mi dmigs pa'i phyir sems 'ba' zhig snang la 'ba' zhig pa nyid ni dag pa nyid do //
translated: Since the mind alone appears due to delusion, the non-apprehension of objects, the mind alone is the pure,🔽the pure is the clean,🔽the clean is the stainless,🔽the stainless is the immaculate,

original: dag pa nyid ni gtsang ba nyid do //
analyzed: dag pa nyid ni gtsang ba nyid do //
translated: the immaculate is the signless,🔽the signless is the wishless,🔽the wishless is the emptiness,🔽the emptiness is the reality,🔽the reality is the truth,🔽the truth is the ultimate,🔽the ultimate is the unsurpassed,🔽the unsurpassed is the supreme,🔽the supreme is the highest,🔽the highest is the ultimate,🔽the ultimate is the reality,🔽the reality is the suchness,🔽the suchness is the non-differentiation,🔽the non-differentiation is the non-differentiation of the three times,🔽the non-differentiation of the three times is the non-differentiation of the three vehicles,🔽the non-differentiation of the three vehicles is the non-differentiation of the three bodies,🔽the non-differentiation of the three bodies is the non-differentiation of the three realms,🔽the non-differentiation of the three realms is the non-differentiation of the three poisons,🔽the non-differentiation of the three poisons is the non-differentiation of the three existences,🔽the non-differentiation of the three existences is the non-differentiation of the three times,🔽the non-differentiation of the three times is the non-differentiation of the three vehicles,🔽the non-differentiation of the three vehicles is the non-differentiation of the three bodies,🔽the non-differentiation of the three bodies is the non-differentiation of the three realms,🔽the non-differentiation of the three realms is the non-differentiation of the three poisons,🔽the non-differ

original: gtsang ba dang dkar ba zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin pa de'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad ni dkar po yin no //
analyzed: gtsang ba dang dkar ba zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin pa de'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad ni dkar po yin no //
translated: Pure and white are synonyms, therefore Vairocana is white.

original: gang gi phyir zhe sdang gis ni khams gsum las sems 'dren par byed pa de bas na mi bskyod pa ste 'dren @216b par byed pa'i phyir nag po'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe sdang gis ni khams gsum las sems 'dren par byed pa de bas na mi bskyod pa ste 'dren @216b par byed pa'i phyir nag po'o //
translated: Since hatred draws the mind away from the three realms, Akshobhya is black, since he draws away.

original: gang gi phyir mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis ni bde bas sems tshim par byed pa de bas na rin chen dpal te tshim par byed pa'i phyir ser po'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis ni bde bas sems tshim par byed pa de bas na rin chen dpal te tshim par byed pa'i phyir ser po'o //
translated: Since the gnosis of equality satisfies the mind with bliss, Ratnasambhava is yellow, since he satisfies.

original: gang gi phyir chags pas na sems dngos po la sgyur bar byed pa de bas na 'od dpag tu med pa ni dmar po yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chags pas na sems dngos po la sgyur bar byed pa de bas na 'od dpag tu med pa ni dmar po yin no //
translated: Since attachment turns the mind to things, Amitabha is red.

original: gang gi phyir dam tshig gis sems can thams cad du 'gro bar byed pa de bas na don yod par grub pa ste 'gro bar byed pa'i ljang gu'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dam tshig gis sems can thams cad du 'gro bar byed pa de bas na don yod par grub pa ste 'gro bar byed pa'i ljang gu'o //
translated: Since the vow causes the mind to go to all sentient beings, Amoghasiddhi is green, since he causes going.

original: de nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid kyi zhal ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid kyi zhal ni dkar po'o //
translated: Therefore, the face of emptiness is white.

original: smon pa med pa'i zhal ni nag po'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i zhal ni nag po'o //
translated: The face of the wishless is black.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i zhal ni dmar po'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i zhal ni dmar po'o //
translated: The face of the signless is red.

original: ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du gti mug la sogs pa skye ba yin pa de ltar na rim pa de nyid kyis sku mdog dang zhal dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du gti mug la sogs pa skye ba yin pa de ltar na rim pa de nyid kyis sku mdog dang zhal dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Just as delusion and so on arise in the proper order, so too the colors of the body and faces are in that very order.

original: thams cad kyi rtsa ba'i zhal ni sku dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rtsa ba'i zhal ni sku dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The fundamental face of all is the same color as the body,

original: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the principal one.

original: de la dang po gti mug ni dkar po ste de'i zhal dbus ma dkar po yin la g-yas pa ni nag po g-yon pa ni dmar po'o //
analyzed: de la dang po gti mug ni dkar po ste de'i zhal dbus ma dkar po yin la g-yas pa ni nag po g-yon pa ni dmar po'o //
translated: Therein, the first face of delusion is white, and its central face is white, the right face is black, and the left face is red.

original: gti mug gi zhal rnams kyi 'brel pa grub pa yin te thams cad du rags pa nyid kyis thog ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug gi zhal rnams kyi 'brel pa grub pa yin te thams cad du rags pa nyid kyis thog ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The connection of the faces of delusion is established, because they are the first due to their coarseness.

original: de nas zhe sdang la sogs pa'i zhal dkar po ni gnas 'phrog par byed pa'i gnas su 'pho ba yin te /
analyzed: de nas zhe sdang la sogs pa'i zhal dkar po ni gnas 'phrog par byed pa'i gnas su 'pho ba yin te /
translated: Then the white face of hatred and so on is transferred to the place of the stolen abode.

original: zhe sdang nag po de'i zhal nag po ni dkar po'i gnas dbus ma la yin la nag po'i gnas g-yas su ni dkar po yin zhing g-yon pa ni dmar po nyid do //
analyzed: zhe sdang nag po de'i zhal nag po ni dkar po'i gnas dbus ma la yin la nag po'i gnas g-yas su ni dkar po yin zhing g-yon pa ni dmar po nyid do //
translated: The black face of black hatred is in the central place of the white face, the right place of the black face is white, and the left place is red.

original: ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu dag gis mtshan ma med pa'i zhal de dag ni go rims bzhin du dbus ma dkar po'i gnas la ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu nyid yin la mtshan ma med pa'i gnas g-yon pa la ni dkar po yin
analyzed: ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu dag gis mtshan ma med pa'i zhal de dag ni go rims bzhin du dbus ma dkar po'i gnas la ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu nyid yin la mtshan ma med pa'i gnas g-yon pa la ni dkar po yin
translated: The signless faces of yellow, red, and green are yellow, red, and green in the central place of the white face, respectively. The left place of the signless face is white,

original: te lhag ma g-yas pa ni nag po'o //
analyzed: te lhag ma g-yas pa ni nag po'o //
translated: and the remaining right place is black.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas rnams la zhal gsum mnga' ba de bzhin du de las gzhan rnams kyi yang kha dog de dag yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas rnams la zhal gsum mnga' ba de bzhin du de las gzhan rnams kyi yang kha dog de dag yin te /
translated: Just as the Buddhas have three faces, so do the others have those colors.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi sku mdog lnga //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi sku mdog lnga //
translated: The color of the bodies of the Victorious Ones

original: dkar nag ser dang dmar ljang 'gyur //🔽sems la 'ba' zhig dang 'dren byed dang // tshim 'gyur 'tshor dang 'gro bar byed //
analyzed: dkar nag ser dang dmar ljang 'gyur //🔽sems la 'ba' zhig dang 'dren byed dang // tshim 'gyur 'tshor dang 'gro bar byed //
translated: is white, black, yellow, red, and green.🔽The eye, the eye-lead, the eye-satisfier, the eye-goer, and the eye-maker are the five eyes.

original: dkar min g-yas dkar dkar ba'i nag / de dag gi ni g-yon pa dmar po ste //
analyzed: dkar min g-yas dkar dkar ba'i nag / de dag gi ni g-yon pa dmar po ste //
translated: The right faces of the white, black, and white-black are white.

original: ser dang dmar dang ljang ba dag gi ni //🔽g-yas pa dkar min g-yon pa dkar po yin //
analyzed: ser dang dmar dang ljang ba dag gi ni // g-yas pa dkar min g-yon pa dkar po yin //
translated: The left faces of the yellow, red, and green are red.🔽The right faces of the white, black, and white-black are black.

original: dkar dang dkar min gzhan rnams @217a * //🔽rtsa ba'i zhal //
analyzed: dkar dang dkar min gzhan rnams @217a * // rtsa ba'i zhal //
translated: The left faces of the white and black are white.

original: sku dang 'dra dang g-yas dang g-yon gyi ni //
analyzed: sku dang 'dra dang g-yas dang g-yon gyi ni //
translated: The other faces are the same as the body.🔽The right and left faces are blue and red,

original: sngo dmar dang ni dkar dang dmar po dang // sngo dang dkar po dag tu shes par bya //
analyzed: sngo dmar dang ni dkar dang dmar po dang // sngo dang dkar po dag tu shes par bya //
translated: white and red, and blue and white.

original: gang phyir dkar min dang ni chags can gsum //
analyzed: gang phyir dkar min dang ni chags can gsum //
translated: The three black faces and the three passionate faces

original: dkar dbus zhal gyi gnas ni 'phrog byed pas //🔽gnas 'phrog byed pa'i gnas su 'pho rim pas //
analyzed: dkar dbus zhal gyi gnas ni 'phrog byed pas // gnas 'phrog byed pa'i gnas su 'pho rim pas //
translated: steal the place of the central white face.

original: rgyud la dkar na gzhal ni sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: rgyud la dkar na gzhal ni sbyar bar bya //
translated: Since they steal the place, the white face is placed in the place of the black faces in order.

original: spyan dang m'a ma k'i'i tshig gi gzhung ni go rims 'chol bar yod pas na de la spyi'i gzhung dang por blta bar bya la de'i 'og tu m'a ma k'i'i gzhung yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: spyan dang m'a ma k'i'i tshig gi gzhung ni go rims 'chol bar yod pas na de la spyi'i gzhung dang por blta bar bya la de'i 'og tu m'a ma k'i'i gzhung yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Since the text of Locanā and Māmakī is disordered, one should first look at the general text and then look at the text of Māmakī.

original: gti mug bzhin du gti mug dga' ma yang dang po nyid yin pa'i phyir te dper na bris pa'i dkyil 'khor lta bu'o //
analyzed: gti mug bzhin du gti mug dga' ma yang dang po nyid yin pa'i phyir te dper na bris pa'i dkyil 'khor lta bu'o //
translated: Delusion is the first, like the mandala of the written [image], because it is the first, like the mandala of the written [image].

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni don yod par grub pa bkod pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni don yod par grub pa bkod pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: Then, immediately after Amoghasiddhi is arrayed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de de nyid gti mug rdo rje ste de yang lus mnyam pa nyid du dmigs pa'i zhi gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de de nyid gti mug rdo rje ste de yang lus mnyam pa nyid du dmigs pa'i zhi gnas so //
translated: All tathāgatas are all tathāgata bodies, and that is delusion vajra. That is also the śamatha that observes the equality of the body.

original: de'i rjes su mnyes par byed pa ni rnam par dpyad na sems tsam nyid du mnyam par lta ba'i lhag mthong ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su mnyes par byed pa ni rnam par dpyad na sems tsam nyid du mnyam par lta ba'i lhag mthong ste /
translated: After that, pleasing is vipaśyanā that views the equality of mind only when analyzed.

original: de rnams kyi gzugs kyi de kho na nyid la lta ba'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gzugs kyi de kho na nyid la lta ba'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
translated: The eye of the buddhas is the view of the suchness of form of those [deities].

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o ;
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o ;
translated: That samādhi that observes that is called that.

original: / de nyid ni mi phyed pas na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: / de nyid ni mi phyed pas na rdo rje'o //
translated: That itself is vajra because it is indivisible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni gti mug rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni gti mug rdo rje'o //
translated: All the Tathagatas are the vajra of delusion.

original: de'i btsun mo'i mchog ni gtso mo ste shin tu yang longs spyod du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i btsun mo'i mchog ni gtso mo ste shin tu yang longs spyod du gyur pa'o //
translated: His chief queen is the chief one, who is also the one who is enjoyed.

original: spyan gyi snying po ni 'dir spyan yin pa de nyid kyis na mo ha ra t'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyan gyi snying po ni 'dir spyan yin pa de nyid kyis na mo ha ra t'i zhes bya'o //
translated: The essence of Locana is the eye, and it is she who is called “Mohavajrā.”

original: bud med kyi gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bud med kyi gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: She assumes the form of a woman.

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs spros pa dang / bsdus pa dang rgyas btab pa las lha mo spyan gyi gzugs su gyur te'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs spros pa dang / bsdus pa dang rgyas btab pa las lha mo spyan gyi gzugs su gyur te'o //
translated: This is the goddess Locanā, who arises from the expansion, contraction, and sealing of the family.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?🔽She resides in the eastern corner.

original: shar phyogs kyi grvar bzhugs so zhes snga ma dang sbyar te shar gyi de ma thag grvar ni shar gyi grvar te me'i phyogs su zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi grvar bzhugs so zhes snga ma dang sbyar te shar gyi de ma thag grvar ni shar gyi grvar te me'i phyogs su zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The eastern corner is the southeast, the meaning of “in the direction of fire.”

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni spyan bkod pa'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni spyan bkod pa'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: Then, after the arrangement of Locanā,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ni sems so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ni sems so //
translated: the vajra of all the Tathāgatas is the mind.

original: de 'dzin pa ni 'dzin par byed pa'i zhi gnas te zhe sdang rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa ni 'dzin par byed pa'i zhi gnas te zhe sdang rdo rje'o //
translated: The retention of that is the retention of the śamatha that holds it, which is Dveṣavajra.

original: de rjes su mnyes pa ni rnam par dpyad na 'dzin pa po med pas mnyam pa nyid du lta ba'i lhag mthong ste m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: de rjes su mnyes pa ni rnam par dpyad na 'dzin pa po med pas mnyam pa nyid du lta ba'i lhag mthong ste m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: Then, the one who is pleased is the insight that views the equality of the absence of a grasper when analyzed, which is Māmakī.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi @217b thugs ni bdag ste de la rigs pas na m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi @217b thugs ni bdag ste de la rigs pas na m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: Thus, the mind of the buddhas is the self, and because it is the lineage of that, it is Māmakī.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The samādhi that focuses on that is called that.

original: de nyid ni dam tshig ste 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni dam tshig ste 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the pledge, because it is not to be transgressed.

original: bud med kyi gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du m'a ma k'i'o gzugs su gyur te'o //
analyzed: bud med kyi gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du m'a ma k'i'o gzugs su gyur te'o //
translated: She assumes the form of a woman—as before, Māmakī—and becomes the form.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: lho phyogs kyi grvar bzhugs so zhes 'og ma dang sbyar te lto phyogs kyi de ma thag pa'i grvar ni bden bral gyi phyogs su zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi grvar bzhugs so zhes 'og ma dang sbyar te lto phyogs kyi de ma thag pa'i grvar ni bden bral gyi phyogs su zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: She resides in the southern corner, as below. In the immediate corner of the south, in the direction of Rākṣasa, is the meaning of “in the southern direction.”

original: 'dod chags ni chos so //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni chos so //
translated: Passion is phenomena.

original: de 'dzin pa ni zhi gnas te 'dod chags rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa ni zhi gnas te 'dod chags rdo rje'o //
translated: The retention of that is śamatha, which is Rāgavajrā.

original: de rjes su chags par byed pa ni ngag la rnam par dpyad pas brjod du med par mnyam par lta ba'i lhag mthong ste /
analyzed: de rjes su chags par byed pa ni ngag la rnam par dpyad pas brjod du med par mnyam par lta ba'i lhag mthong ste /
translated: The insight that is the subsequent passion is the insight that views the equality of the inexpressible by the analysis of speech.

original: chos la mkhas pa nyid kyis gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: chos la mkhas pa nyid kyis gos dkar mo'o //
translated: The one who is skilled in the Dharma is Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni sku la sogs pa mnyam par dmigs pa'i zhi gnas te dam tshig rdo rje shes rab 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni sku la sogs pa mnyam par dmigs pa'i zhi gnas te dam tshig rdo rje shes rab 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas is the meditative serenity that observes the equality of the body, and so on, and is the commitment-vajra-prajñā-holder.

original: de'i slu ba ni rnam par dpyad na slu ba ste rang bzhin med par mnyam par lta ba'i ye shes te lam du rgal bas na sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: de'i slu ba ni rnam par dpyad na slu ba ste rang bzhin med par mnyam par lta ba'i ye shes te lam du rgal bas na sgrol ma'o //
translated: The deception of that is the deception when analyzed, the equality of the absence of intrinsic nature that is the pristine wisdom, and is Tārā, because she crosses over the path.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The meditative stabilization that observes that is called that.

original: shes rab 'chang ba ni shes rab 'chang ba ste dam tshig rdo rje'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'chang ba ni shes rab 'chang ba ste dam tshig rdo rje'o //
translated: The one who holds wisdom is the holder of wisdom, the commitment-vajra.

original: sdom pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsum de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi btsun mo'i mchog nyid phun sum tshogs pa ste sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bde ba'i mchog ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: sdom pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsum de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi btsun mo'i mchog nyid phun sum tshogs pa ste sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bde ba'i mchog ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: The vows are the three beginning with “of all tathagatas,” which are the perfection of being the supreme queen of all tathagatas, the supreme bliss of body, speech, and mind.🔽The three are the perfection of supreme bliss,

original: gsum gyi bde mchog phun sum chog / zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum gyi bde mchog phun sum chog / zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: as it is said.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du sku mdog dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po dang ser po dag yin no //
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du sku mdog dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po dang ser po dag yin no //
translated: These four are, respectively, white, black, red, and yellow.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ni de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ni de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'i sku'o //
translated: Vairochana is the eternal body of the tathagata.

original: de'i rdo rje ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthar byed pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i rdo rje ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthar byed pa'i ye shes so //
translated: His vajra is the gnosis that destroys the discordant class.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das gshin rje gshed de de'i sprul par bzhed pa'i rnam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das gshin rje gshed de de'i sprul par bzhed pa'i rnam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is also the bhagavat Yamantaka, and the samadhi focused on him is called that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi sku dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi sku dag go //
translated: All the Tathagatas are the Buddha-bodies.

original: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ni mngon par 'dod pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ni mngon par 'dod pa thams cad do //
translated: Their mandala is the desire for all things.

original: des byin gyis brlabs pa ni bsrung bas te gshin rje gshed nyid do //
analyzed: des byin gyis brlabs pa ni bsrung bas te gshin rje gshed nyid do //
translated: Blessed by that, he is protected, and he is Yamantaka.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsnyengs par @218a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsnyengs par @218a * //
translated: All the Tathagatas are frightened by him,

original: byed pa ni rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'jigs par byed pa yin la de nyid ni gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: byed pa ni rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'jigs par byed pa yin la de nyid ni gshin rje gshed do //
translated: because he frightens his opponents, and he is Yamantaka.

original: tshul des bzhugs so zhes bya ba ste g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas tshar gcod pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul des bzhugs so zhes bya ba ste g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas tshar gcod pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He abides in that way, that is, he abides in the posture of left leg extended, in the posture of subjugation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par byang chub pa ni thugs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par byang chub pa ni thugs so //
translated: The enlightenment of all the Tathagatas is the mind.

original: de'i rdo rje ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad par byed pa'i ye shes te de yang shes rab mthar byed do //
analyzed: de'i rdo rje ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad par byed pa'i ye shes te de yang shes rab mthar byed do //
translated: His vajra is the wisdom that destroys the opponents, and that is Prajna-bhairava.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor ni thugs kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor ni thugs kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The mandala of all the Tathagatas is the nature of the mind.

original: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The vajra is the Tathagatas.

original: de'i dam tshig ni thugs so //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni thugs so //
translated: Their commitment is their mind.

original: de dag bsnyengs par byed pa ni rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs skrag par byed pa ste shes rab mthar byed do //
analyzed: de dag bsnyengs par byed pa ni rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs skrag par byed pa ste shes rab mthar byed do //
translated: He terrifies them, he terrifies his resistant tendencies, and he is the Knowledge Wisdom Lord of Death.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos rin po che ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i gsung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos rin po che ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i gsung ngo //
translated: The jewel of the Dharma of all the Tathagatas is their very pure speech.

original: de rnams kyi 'byung gnas ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthar byed pa yin pa'i phyir te de yang padma mthar byed yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'byung gnas ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthar byed pa yin pa'i phyir te de yang padma mthar byed yin no //
translated: The source of that is the Lord of Death who terminates its resistant tendency, and he is the Lotus Lord of Death.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags 'chang ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gsung gi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags 'chang ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gsung gi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The mandala of the bearer of the passion of all the Tathagatas is the nature of speech.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung ni padma mthar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung ni padma mthar byed do //
translated: The speech of all the Tathagatas is the Lotus Lord of Death.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs de rnams kyi rdo rje ni bgegs mthar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs de rnams kyi rdo rje ni bgegs mthar byed do //
translated: The vajra of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas is the Obstacles Lord of Death.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni bgegs mthar byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni bgegs mthar byed de /
translated: The body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas is Vighnantakrt,

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs bsrung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs bsrung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he protects the body, speech, and mind.

original: sdom ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sdom ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The summary is stated with “the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas, etc. ”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs de rnams kyis mnyes par byed pa ni rangs par byas pa ste mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs de rnams kyis mnyes par byed pa ni rangs par byas pa ste mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The satisfaction of those body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas is the delight of them, because it destroys the discordant class.

original: de'i don gyi dkyil 'khor gyi dam tshig gi sems dpa' ni 'da' bar mi bya ba'i skyes bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i don gyi dkyil 'khor gyi dam tshig gi sems dpa' ni 'da' bar mi bya ba'i skyes bu yin no //
translated: The being who is the commitment being of the mandala of that meaning is the one who should not be transgressed.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po yin no //
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po yin no //
translated: These four are black, white, red, and black, respectively.

original: de ltar lha bcu gsum po de dag dkyil 'khor 'di la gnas ji lta ba bzhin du dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lha bcu gsum po de dag dkyil 'khor 'di la gnas ji lta ba bzhin du dgod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, those thirteen deities should be arranged in this mandala in their proper places.

original: gzhan gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa mchod pa'i lha mo drug po mtshams drug tu dgod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa mchod pa'i lha mo drug po mtshams drug tu dgod par bya ste /
translated: The other six goddesses of offering, such as Rupavajra, are placed in the six directions.

original: 'di ltar dkyil 'khor chen po ni mchod pa dang bral bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes sngon gyi slob dpon dag 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dkyil 'khor chen po ni mchod pa dang bral bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes sngon gyi slob dpon dag 'dod do //
translated: Thus, the great mandala is not suitable without offerings, as the former masters assert.

original: 'di ltar @218b le'u bcu drug pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar @218b le'u bcu drug pa las kyang /
translated: Thus, the sixteenth chapter also states:🔽The supreme vajra of body, speech, and mind

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje mchog / grva rnams kun du dgod par bya //🔽zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje mchog / grva rnams kun du dgod par bya // zhes 'byung ste /
translated: should be placed in all the corners.

original: de la sku'i rdo rje'i mchog ma ni spyan no //
analyzed: de la sku'i rdo rje'i mchog ma ni spyan no //
translated: There, Locana is the supreme vajra of body.

original: gsung gi rdo rje'i mchog ma ni gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje'i mchog ma ni gos dkar mo'o //
translated: Pāṇḍaravāsinī is the supreme vajra of speech.

original: thugs kyi rdo rje'i mchog ma ni m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo rje'i mchog ma ni m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: Māmakī is the supreme vajra of mind.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i mchog ma ni mchod pa'i lha mo dang / sgrol ma ste bdun no //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i mchog ma ni mchod pa'i lha mo dang / sgrol ma ste bdun no //
translated: The supreme vajras of body, speech, and mind are the seven goddesses of offering and Tārā.

original: gzhan dag na re rtsa ba'i sgo'i ngos gnyis su lha mo dgod pa bzhin du sgo thams cad du yang ste de la sku ni sa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rtsa ba'i sgo'i ngos gnyis su lha mo dgod pa bzhin du sgo thams cad du yang ste de la sku ni sa'i snying po'o //
translated: Others say that just as goddesses are placed on both sides of the main gate, they are also placed on all the gates. There, Body is Kṣitigarbha.

original: gsung ni 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
analyzed: gsung ni 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
translated: Speech is Lokeśvara.

original: thugs ni phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: thugs ni phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: Mind is Vajrapāṇi.

original: rdo rje gsum bsdus pas na rdo rje ste nam mkha'i snying po dang sgrib pa sel ba dang kun du bzang po'o /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum bsdus pas na rdo rje ste nam mkha'i snying po dang sgrib pa sel ba dang kun du bzang po'o /
translated: Since the three vajras are included, they are vajras, namely Ākāśagarbha, Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin, and Samantabhadra.

original: mchog ni lha mo bcu ste /
analyzed: mchog ni lha mo bcu ste /
translated: The supreme ones are the ten goddesses.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje mchog gi sgras ni bcu drug bzung ste grvar kun du dgod par bzung ngo //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje mchog gi sgras ni bcu drug bzung ste grvar kun du dgod par bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “supreme vajras of body, speech, and mind” refers to the sixteen, and they are to be placed in the corners.

original: gzhan du na kun zhes smos pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na kun zhes smos pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the term “all” would be meaningless.

original: de dag kyang gleng gzhi'i gzhung dang dkyil 'khor chen po'i bstod pa las nges par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang gleng gzhi'i gzhung dang dkyil 'khor chen po'i bstod pa las nges par byas pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, they are to be ascertained from the Introduction chapter and the praise of the great maṇḍala.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang sa'i snying po la sogs pa lnga'i sku mdog ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang sa'i snying po la sogs pa lnga'i sku mdog ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang 'dra'o //
translated: The colors of the five such as form and the five such as Ākāśagarbha are like the five tathāgatas.

original: rdo rje 'chang dang chos kyi dbyings dang kun du bzang po'i yang rnam par snang mdzad kyi dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang dang chos kyi dbyings dang kun du bzang po'i yang rnam par snang mdzad kyi dang 'dra'o //
translated: Vajradhara, Dharmadhātu, and Samantabhadra are also like Vairocana.

original: rgyud 'dir yang lha thams cad phyag drug pa dang phyag mtshan lnga can te /
analyzed: rgyud 'dir yang lha thams cad phyag drug pa dang phyag mtshan lnga can te /
translated: In this tantra, all the deities have six arms and five implements.

original: le'u bcu gsum pa las /
analyzed: le'u bcu gsum pa las /
translated: The thirteenth chapter says:

original: rdo rje phyag drug mtshon cha ni //
analyzed: rdo rje phyag drug mtshon cha ni //
translated: Meditate on the six-armed vajra

original: bzang po sna tshogs bsnams par bsgom //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzang po sna tshogs bsnams par bsgom // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: holding various good weapons.

original: lha rnams kyi phyag mtshan re rer gsungs pa gang yin pa de yang de rnams kyi khyad par gyi phyag mtshan yin par rigs te lhag ma bzhi ni rigs pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi phyag mtshan re rer gsungs pa gang yin pa de yang de rnams kyi khyad par gyi phyag mtshan yin par rigs te lhag ma bzhi ni rigs pas shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the implements of the deities are their special implements. The remaining four should be understood through reasoning.

original: de la rigs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rigs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The reasoning is as follows.

original: le'u bcu gsum pa las phyag mtshan rnams kyi dang po bstan pa de ni de rnams kyi gtso bo bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: le'u bcu gsum pa las phyag mtshan rnams kyi dang po bstan pa de ni de rnams kyi gtso bo bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The teaching of the implements in the thirteenth chapter is for the purpose of teaching their main implements.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po kho na yin no //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po kho na yin no //
translated: Moreover, they are only the five transcendent ones.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag mtshan rnams kyang ci rigs par lha rnams kyi phyag la yang brje bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag mtshan rnams kyang ci rigs par lha rnams kyi phyag la yang brje bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the implements of the transcendent ones should be exchanged with the implements of the deities as appropriate.

original: de la mi bskyod pa'i ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyang phyag mtshan yin la de'i ye shes kyang yin te /
analyzed: de la mi bskyod pa'i ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyang phyag mtshan yin la de'i ye shes kyang yin te /
translated: The mudra of Akshobhya is the dharma realm itself, because it is the nature of the gnosis of the dharma realm.

original: le'u bcu gsum pa las /🔽tshogs gnyis @219a * //
analyzed: le'u bcu gsum pa las / tshogs gnyis @219a * //
translated: The thirteenth chapter of the Gnosis Vajra Compendium Tantra says:

original: dang ni ldan pa yis //
analyzed: dang ni ldan pa yis //
translated: By possessing the two stores,🔽the supreme mudra of Akshobhya

original: mi bskyod pa yi rgya mchog dang / zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa yi rgya mchog dang / zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is the dharma realm, the nature of gnosis.

original: de bas na de'i phyag mtshan 'di gnyi ga gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na de'i phyag mtshan 'di gnyi ga gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, these two mudras of Akshobhya should be applied to the others as well,

original: shes rab dang ye shes la brten pa nyid kyis ni shin tu gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes la brten pa nyid kyis ni shin tu gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the most important, based on wisdom and gnosis.

original: de bas na thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi lha rnams rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis shes rab la 'khyud pa can yin la shes rab kyi rang bzhin yang de gnyis kyis thabs la 'khyud pa can yin no //
analyzed: de bas na thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi lha rnams rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis shes rab la 'khyud pa can yin la shes rab kyi rang bzhin yang de gnyis kyis thabs la 'khyud pa can yin no //
translated: Therefore, the deities who are the nature of method have two principal hands embracing wisdom, and the deities who are the nature of wisdom have two principal hands embracing method.

original: thams cad kyi g-yas pa'i gnyis pas khyad par gyi phyag mtshan bsnams pa yin la cig shos gsum la ni gsum ste de la g-yas pa'i gsum pas ni ral gri'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi g-yas pa'i gnyis pas khyad par gyi phyag mtshan bsnams pa yin la cig shos gsum la ni gsum ste de la g-yas pa'i gsum pas ni ral gri'o //
translated: The second right hand of all of them holds the special hand implement, while the other three hold the three. The third right hand holds a sword.

original: g-yon la ni go rims bzhin du nor bu dang padma'o //
analyzed: g-yon la ni go rims bzhin du nor bu dang padma'o //
translated: The left hands hold a jewel and a lotus, respectively.

original: gnas 'phrog par byed pa'i gnas la ni 'khor lo yin te gti mug nyid kyi dang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas 'phrog par byed pa'i gnas la ni 'khor lo yin te gti mug nyid kyi dang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wheel is in the place of the one who steals the place, because delusion is the first.

original: gang dag la khyad par gyi mtshan ma 'khor lo med pa de dag gi thun mong du gti mug gi mtshan ma lus nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang dag la khyad par gyi mtshan ma 'khor lo med pa de dag gi thun mong du gti mug gi mtshan ma lus nyid yin no //
translated: The body itself is the sign of delusion in common for those who do not have the special sign of the wheel.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni ma yin te de dag gi nang nas rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis 'khyud pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni ma yin te de dag gi nang nas rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis 'khyud pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not the realm of phenomena, because the two root hands embrace within that.

original: rdo rje can dag gi g-yas kyi gnyis pa la rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can dag gi g-yas kyi gnyis pa la rdo rje'o //
translated: The second right hand of the vajra holders holds a vajra.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ni chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya ste khyad par gyi phyag mtshan gyi don yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ni chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya ste khyad par gyi phyag mtshan gyi don yin no //
translated: The dharma realm has the mudra of the source of phenomena, which is the meaning of the special hand implement.

original: sku mdog gi rigs la ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: sku mdog gi rigs la ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The types of body color have already been explained.

original: rnam par dag pa'i dbye ba ni la lar rnam pa gzhan du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dbye ba ni la lar rnam pa gzhan du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The classification of purity is sometimes different.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: 'khor lo nam mkha'i dbyings dang rdo rje dang // nor bu 'dam skyes ral gri phyag mtshan yin //
analyzed: 'khor lo nam mkha'i dbyings dang rdo rje dang // nor bu 'dam skyes ral gri phyag mtshan yin //
translated: The emblems are the wheel, the sky-treasury, the vajra, the jewel, the lotus, and the sword.

original: rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis yid 'ong gis mtshan can //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis yid 'ong gis mtshan can //
translated: The two principal hands are marked with the beautiful.

original: g-yas pa'i gnyis pas kyang ni rang phyag mtshan //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i gnyis pas kyang ni rang phyag mtshan //
translated: The second right hand also has its own emblem.

original: gsum la cig shos rnams te g-yas ral gri //
analyzed: gsum la cig shos rnams te g-yas ral gri //
translated: The third is the other, and the right is the sword.

original: yid 'ong ldan phyir rdo rje nam mkha' min //
analyzed: yid 'ong ldan phyir rdo rje nam mkha' min //
translated: Because of possessing the beautiful, the vajra is not the sky.

original: zhal dkar sems kyi dbang phyug 'khor lo ni //
analyzed: zhal dkar sems kyi dbang phyug 'khor lo ni //
translated: The white face is the lord of the mind, the wheel.

original: gnas 'phrog byed pa'i gnas su 'gro bar byed //
analyzed: gnas 'phrog byed pa'i gnas su 'gro bar byed //
translated: It goes to the place of the one who steals the place.

original: snying po mtshan ma sems dang 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: snying po mtshan ma sems dang 'dra ba ste //
translated: The sign of the essence is like the mind.🔽The sword is blue like the sky, and the nine-part jewel is green.

original: ral gri nam mkha' lta bur sngo ba dang // nor bu cha dgu pa can ljang gu'i mdog / dung chos nya phyis ri bong can bzhin dkar //
analyzed: ral gri nam mkha' lta bur sngo ba dang // nor bu cha dgu pa can ljang gu'i mdog / dung chos nya phyis ri bong can bzhin dkar //
translated: The conch is white like a conch, oyster, and rabbit.

original: dang po'i rdo rje dmar ba'i rang bzhin can //
analyzed: dang po'i rdo rje dmar ba'i rang bzhin can //
translated: The first is the nature of red Vajra.

original: yid dang yid yul rdo rje 'chang dkar po //
analyzed: yid dang yid yul rdo rje 'chang dkar po //
translated: The mind and mental objects are white Vajradhara.🔽The gate-keepers are blue, white, red, and green, and Tara is golden.

original: sgo gnas sngo dkar dmar dang sngon po dang // sgrol ma gser mdog rnam dag dbye phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgo gnas sngo dkar dmar dang sngon po dang // sgrol ma gser mdog rnam dag dbye phyir ro // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is for the sake of purifying the distinctions.

original: le'u 'di'i bsdus @219b pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: le'u 'di'i bsdus @219b pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The summarized meaning of this chapter is as follows.

original: rgyud 'dir bsgom pa dang / bzlas pa'i dbang thob pa mos pa brtan pa byang chub kyi sems brtan pa dkon mchog gsum la gcig tu skyabs su song ba bla ma dang rdo rje 'chang la tha mi dad par mos pa blo gros dang ldan pa khengs pa med pa snying rje dang ldan
analyzed: rgyud 'dir bsgom pa dang / bzlas pa'i dbang thob pa mos pa brtan pa byang chub kyi sems brtan pa dkon mchog gsum la gcig tu skyabs su song ba bla ma dang rdo rje 'chang la tha mi dad par mos pa blo gros dang ldan pa khengs pa med pa snying rje dang ldan
translated: Here in this tantra, one who has obtained the empowerment of meditation and repetition, who has stable interest, who has stable bodhichitta, who has gone for refuge to the Three Jewels alone, who has the intelligence of the conviction that the guru is not different from Vajradhara, who is free of pride, who has compassion,

original: pa / dngos grub kyi mchog 'dod pa gang yin pa de bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag nye bar bsags pa'i phyir dang rnal 'byor dbang du bya ba'i phyir dang por sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: pa / dngos grub kyi mchog 'dod pa gang yin pa de bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag nye bar bsags pa'i phyir dang rnal 'byor dbang du bya ba'i phyir dang por sgrub pa'am /
translated: who desires the supreme spiritual power, should first practice in order to accumulate the collections of merit and wisdom, in order to become a master of yoga, and in order to purify the obscurations of the body, speech, and mind.

original: sgrub pa chen po la yun ring du mngon par brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po la yun ring du mngon par brtson par bya'o //
translated: One should strive for a long time in the great practice.

original: gang gi tshe rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor byed par 'dod na de'i tshe des dang por nang par gyi dus rang gi snying ga'i zla ba la de'i sa bon 'od zer gyi phreng ba can bsams la gdong bkru ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor byed par 'dod na de'i tshe des dang por nang par gyi dus rang gi snying ga'i zla ba la de'i sa bon 'od zer gyi phreng ba can bsams la gdong bkru ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: When one wishes to perform the yoga of Vajrasattva, then at the beginning of the day one should visualize at one’s heart a moon with its seed syllable and a garland of light rays, and one should wash one’s face and so forth.

original: de'i 'og tu bdud rtsi bab  sbyor gyi sngags kyis gnas dang bdag dang rnal 'byor bsrung ba byas la bsam gtan gyi khang pa yang tsandan bzang po la sogs pa dang me tog gi gcal bkram pas gtsang zhing dri zhim par byas pa'am /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bdud rtsi bab  sbyor gyi sngags kyis gnas dang bdag dang rnal 'byor bsrung ba byas la bsam gtan gyi khang pa yang tsandan bzang po la sogs pa dang me tog gi gcal bkram pas gtsang zhing dri zhim par byas pa'am /
translated: Then, having protected one’s place, oneself, and the yoga with the mantra of the descent of nectar, one should enter the meditation hut, which is clean and fragrant with good sandalwood and so forth and strewn with flower petals,

original: de ltar mos par byas nas zhugs te /
analyzed: de ltar mos par byas nas zhugs te /
translated: or having imagined it thus,

original: stan bde ba la 'dug nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang bcas pa thams cad mngon sum dang 'dra bar bsams te /
analyzed: stan bde ba la 'dug nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang bcas pa thams cad mngon sum dang 'dra bar bsams te /
translated: Sitting on a comfortable seat, one should visualize all the tathāgatas of all the world systems of the ten directions, together with their assemblies of bodhisattvas, as if they were actually present.🔽One should generate an uninterrupted stream of experiences of faith toward them, and make the sevenfold offering to them, which is unsurpassed:

original: de rnams la dad pa'i nyams rgyun mi 'chad par bskyed de de rnams kyi bla na med pa'i mchod pa rnam pa bdun po sangs rgyas thams cad la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de rnams la dad pa'i nyams rgyun mi 'chad par bskyed de de rnams kyi bla na med pa'i mchod pa rnam pa bdun po sangs rgyas thams cad la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage with my body, speech, and mind to all the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod pa rgya chen po thams cad kyis mchod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod pa rgya chen po thams cad kyis mchod par bgyi'o //
translated: I make offerings to all the buddhas with all the vast offerings.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bdag gis sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bdag gis sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags par bgyi'o //
translated: I confess all my misdeeds to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'phags pa dang so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi dge ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'phags pa dang so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi dge ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang bar bgyi'o //
translated: I rejoice in all the virtue of all the buddhas, bodhisattvas, noble ones, and ordinary beings.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i phyir bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i phyir bskul bar bya'o //
translated: And I will request all the Buddhas who have not long been manifestly and fully enlightened to turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhed pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la bskal pa mang por bzhugs pa'i phyir gsol ba gdab par bgyi'o //🔽bdag gi mchod pa rnam pa drug gi rang bzhin can dang dge ba @220a * //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhed pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la bskal pa mang por bzhugs pa'i phyir gsol ba gdab par bgyi'o // bdag gi mchod pa rnam pa drug gi rang bzhin can dang dge ba @220a * //
translated: And I will request all the Buddhas who are about to pass away into final nirvāṇa to remain for many eons.

original: gzhan gang yin pa de dag thams cad cho ga bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba de dag bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gang yin pa de dag thams cad cho ga bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba de dag bya'o //
translated: And I will properly dedicate all of my own six-­branched worship and whatever other virtues there are to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽Then one should go for refuge, saying:

original: de nas skyabs su 'gro bar bya ste chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad la byang chub kyi bar du skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: de nas skyabs su 'gro bar bya ste chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad la byang chub kyi bar du skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: I go for refuge to all the Buddhas, the lords of all Dharma, until enlightenment.

original: rnam pa thams cad pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos la skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: I go for refuge to the Dharma of the Great Vehicle in all its aspects.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: I go for refuge to the Sangha of irreversible Bodhisattvas.

original: de nas byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya ste /🔽kye ma'o bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can thams cad kyi don byed pas na shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi bar
analyzed: de nas byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya ste / kye ma'o bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can thams cad kyi don byed pas na shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi bar
translated: Then one should generate the mind of enlightenment:

original: la de dag gzhag par bgyi'o //
analyzed: la de dag gzhag par bgyi'o //
translated: “Alas! Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, I will benefit all sentient beings, and I will establish them in the limit of the ultimate nirvana and in the knowledge of the Tathagata.

original: de nas bdag nyid kyi dngos po dbul bar bya ste sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'bul gyis mgon po ji ltar bzhed par mdzad par bya ba'i phyir bdag so sor bzhes su gsol //
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid kyi dngos po dbul bar bya ste sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'bul gyis mgon po ji ltar bzhed par mdzad par bya ba'i phyir bdag so sor bzhes su gsol //
translated: Then one should offer oneself, saying: “I offer myself to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas. O Protectors, please accept me and do with me as you will.”

original: de nas lam la gnas par bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nas lam la gnas par bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Then one should abide in the path, as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba 'dus pa bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lam la bdag gnas par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba 'dus pa bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lam la bdag gnas par bgyi'o //
translated: I will abide in the path of unsurpassed awakening, the gathering of the secrets of all tathāgatas.

original: de nas 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du rnam par bsams la de yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam pa'i rnam pa can gyi snying rje bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du rnam par bsams la de yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam pa'i rnam pa can gyi snying rje bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, having contemplated the world of living beings as having the nature of suffering, one should cultivate compassion that has the aspect of the intention to protect them.

original: de nas sems tsam yin no zhes shes par byas la 'khrul ba'i mtshan ma gnyis su snang ba spangs nas gcig tu nam mkha' mtha' yas pa dri ma med pa lta bur 'gro ba thams cad bltas te /
analyzed: de nas sems tsam yin no zhes shes par byas la 'khrul ba'i mtshan ma gnyis su snang ba spangs nas gcig tu nam mkha' mtha' yas pa dri ma med pa lta bur 'gro ba thams cad bltas te /
translated: Then, having understood that it is merely mind, one should abandon the dualistic appearance of the signs of delusion and look at all beings as being one with stainless infinite space.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes bya ba 'dis kyang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes bya ba 'dis kyang bstan par bya'o //
translated: One should also recite this: Oṃ śūnyatā-jñāna-vajra-svabhāvātmako 'ham ( I am of the nature of the vajra of the wisdom of emptiness).

original: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i bgegs ma lus par nges par zlog par byed pa de ni sngags kyi don thams cad sgom pa'i rnam par dag pa rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //🔽de las kyang lhag par bsrung ba'i don du yi ge brum las 'khor lo dmar ser rtsibs bcu pa rgya che ba'i phyogs kyi rtsibs la sgo srung @220b rnams dang mtshams kyi rtsibs rnams la 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang dbyug sngon dang stobs po che dang mi g-yo
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i bgegs ma lus par nges par zlog par byed pa de ni sngags kyi don thams cad sgom pa'i rnam par dag pa rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin no // de las kyang lhag par bsrung ba'i don du yi ge brum las 'khor lo dmar ser rtsibs bcu pa rgya che ba'i phyogs kyi rtsibs la sgo srung @220b rnams dang mtshams kyi rtsibs rnams la 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang dbyug sngon dang stobs po che dang mi g-yo
translated: This ultimate thought of awakening is the cause for perfecting the meditation on the meaning of the mantra, which definitely stops all the hindrances of afflictions and discursive thoughts.🔽For the sake of even greater protection, one should meditate on a red-orange ten-spoked wheel arisen from bhrūṃ, with the gate guardians on the spokes of the cardinal directions, with the lords of the desire realm, Nīladaṇḍa, Mahābala, Acalanātha, and Cakravartin on the intermediate spokes, with Sumbha-niṣumbha on the nave, and with one’s own deity and so on.

original: ba dang steng gi rtsibs la 'khor los sgyur ba dang 'og gi rtsibs la gnod mdzes rdo rje dang lte bar rang gi lha la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa myur du 'khor ba bsgom bar bya zhing khro bo 'bar ba spros pa rnams kyis kyang phyogs thams
analyzed: ba dang steng gi rtsibs la 'khor los sgyur ba dang 'og gi rtsibs la gnod mdzes rdo rje dang lte bar rang gi lha la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa myur du 'khor ba bsgom bar bya zhing khro bo 'bar ba spros pa rnams kyis kyang phyogs thams
translated: The blazing wrathful ones that emanate from that wheel should be visualized as filling all the directions.

original: cad du bgegs kyi rigs kyi tshogs bskrad par rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: cad du bgegs kyi rigs kyi tshogs bskrad par rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the entire assembly of the classes of obstructors is expelled.

original: de nas bgegs rnams shin tu mi 'byung bar mos par byas la ston ka'i zla ba ltar dkar ba'i chos 'byung 'og phra zhing steng yangs pa gru gsum pa nam mkha' nang du chud par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bgegs rnams shin tu mi 'byung bar mos par byas la ston ka'i zla ba ltar dkar ba'i chos 'byung 'og phra zhing steng yangs pa gru gsum pa nam mkha' nang du chud par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, imagining that the obstructors do not appear at all, one should imagine a source of phenomena, white like the autumn moon, with a narrow base and a wide top, a triangle that fits into space.

original: de'i dbus su sna tshogs 'dab ma can gyi padma'i lte ba la gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje dang de'i lte bar zla ba dang 'khor lo dang yi ge brum dang nor bu las spros pa'i ye shes kyi rgya mtsho bsdus pa las byung ba rig pa'i rgyal
analyzed: de'i dbus su sna tshogs 'dab ma can gyi padma'i lte ba la gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje dang de'i lte bar zla ba dang 'khor lo dang yi ge brum dang nor bu las spros pa'i ye shes kyi rgya mtsho bsdus pa las byung ba rig pa'i rgyal
translated: In its center, on the center of a multicolored lotus, is a multicolored vajra cross, in the center of which is a moon, a wheel, the syllable bhrūṃ, and a jewel. original: mo'i tshogs yongs su gyur pa las sna tshogs pa'i 'od zer can nor bu'i rang bzhin can gyi gzhal yas khang thar pa chen po'i grong khyer gyi rang bzhin can /

analyzed: zur bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //

analyzed: de nas dbus su gnas pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sangs rgyas rnams kyi yon tan gyi sa bon dbyangs kyi yi ge dkar po bcu drug yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rgyas par gyur pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid

translated: In its center, the thirty-four syllables to be clarified transform into a first-part vajra, which is red like a ruby and is the nature of the timeless awareness of equality.

original: de'i lte ba la yi ge h'um de nyid ni mnyam pa nyid la des par spyod pa nyid kyi phyir so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can no //

original: 'od zer des dkyil 'khor ba thams cad kyi mchog spro ba dang bsdus pa ni bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can yin par bsgoms nas zla ba dang rdo rje dang sngags yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i sku chos kyi dbyings shin🔽tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can no //

translated: The body that arises from the moon, vajra, and mantra is the nature of the gnosis of the utterly pure realm of phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang po'i skyes bu ston ka'i zla ba ltar dkar ba zhal dkar ba dang sngo ba dang dmar ba can rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis rang snang ba'i rig ma la yongs su 'khyud pa /

translated: The assembly of the five families is included in the five consorts, and the two Pāṇḍaravāsinīs are made into one, and they are placed on the moons in the four directions.

original: de nas rang gi snying gar de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bzhugs pa zhu bas bdag nyid 'khor dang bcas pa dbang bskur nas ba spu'i bu ga la sogs pa'i khung bu las zhugs pa'i chu des zhu bar gyur la /

translated: Then, the five tathāgatas residing in one’s heart melt, and having conferred empowerment on oneself and the retinue, the water that enters through the pores of the body and so on causes one to melt.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor pa thams cad zhu bar gyur pa de'i 'od kyis yab dang yum dag ro gcig par zhu bar gyur te /
