translated: In the same way, the entire maṇḍala and maṇḍala residents melt, and the light of that causes the father and mother to melt into one taste.

original: sgrib pa med cing dag pa'i nam mkha'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin can shin tu dkar ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor stug po'i rnam par bdag nyid zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas par bsam par bya'o //

translated: One should imagine oneself as the nature of the realm of space, free of obscurations, with the appearance of a thick, very white moon maṇḍala, abiding in the moon maṇḍala.

original: de'i 'od zer phyogs bcur rnam par 'phros pas sems can gyi 'jig rten ma lus pa dbang bskur te yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'od zer phyogs bcur rnam par 'phros pas sems can gyi 'jig rten ma lus pa dbang bskur te yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //

original: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin de las bslang bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad rtsol med par m'a ma k'i la sogs pa lha mo bzhis bskul ba'i glus bskul bar bsam par bya'o //

translated: Then, in order to arouse him from that meditative concentration, one should imagine that he is aroused by the song of the four goddesses such as Māmakī, who are urging him on without effort.

analyzed: sems can khams ni gnas kyi dbang phyug khyod ni rdo rje'i thugs //

analyzed: dga' ba yid 'ong don chen 'dod pas bdag la bskyab tu gsol //

analyzed: mgon po gal te de ring bdag ni gson par mchis bzhed na ;

analyzed: rdo rje'i sku khyod bka' yi 'khor los sems can kun la phan //

analyzed: de'i 'og tu thugs ka'i zla ba la rang gi mtshan ma dang sa bon yongs su gyur pa las dam tshig sems dpa'i rnam pa can gyi ye shes sems dpa' de'i thugs ka la zla ba dang rdo rje dang sa bon gyis byin gyis brlabs par bsams nas
translated: One should imagine that the heart of the gnosis being is blessed by a moon, vajra, and seed syllable.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa'i ye shes sems dpa' rdo rje 'chang chen po bkug cing bcug la /

translated: One should bind him with the yoga of nonduality, bring him under control, and bless him.🔽One should stabilize him with the mantra, “Oṃ, I am the dharmadhātu vajra nature.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis brtan par bya'o //
translated: One should stabilize it with the mantra “Oṁ, you who are the essence of the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas, hūṁ hūṁ, phaṭ phaṭ, svāhā.”🔽

translated: Below that, on a moon disk, Vajra Mind is like Vajrapani, arisen from a vajra and seed syllable, and blessed with a moon, vajra, and seed syllable at his heart.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs rdo rje yang dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba dang dbang du byas shing des byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs rdo rje yang dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba dang dbang du byas shing des byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Having summoned, caused to enter, bound, and controlled the vajra mind of all tathagatas, he is blessed by that.

analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta tsitta badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes bya bas de brtan par bya'o //
translated: One should stabilize that with Om, I am the nature of the vajra mind of all tathagatas.

original: de bzhin du spyi bor zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la 'khor lo dang / aom las byung ba'i sku rdo rje sa'i snying po lta bur bsams nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi bor zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la 'khor lo dang / aom las byung ba'i sku rdo rje sa'i snying po lta bur bsams nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Similarly, on a moon disk at the crown, one should imagine Body Vajra arisen from a wheel and Om, like Kshitigarbha, blessed by the vajra body of all tathagatas.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes bya bas brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes bya bas brtan par bya'o //
translated: One should stabilize it with Om, I am the vajra nature of the body of all Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin du lkog mar zla ba padma dang / a'a: las byung ba'i gsung gi rdo rje 'jig rten dbang phyug lta bur bsams nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: de bzhin du lkog mar zla ba padma dang / a'a: las byung ba'i gsung gi rdo rje 'jig rten dbang phyug lta bur bsams nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Likewise, at the throat, one should imagine a moon lotus and a A, from which arises Vajra Speech, like Lokeshvara, consecrated by the vajra speech of all Tathagatas.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga t'a wa ka badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes bya bas brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga t'a wa ka badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes bya bas brtan par bya'o //
translated: One should stabilize it with Om, I am the vajra nature of the speech of all Tathagatas.🔽 Then, the seed syllable in the heart of the wisdom-being, being fully activated by light rays, all the Tathagatas in the ten directions come to the sky.

original: de nas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis yang dag par bskul ba'i phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nam mkha'i ngos la byon pa rnams kyi thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer las byung ba'i rig pa'i lha mo rnams kyis
analyzed: de nas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis yang dag par bskul ba'i phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nam mkha'i ngos la byon pa rnams kyi thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer las byung ba'i rig pa'i lha mo rnams kyis
translated: The knowledge goddesses that arise from the light rays from the seed syllables in their hearts

original: ci rigs par phyag na gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang rol mo dang rin po che'i bum pa la sogs pa thogs pa rnams kyis dri ma med pa'i ye shes kyi chus bdag nyid dbang bskur bar gyur pa dang de las byung ba'i rig pa dang bcas pa'i mi
analyzed: ci rigs par phyag na gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang rol mo dang rin po che'i bum pa la sogs pa thogs pa rnams kyis dri ma med pa'i ye shes kyi chus bdag nyid dbang bskur bar gyur pa dang de las byung ba'i rig pa dang bcas pa'i mi
translated: One should imagine that one is empowered by oneself with the water of stainless intuition, holding a parasol, a victory banner, a musical instrument, a precious vase, and so on, in one's hands, and that one is endowed with the awareness born from that.

original: bskyod pa dang bcas pa rin po che'i cod pan can bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bskyod pa dang bcas pa rin po che'i cod pan can bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that one is endowed with Akṣobhya, and has a precious diadem.

original: de'i 'og tu mdun gyi gdan la rigs kyi rig pa thugs ka'i phyag mtshan dang sa bon tsam las bskyed de mngon par phyogs par byas la snga ma bzhin du mig dang lus la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mdun gyi gdan la rigs kyi rig pa thugs ka'i phyag mtshan dang sa bon tsam las bskyed de mngon par phyogs par byas la snga ma bzhin du mig dang lus la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Then, on the seat in front of oneself, one should generate the awareness of the family, merely from the insignia and seed at one's heart, and cause it to face oneself. As before, one should bless one's eyes, body, and so on,

original: de bzhin du dbang bskur la chags pa dang bcas shing chags pa dang bcas pa'i mig gis blta ba bsams la rang gi rig pa dang gnyis su med par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang bskur la chags pa dang bcas shing chags pa dang bcas pa'i mig gis blta ba bsams la rang gi rig pa dang gnyis su med par bya'o //
translated: and similarly empower oneself. One should imagine that one looks with eyes of passion and passionlessness, and become nondual with one's awareness.

original: @223a * // de nas de'i spyi bo dang snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang ba dang brla rtsa rnams la go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: @223a * // de nas de'i spyi bo dang snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang ba dang brla rtsa rnams la go rims bzhin du /
translated: Then, on his crown, heart, navel, secret place, and thighs, respectively,

original: aom h'um sv'a a'a:h'a zhes bya ba'i rig pa bkod la /
analyzed: aom h'um sv'a a'a:h'a zhes bya ba'i rig pa bkod la /
translated: one should arrange the awarenesses oṃ, hūṃ, svā, āḥ, and hā.

original: de spros pa las snying ga'i bar dang lte ba'i bar dang rked pa nas gsang ba'i bar dang brla rtsa nas rkang pa'i mthil gyi bar du dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po dang ljang gur bya'o //
analyzed: de spros pa las snying ga'i bar dang lte ba'i bar dang rked pa nas gsang ba'i bar dang brla rtsa nas rkang pa'i mthil gyi bar du dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po dang ljang gur bya'o //
translated: From their emanation, one should make white, black, red, and green lines from the heart to the navel, from the waist to the secret place, and from the thighs to the soles of the feet.

original: de'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu /
translated: Then,

original: h'um a'a:h'a aom /🔽zhes bya ba de dag gis go rims bzhin du padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa la de'i nor bu zur gsum mu tig gi 'od can rjes su mthun pa'i bu ga can rdo rje dmar po rtse mo shin tu sbas pa de'i nor bu mu tig gi
analyzed: h'um a'a:h'a aom / zhes bya ba de dag gis go rims bzhin du padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa la de'i nor bu zur gsum mu tig gi 'od can rjes su mthun pa'i bu ga can rdo rje dmar po rtse mo shin tu sbas pa de'i nor bu mu tig gi
translated: hūṃ, āḥ, hā, and oṃ

original: 'od can bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od can bskyed par bya'o //
translated: respectively generate an eight-petaled red lotus with a jewel in its center, which has the luster of a pearl, a corresponding hole, a red vajra with a very hidden tip, and a jewel in its center that has the luster of a pearl.

original: de nas / aa nu r'a ga ya mi h'um zhes brjod la dga' ba brtsam par bya ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bla na med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba mngon sum du byas la /🔽aom sarba tath'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a la a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: de nas / aa nu r'a ga ya mi h'um zhes brjod la dga' ba brtsam par bya ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bla na med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba mngon sum du byas la / aom sarba tath'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a la a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Then, saying “anurāgya yami hūṃ,” one should begin the lovemaking, and having actualized the unsurpassed bliss and mental joy of all the tathāgatas,

original: zhes bya bas kyang byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas kyang byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: one should also bless oneself with “oṃ sarvatathāgata anurāgaṇa vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.”

original: de nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pas mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pas mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Then, one should make offerings, praises, and taste the elixir, and so on, with the procedure that will be explained.🔽Thus, this is the method called “accomplishment.”

original: de ltar na sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i thabs yin te le'u bco brgyad pa las kyang /
analyzed: de ltar na sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i thabs yin te le'u bco brgyad pa las kyang /
translated: The eighteenth chapter of the Cakrasaṃvara Tantra says:🔽I pay homage to that bodhicitta, which is like a vajra,

original: gang zhig thog ma med dngos rnam dag 'di bsgom pa //
analyzed: gang zhig thog ma med dngos rnam dag 'di bsgom pa //
translated: the meditation on this pure thing that is beginningless,

original: thabs dang shes rab las byung dpe dang rnam par bral //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab las byung dpe dang rnam par bral //
translated: arisen from method and wisdom, free from examples,

original: gsang ba dbang bskur brtul zhugs sdom pa sbyor la rtag / byang chub rdo rje 'dra lta de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gsang ba dbang bskur brtul zhugs sdom pa sbyor la rtag / byang chub rdo rje 'dra lta de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: always engaged in the secret empowerment, conduct, vow, and union.

original: zhes 'chad pas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad pas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it will be explained.

original: sgrub pa chen po la mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa med par sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi ngo bo chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin ngo
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po la mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa med par sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi ngo bo chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin ngo
translated: In the great practice, without worship, praise, and so on, the essence of the enlightenment of the Buddha, which has the characteristic of the extremely pure realm of truth, the nature of great bliss, which is of one taste with all the qualities of the Buddha,

original: bo nyid kyi sku'i bdag nyid can 'di ni dang po'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang po'o //
analyzed: bo nyid kyi sku'i bdag nyid can 'di ni dang po'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang po'o //
translated: this very nature body, is the first concentration called the first union.

original: de ltar dang po'i sbyor ba rdzogs nas don dam pa'i dga' ba la gnas pa'i sngags pas dga' ba de nyid /
analyzed: de ltar dang po'i sbyor ba rdzogs nas don dam pa'i dga' ba la gnas pa'i sngags pas dga' ba de nyid /
translated: Thus, having completed the first union, the mantra practitioner who abides in ultimate joy should bless that very joy

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes bya bas byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes bya bas byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: with Oṃ sarva tathāgata anurāgaṇa vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.

original: snying po'i sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bkug la bcug ste rnam par zhu ba'i nor @223b bu'i bu ga nas nor bu'i bu gar zhugs te zla ba zhu ba'i dkyil 'khor du gyur par bsam par bya'o //🔽de bsdus pa las byung ba'i rang gi sa bon gdan dang bcas pa rnam par bsams la de nyid las dkyil 'khor pa thams cad re re zhing rdo rje dam tshig gsum gyis bskyed la bzhi pas gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: snying po'i sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bkug la bcug ste rnam par zhu ba'i nor @223b bu'i bu ga nas nor bu'i bu gar zhugs te zla ba zhu ba'i dkyil 'khor du gyur par bsam par bya'o // de bsdus pa las byung ba'i rang gi sa bon gdan dang bcas pa rnam par bsams la de nyid las dkyil 'khor pa thams cad re re zhing rdo rje dam tshig gsum gyis bskyed la bzhi pas gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that light rays from the seed syllable of the essence gather all the tathāgatas, and having entered, they enter the hole of the jewel from the hole of the jewel, and melt into the moon maṇḍala.🔽From that, one should imagine one’s own seed syllable with the seat, and from that very [syllable] one should generate all the maṇḍala [beings] with the three vajra pledges, and one should place them with the fourth [pledge].

original: de la dang por sa bon de nyid las badzra dhrik ces bya ba 'dis khro bo'i rigs nam mkha'i gtos thams cad khyab pa can spros nas bsdus pa las byung ba'i mi bskyod pa cig aindra n'i la lta bu zhal nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po
analyzed: de la dang por sa bon de nyid las badzra dhrik ces bya ba 'dis khro bo'i rigs nam mkha'i gtos thams cad khyab pa can spros nas bsdus pa las byung ba'i mi bskyod pa cig aindra n'i la lta bu zhal nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po
translated: There, first, from that very seed syllable, one should emanate the vajra family wrathful ones, filling the entire vault of space, with this [mantra], vajra-dhṛk. Having gathered them, one should generate Akṣobhya arisen from the gathering, the color of sapphire, with a black, white, and red face,

original: can 'bar zhing mche ba cung zad gtsigs pa ral ba'i thor tshugs can rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis rang sdang ba'i rig ma la 'khyud pa can /
analyzed: can 'bar zhing mche ba cung zad gtsigs pa ral ba'i thor tshugs can rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis rang sdang ba'i rig ma la 'khyud pa can /
translated: He is blazing, with slightly bared fangs, with hair in a topknot, with his two principal hands embracing his natural knowledge consort,🔽and with the remaining hands holding a vajra, a sword, a gem, and a lotus.

original: lhag mas rdo rje dang ral gri dang nor bu dang padma bsnams pa bsams la de phyung ste bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs la rang gi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi nang du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag mas rdo rje dang ral gri dang nor bu dang padma bsnams pa bsams la de phyung ste bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs la rang gi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi nang du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having emanated him, he should be inserted into the body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat, into one's own body, speech, and mind.

original: de nyid las dzi na dzi ka ces bya ba 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs spro ba dang bsdu ba las byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad ston ka'i zla ba lta bu zhal dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po can zhi ba rang snang ba'i rig ma
analyzed: de nyid las dzi na dzi ka ces bya ba 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs spro ba dang bsdu ba las byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad ston ka'i zla ba lta bu zhal dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po can zhi ba rang snang ba'i rig ma
translated: From that very [tantra], Jinajik [means] emanating and gathering the Tathagata lineage, and [means] Vairochana, who is like an autumn moon, with a white, black, and red face, peaceful, embracing his natural knowledge consort,

original: la 'khyud pa can /
analyzed: la 'khyud pa can /
translated: and with the remaining hands holding a wheel, a jewel, a lotus, and a sword.

original: lhag mas 'khor lo dang ral gri dang nor bu dang padma bsnams pa rnam par bsams la snga ma bzhin du byung ste shar phyogs kyi zla ba la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag mas 'khor lo dang ral gri dang nor bu dang padma bsnams pa rnam par bsams la snga ma bzhin du byung ste shar phyogs kyi zla ba la dgod par bya'o //
translated: Having visualized the remaining [deities] holding a wheel, sword, gem, and lotus, as before, they should be emitted and placed on the moon in the east.

original: de nyid las ratna dhrik ces bya ba 'dis rig pa'i rgyal po'i rigs spro ba dang bsdu ba las byung ba'i rin chen 'byung ldan gser bcom lta bu zhal ser po dang nag po dang dkar po can nor bu dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang padma bsnams
analyzed: de nyid las ratna dhrik ces bya ba 'dis rig pa'i rgyal po'i rigs spro ba dang bsdu ba las byung ba'i rin chen 'byung ldan gser bcom lta bu zhal ser po dang nag po dang dkar po can nor bu dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang padma bsnams
translated: From that very [syllable], by Ratnasaṃbhava, the king of awareness families is emitted and absorbed, and one should visualize Ratnasaṃbhava, the color of refined gold, with a yellow, black, and white face, holding a gem, sword, wheel, and lotus,

original: pa rnam par bsams la lto phyogs kyi nyi ma la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: pa rnam par bsams la lto phyogs kyi nyi ma la dgod par bya'o //
translated: and place him on the sun in the southeast.🔽From that very [syllable], by Ārolikā, the queen of awareness families is emitted and absorbed, and one should visualize Amitābha, the color of a padmarāga gem, with a red, black, and white face, holding a lotus, sword, gem,

original: de nyid las a'a ro li ka ces bya ba 'dis rig pa'i rgyal mo'i rigs spro ba dang bsdu ba las byung ba'i 'od dpag tu med pa padma r'a ga lta bu zhal dmar po dang nag po dang dkar po can padma dang ral gri dang nor bu
analyzed: de nyid las a'a ro li ka ces bya ba 'dis rig pa'i rgyal mo'i rigs spro ba dang bsdu ba las byung ba'i 'od dpag tu med pa padma r'a ga lta bu zhal dmar po dang nag po dang dkar po can padma dang ral gri dang nor bu
translated: and wheel,🔽and place him on the moon in the south.

original: dang 'khor lo bsnams par bsams la nub kyi nyi ma la dgod par bya'o //🔽de nyid las pradzny'a dhrik ces bya ba 'dis mchod pa'i lha mo'i rigs spro ba dang bsdu ba las byung ba'i gdon mi za bar grub pa nor bu ma rgad lta bu zhal ljang gu dang nag po dang dkar po can ral gri dang 'khor lo dang nor🔽bu dang padma bsnams pa bsgoms la byang gi @224a * //
analyzed: dang 'khor lo bsnams par bsams la nub kyi nyi ma la dgod par bya'o // de nyid las pradzny'a dhrik ces bya ba 'dis mchod pa'i lha mo'i rigs spro ba dang bsdu ba las byung ba'i gdon mi za bar grub pa nor bu ma rgad lta bu zhal ljang gu dang nag po dang dkar po can ral gri dang 'khor lo dang nor bu dang padma bsnams pa bsgoms la byang gi @224a * //
translated: One should imagine that he holds a sword and a wheel, and one should place him in the western sun.

original: nyi ma la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma la dgod par bya'o //
translated: By this, “prajñādhṛk,” one should emanate and gather the family of the offering goddesses, and one should meditate on the inevitable accomplishment, which is like a wish-fulfilling gem, with a green, black, and white face, holding a sword, wheel, gem, and lotus, and one should place him in the northern sun.

original: lnga po de dag ni ral ba'i thor tshugs can yin no //
analyzed: lnga po de dag ni ral ba'i thor tshugs can yin no //
translated: Those five have matted hair.

original: de nyid las mo ha ra t'i zhes bya ba 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku rdo rje'i sprin spros te gti mug dga' ma'i gzugs su bsdus pa las byung ba'i spyan ston ka'i zla ba lta bu gtso bo dang rjes su mthun par zhal gsum
analyzed: de nyid las mo ha ra t'i zhes bya ba 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku rdo rje'i sprin spros te gti mug dga' ma'i gzugs su bsdus pa las byung ba'i spyan ston ka'i zla ba lta bu gtso bo dang rjes su mthun par zhal gsum
translated: By this, “moharati,” one should emanate a cloud of vajra bodies of all tathāgatas, and one should meditate on Locanā, who is like an autumn moon, with three faces that accord with the principal one,

original: pa rin po che'i cod pan can rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis rang snang ba'i thabs la 'khyud pa can lhag mas 'khor lo dang ral gri dang nor bu dang padma bsnams par bsams la me'i phyogs kyi zla ba la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: pa rin po che'i cod pan can rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis rang snang ba'i thabs la 'khyud pa can lhag mas 'khor lo dang ral gri dang nor bu dang padma bsnams par bsams la me'i phyogs kyi zla ba la dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that he has a crest jewel, that his two principal hands embrace the method that is his natural radiance, and that the remaining hands hold a wheel, a sword, a gem, and a lotus, and one should place him on the moon in the fire direction.

original: de nyid las dve sha ra t'i zhes bya ba 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs rdo rje'i sprin spros te zhe sdang dga' ma'i gzugs su bsdus pa las byung ba'i m'a ma k'i aindra n'i la lta bu /
analyzed: de nyid las dve sha ra t'i zhes bya ba 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs rdo rje'i sprin spros te zhe sdang dga' ma'i gzugs su bsdus pa las byung ba'i m'a ma k'i aindra n'i la lta bu /
translated: From that very [syllable], by this “dveśa-raṭ,” he emits a cloud of all the tathāgatas’ mind vajras, and from the form of Aṅkura Rāgavajrī, he arises as Māmakī, who is like an emerald,

original: autpala dmar po dang ral gri dang nor bu dang padma bsnams pa bden bral gyi phyogs kyi zla ba la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: autpala dmar po dang ral gri dang nor bu dang padma bsnams pa bden bral gyi phyogs kyi zla ba la dgod par bya'o //
translated: holding a red lotus, a sword, a gem, and a lotus, and one should place her on the moon in the northeast direction.

original: de nyid las r'a ga ra t'i zhes bya ba 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi rdo rje'i sprin spros te 'dod chags dga' ma'i gzugs su bsdus pa las byung ba'i gos dkar mo padma r'a ga lta bu padma dang ral gri dang nor bu🔽dang 'khor lo bsnams pa rlung gi phyogs kyi zla ba la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las r'a ga ra t'i zhes bya ba 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi rdo rje'i sprin spros te 'dod chags dga' ma'i gzugs su bsdus pa las byung ba'i gos dkar mo padma r'a ga lta bu padma dang ral gri dang nor bu dang 'khor lo bsnams pa rlung gi phyogs kyi zla ba la dgod par bya'o //
translated: From that, by “ragarati,” having emanated the cloud of all the Tathagatas’ Vajra Speech, and having condensed it into the form of Rati-rāgā, one should place Sitātapatrā, who is like a ruby, holding a lotus, a sword, a gem, and a wheel, on the moon in the wind direction.

original: de nyid las badzra ra t'i zhes bya ba 'dis sku dang gsung dang thugs dam tshig rdo rje'i sprin spros te rdo rje dga' ma'i gzugs su bsdus pa las byung ba'i sgrol ma gser bcom lta bu autpala ser po dang / ral gri dang nor bu dang padma bsnams pa dbang ldan gyi phyogs kyi zla ba la dgod par bya'o //

translated: These four are respectively the desire for the taste of the arising of wisdom, the desire for the taste of analysis, the desire for the taste of piercing each object, and the desire for the taste of thorough composition.

original: snying ga'i zla ba chen po la mos par byas te des tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: snying ga'i zla ba chen po la mos par byas te des tshim par bya'o //
translated: Then, having generated the five nectars as intended or summoned them according to the rite, one should imagine a white vajra, the size of a mere sesame seed, in the center of the tongue, from the letter hūṃ. Having made the tongue the nature of that by the yoga of emanating and reabsorbing, one should imagine the great moon in the heart, and be satisfied by it.

original: de nas sangs rgyas rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku gzhan gyis rag par bya ba ma yin pas na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ro gcig pa bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin can dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'i bdag nyid dang de'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku gzhan gyis rag par bya ba ma yin pas na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ro gcig pa bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin can dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'i bdag nyid dang de'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa
translated: Then, since the nature body of the buddhas is not to be obtained from another, all the qualities of the buddhas are of one taste, the nature of great bliss, and one should imagine that the nature of the principal of the maṇḍala is concordant with that.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi @226a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi @226a * //
translated: The qualities of all buddhas

original: longs spyod kyi ngo bo'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang lhan cig kun du longs spyod par gyur la bde ba chen po 'bebs pas gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas gnyi ga ji srid 'dod kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi ngo bo'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang lhan cig kun du longs spyod par gyur la bde ba chen po 'bebs pas gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas gnyi ga ji srid 'dod kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on both as long as one wishes, by the descent of great bliss, having become the master of the great bodhisattvas of the great mandala of the nature of enjoyment, enjoying together.

original: de ltar na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid can dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po'i mchog ces bya ba ste ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid can dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po'i mchog ces bya ba ste ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa'o //
translated: Thus, the second meditative stabilization, called the “supreme king of mandalas, having the nature of the enjoyment body,” is finished.

original: de nas bdag pos dkyil 'khor ba'i lha thams cad bskul zhing rang gi sku'i sprin spros pas phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad nas rang gi sku'i sprin bdag nyid la bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bdag pos dkyil 'khor ba'i lha thams cad bskul zhing rang gi sku'i sprin spros pas phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad nas rang gi sku'i sprin bdag nyid la bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having caused all the deities of the mandala to invoke the lord, and having performed the welfare of all sentient beings in the ten directions by emanating the cloud of one’s own body, one should gather the cloud of one’s own body into oneself.

original: de la rnam par snang mdzad kyi sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gzugs kyi de kho na nyid rnam par thar pa'i ting nge 'dzin mchog tu mdzad do //
analyzed: de la rnam par snang mdzad kyi sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gzugs kyi de kho na nyid rnam par thar pa'i ting nge 'dzin mchog tu mdzad do //
translated: In this regard, Vairocana makes the reality of the form of all sentient beings the supreme concentration of liberation of the reality of all tathāgatas.

original: rnam par shes pa'i de kho na nyid ni mi bskyod pas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de kho na nyid ni mi bskyod pas so //
translated: The reality of consciousness is by Akṣobhya.

original: tshor ba'i de kho na nyid ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyis so //🔽'du shes kyi de kho na nyid ni 'od dpag tu med pas so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i de kho na nyid ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyis so // 'du shes kyi de kho na nyid ni 'od dpag tu med pas so //
translated: The reality of feeling is by Ratnasaṃbhava.🔽The reality of perception is by Amitābha.

original: 'du byed kyi de kho na nyid ni don yod grub pas so //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi de kho na nyid ni don yod grub pas so //
translated: The reality of mental formations is by Amoghasiddhi.

original: gzugs kyi de kho na nyid ni yang dag par mthong ba'i dga' ba ni spyan gyis so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de kho na nyid ni yang dag par mthong ba'i dga' ba ni spyan gyis so //
translated: The reality of form is the joy of correct seeing by Locanā.

original: rnam par shes pa'i de kho na nyid ni m'a ma k'is so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de kho na nyid ni m'a ma k'is so //
translated: The reality of consciousness is by Māmakī.

original: chos kyi de kho na nyid ni gos dkar mos so //
analyzed: chos kyi de kho na nyid ni gos dkar mos so //
translated: The reality of phenomena is by Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: las kyi de kho na nyid ni sgrol mas so //
analyzed: las kyi de kho na nyid ni sgrol mas so //
translated: The reality of actions is by Tārā.

original: gzugs kyi de kho na nyid ni thob pa la sgrib pa zad par byed pa ni gshin rje mthar byed kyis so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de kho na nyid ni thob pa la sgrib pa zad par byed pa ni gshin rje mthar byed kyis so //
translated: The reality of form is purified by Yamântaka, the Destroyer of Death, which removes the obscurations to the attainment of the reality of form.

original: rnam par shes pa'i de kho na nyid ni shes rab mthar byed kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de kho na nyid ni shes rab mthar byed kyis so //
translated: The reality of consciousness is purified by Prajñânta, the Destroyer of Wisdom.

original: chos kyi de kho na nyid ni padma mthar byed kyis so //
analyzed: chos kyi de kho na nyid ni padma mthar byed kyis so //
translated: The reality of phenomena is purified by Padmaântaka, the Destroyer of the Dharma.

original: las kyi de kho na nyid ni bgegs mthar byed kyis so ;
analyzed: las kyi de kho na nyid ni bgegs mthar byed kyis so ;
translated: The reality of action is purified by Vighnântaka, the Destroyer of Obstacles.

original: / mchog tu kha na ma tho ba med pa dang mchog tu nyams dga' ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul sna tshogs dbang du byed pa nyid ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pas so //
analyzed: / mchog tu kha na ma tho ba med pa dang mchog tu nyams dga' ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul sna tshogs dbang du byed pa nyid ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pas so //
translated: The subjugation of the various objects of form, etc. , which are supremely free from evil and supremely delightful, is accomplished by Rûpavajrâ, etc.

original: sa'i snying po la sogs pas ni gzugs mthong ba la sogs pa la dbang bsgyur bar ro //
analyzed: sa'i snying po la sogs pas ni gzugs mthong ba la sogs pa la dbang bsgyur bar ro //
translated: The subjugation of the seeing of form, etc. , is accomplished by Kshitigarbha, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i bdag nyid ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba stsol bar mdzad do //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i bdag nyid ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba stsol bar mdzad do //
translated: The bestowal of the bliss of unsurpassed enlightenment is accomplished by the Lord of the Mandala himself.

original: sgrib pa kun las nges grol ba //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun las nges grol ba //
translated: Completely liberated from all obscurations,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi yon tan gnas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi yon tan gnas //
translated: the abode of the qualities of all the Buddhas,

original: rtag cing bla na med bde ba //
analyzed: rtag cing bla na med bde ba //
translated: It is eternal, unsurpassed bliss,

original: rdo rje 'chang ba chen po'i gnas //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ba chen po'i gnas // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the abode of the Great Vajra Holder.

original: de ni bla na med pa'i @226b byang chub kyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bla na med pa'i @226b byang chub kyi bde ba'o //
translated: This is the unsurpassed bliss of enlightenment.

original: de'i 'og tu bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la dga' ba'i don nyams su myong ba'i phyir khyad par du bde ba dang yid bde ba de gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid 'khor dang bcas pa ji srid 'dod kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la dga' ba'i don nyams su myong ba'i phyir khyad par du bde ba dang yid bde ba de gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid 'khor dang bcas pa ji srid 'dod kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, in order to experience the meaning of delight in the perfection of one's own and others' goals, one should cultivate that special bliss and mental bliss, along with their retinue, for as long as one wishes, in the nature of the dependent.

original: de ltar na sprul ba'i sku'i bdag nyid can te las kyi rgyal po'i mchog ces bya ba ste ting nge 'dzin gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sprul ba'i sku'i bdag nyid can te las kyi rgyal po'i mchog ces bya ba ste ting nge 'dzin gsum pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the nature of the emanation body, called the supreme king of actions, the third samadhi.

original: sgrub pa'i rnal 'byor pas cho ga bzhin du bdud rtsi myong ba'i rjes thogs la rang gi snying ga'i sngags nyid las dkyil 'khor pa thams cad la phan pa'i don snga ma bzhin du byas la de nyid du de rnams yang dag par bsdus te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rnal 'byor pas cho ga bzhin du bdud rtsi myong ba'i rjes thogs la rang gi snying ga'i sngags nyid las dkyil 'khor pa thams cad la phan pa'i don snga ma bzhin du byas la de nyid du de rnams yang dag par bsdus te /
translated: Then, he should imagine that they are all gathered back into the mantra at his heart.

original: phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid mnyam pa med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba'i ro gcig pa ngal ba med pa'i bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid mnyam pa med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba'i ro gcig pa ngal ba med pa'i bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: He should meditate on that, the nature of perfection, the taste of incomparable bliss and mental joy, without fatigue.

original: de ltar sgrub pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang sgrub pa chen po'i rnal 'byor pa bsgoms pas dub par gyur na ngal bsos la bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang sgrub pa chen po'i rnal 'byor pa bsgoms pas dub par gyur na ngal bsos la bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: Thus, the practitioner and the great practitioner, having meditated, should relax and recite the mantra.

original: de la dang por ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na gnas pa'i rang gi mtshan ma rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa de'i lte ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rang gi sa bon gyi don nyid la nges par🔽brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang por ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na gnas pa'i rang gi mtshan ma rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa de'i lte ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rang gi sa bon gyi don nyid la nges par brtag par bya'o //
translated: First, in the center of the moon-disk at the heart of the Knowledge-Being, one should definitely imagine one's own sign in the nature of one's own essence, and in the center of the moon-disk of that, one's own seed-syllable, which is the meaning of the seed-syllable.

original: shes dang shes bya gnyis med pa //
analyzed: shes dang shes bya gnyis med pa //
translated: One should imagine it as follows: The non-dual knowledge and object of knowledge,

original: bdag lus bde ba rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: bdag lus bde ba rdzogs byang chub //
translated: the self-body, the perfection of bliss,

original: dang po'i rdo rje dang po'i dbyangs //
analyzed: dang po'i rdo rje dang po'i dbyangs //
translated: the first vajra, the first melody,

original: sems dang ngag kyang de don yin //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems dang ngag kyang de don yin // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: the mind and speech, that is the meaning.

original: de'i 'og tu zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rang gi sa bon gyi mdun dang g-yas dang g-yon phyogs kyi cha dag la go rims bzhin du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sa bon dang sa bon gyi gdan bzhi bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rang gi sa bon gyi mdun dang g-yas dang g-yon phyogs kyi cha dag la go rims bzhin du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sa bon dang sa bon gyi gdan bzhi bsam mo //
translated: Then, in front of the moon-disk, on the right and left sides, one should imagine the four seats of the body, speech, and mind seed-syllables, respectively, and the seed-syllables.

original: de la dbus ma gang yin pa de ni rang gi sems te de ni sna tshogs pa yin la de nyid ni rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de la dbus ma gang yin pa de ni rang gi sems te de ni sna tshogs pa yin la de nyid ni rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rdo rje'o //
translated: The middle one is one’s own mind, which is variegated, and is a vajra, since it is the nature of the indivisible three vajras.

original: cig shos gsum po ni de nyid kyi dbye ba yin pa de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rang gi sems yang dag par mtshon pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: cig shos gsum po ni de nyid kyi dbye ba yin pa de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rang gi sems yang dag par mtshon pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa zhes bshad de /
translated: The other three are its divisions, and therefore, since it is the nature of the indivisible three vajras, one’s own mind is fully characterized by a vajra, and is explained as vajra repetition.

original: sngags kyi don kun bzlas pa ni //
analyzed: sngags kyi don kun bzlas pa ni //
translated: The meaning of the mantra is fully repeated,

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum gyis mtshan //🔽rdo rje dbye ba gsum ni mthar //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum gyis mtshan // rdo rje dbye ba gsum ni mthar //
translated: characterized by the indivisible three vajras.🔽The three vajra divisions are at the end,

original: bkod pa rdo rje gsum zhes bya //
analyzed: bkod pa rdo rje gsum zhes bya //
translated: arranged as the three vajras.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is stated.

original: de la sna tshogs pa las kha dog lnga'i 'od zer spro zhing dbye ba las ni kha dog re re'o //
analyzed: de la sna tshogs pa las kha dog lnga'i 'od zer spro zhing dbye ba las ni kha dog re re'o //
translated: From the variegated, the light rays of the five colors are emitted, and from the divisions, each color.

original: de nas yi ge bzhi po'i sngags @227a * //
analyzed: de nas yi ge bzhi po'i sngags @227a * //
translated: Then, the mantra of the four syllables

original: rim pa 'dis bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis bzlas par bya ste /
translated: is repeated by this process.

original: ye shes kyi snying po brjod pa na dbye ba dang sna tshogs pa rnams rang gi sems tsam nyid du de nyid kyis mos par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi snying po brjod pa na dbye ba dang sna tshogs pa rnams rang gi sems tsam nyid du de nyid kyis mos par bya'o //
translated: When the essence of pristine awareness is mentioned, one should be convinced that the divisions and varieties are just one’s own mind.

original: byang chub bdag med pa brjod pa na ming dang don dag gi blo bdag med par lhag par mos pas tha snyad nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub bdag med pa brjod pa na ming dang don dag gi blo bdag med par lhag par mos pas tha snyad nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: When enlightenment is mentioned as being without a self, one should be convinced that the mind that apprehends names and meanings is without a self, and that conventions are like space.

original: sna tshogs pa brjod pa na rang gi sems nyid sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du mos par byas te /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa brjod pa na rang gi sems nyid sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du mos par byas te /
translated: When variety is mentioned, one should be convinced that one’s own mind is the essence of variety.

original: de nyid las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sprin spro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sprin spro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because from that very mind, one emanates the clouds of the body, speech, and mind of all the transcendent ones.

original: drag po brjod pa na mnyam pa nyid du mos par bya ba ste /🔽sku la sogs pa'i sprin gsum po sna tshogs pa las /
analyzed: drag po brjod pa na mnyam pa nyid du mos par bya ba ste / sku la sogs pa'i sprin gsum po sna tshogs pa las /
translated: When wrath is mentioned, one should be convinced of their sameness.🔽Because the three clouds of body and so forth, which are of various kinds,

original: sna tshogs pa'i sprin spros pa gsum dang ro gcig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i sprin spros pa gsum dang ro gcig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are made of the same taste as the three emanations of the various clouds.

original: de ltar na re zhig lan dang po la de ltar yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig lan dang po la de ltar yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the first reply.

original: lan gnyis pa la sogs par ni ye shes kyi snying po brjod cing spros pa rang gi sems tsam nyid du mos par bya ste /
analyzed: lan gnyis pa la sogs par ni ye shes kyi snying po brjod cing spros pa rang gi sems tsam nyid du mos par bya ste /
translated: In the second repetition and so on, one should recite the essence mantra of pristine awareness and imagine the emanation as just one’s own mind.

original: rang gi sems su sdud pa yin no ;
analyzed: rang gi sems su sdud pa yin no ;
translated: One should gather it into one’s mind.

original: / lhag ma rnams ni lan dang po 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: / lhag ma rnams ni lan dang po 'dra ba'o //
translated: The rest is the same as the first reply.

original: lan gnyis pa la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad kyi phyi ma'i lan yang yin mod kyi 'on kyang sna tshogs pa nyid brjod cing spro bar ni mi bya ste dbye ba rnams la yang sna tshogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba nyid du mos par
analyzed: lan gnyis pa la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad kyi phyi ma'i lan yang yin mod kyi 'on kyang sna tshogs pa nyid brjod cing spro bar ni mi bya ste dbye ba rnams la yang sna tshogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba nyid du mos par
translated: Although the second reply and so on are indeed the replies to all the subsequent questions, still one should not recite and emanate the diversity, but rather imagine the diversity as the various divisions.

original: bya'o // drag po nyid brjod pa na yang spro bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: bya'o // drag po nyid brjod pa na yang spro bar mi bya ste /
translated: When one recites the fierce mantra, one should not emanate,

original: dbye ba rnams la yang mnyam pa nyid du mos par bya ste /
analyzed: dbye ba rnams la yang mnyam pa nyid du mos par bya ste /
translated: but rather imagine the diversity as the various divisions.

original: 'di ni 'di'i rdo rje bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i rdo rje bzlas pa'o //
translated: This is the vajra recitation of the bodhisattva.

original: de la yang rnam pa gnyis te gang gi tshe dbye ba las dbye ba dang sna tshogs pa las sna tshogs pa spros nas sna tshogs par sdud pa de'i tshe thams cad las spros pa'i rdo rje bzlas pa'o//
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gnyis te gang gi tshe dbye ba las dbye ba dang sna tshogs pa las sna tshogs pa spros nas sna tshogs par sdud pa de'i tshe thams cad las spros pa'i rdo rje bzlas pa'o//
translated: That also has two types: when, having emanated from the division the division and from the variety the variety, they are gathered into the variety, at that time it is vajra repetition emanated from all.

original: yang gang gi tshe sna tshogs pa nyid las dbye ba dang sna tshogs pa yang dag par spros nas dbye ba dag la sdud pa de'i tshe gcig bu nyid las spros pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa yin pa de ltar na rdo rje bzlas pa ni rnam pa
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe sna tshogs pa nyid las dbye ba dang sna tshogs pa yang dag par spros nas dbye ba dag la sdud pa de'i tshe gcig bu nyid las spros pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa yin pa de ltar na rdo rje bzlas pa ni rnam pa
translated: Again, when, having emanated from the variety the division and from the variety the variety, they are gathered into the division, at that time it is vajra repetition emanated from the single one. Thus vajra repetition is of two types.

original: gnyis so // yang na rang gi sku dang thugs dang gsung gi don de bzhin du dpyad la ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar rjes su mthun pa'i gdan la snying po'i sngags bltas te sa bon de nyid la zlum por yongs su bskor ba mgo gyen du lta ba'i sngags kyi
analyzed: gnyis so // yang na rang gi sku dang thugs dang gsung gi don de bzhin du dpyad la ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar rjes su mthun pa'i gdan la snying po'i sngags bltas te sa bon de nyid la zlum por yongs su bskor ba mgo gyen du lta ba'i sngags kyi
translated: Or else, having analyzed the meaning of one’s body, mind, and speech in that way, one should look at the essence mantra in the heart of the gnosis being on a seat that is in accordance with it, and the seed syllable itself should be circled with the upright-headed mantra.

original: yi ge'i phreng ba mar me'i phreng ba lta bu 'bar bas g-yas nas bskor bar yid kyis bris la de nyid la yid mnyam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: yi ge'i phreng ba mar me'i phreng ba lta bu 'bar bas g-yas nas bskor bar yid kyis bris la de nyid la yid mnyam par gzhag ste /
translated: One should mentally write the garland of syllables, blazing like a garland of lamps, circling to the right.🔽One should recite the mantra as long as one wishes, with one's mind fixed on that.

original: @227b de nyid zlos shing ji srid 'dod kyi bar du bzla bar bya ste de ni 'gog pa'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: @227b de nyid zlos shing ji srid 'dod kyi bar du bzla bar bya ste de ni 'gog pa'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: That is the recitation of cessation.

original: de ltar bzlas pa dang bsgoms pa dag gis dub par gyur na sgrub pa chen po'i rnal 'byor pas mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa cho ga bzhin du byas la /
analyzed: de ltar bzlas pa dang bsgoms pa dag gis dub par gyur na sgrub pa chen po'i rnal 'byor pas mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa cho ga bzhin du byas la /
translated: When one becomes tired through such recitation and meditation, the yogin of the great practice should perform the rite of offering, praise, and so forth.

original: yi ge gsum gyis dkyil 'khor nye bar bsdu bar byas te /🔽blo dang bdag med mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyis dkyil 'khor nye bar bsdu bar byas te / blo dang bdag med mnyam pa nyid //
translated: One should gather the mandala with the three syllables.

original: ston pa gsum gyis rim bzhin du //
analyzed: ston pa gsum gyis rim bzhin du //
translated: The three teachers are the three syllables,🔽in order, the mind,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon la //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon la //
translated: the seed of body, speech, and mind.

original: rgyal ba lha mo mthar byed bsdu'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba lha mo mthar byed bsdu'o //
translated: The Victorious One gathers the goddesses into the end.

original: de nas stobs ji lta ba bzhin du'am mdor bsdu na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'dis //
analyzed: de nas stobs ji lta ba bzhin du'am mdor bsdu na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'dis //
translated: Then, according to one's ability, or in brief, with these two verses:

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi kun bdag nyid //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi kun bdag nyid //
translated: The nature of all buddhas

original: rdo rje 'chang ba chen po'i gnas //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ba chen po'i gnas //
translated: The abode of the Great Vajradhara.🔽By this virtue, may I attain it,🔽and may all beings attain it as well.🔽Whatever is the practice for enlightenment,

original: dge ba 'di yis thob gyur cig /'gro bas kyang ni de thob shog / byang chub phyir ni spyod gang dang // rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi gang yin pa //
analyzed: dge ba 'di yis thob gyur cig /'gro bas kyang ni de thob shog / byang chub phyir ni spyod gang dang // rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi gang yin pa //
translated: and whatever is the practice of the perfect Buddha,🔽I will practice both of them,

original: byang chub rdo rjes gsungs pa yi //🔽spyod de gnyi ga bdag spyod shog / ces smon lam gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub rdo rjes gsungs pa yi // spyod de gnyi ga bdag spyod shog / ces smon lam gdab par bya'o //
translated: as taught by the Vajra of Enlightenment.

original: de nas chos 'byung ni nam mkha' dang gzhal yas khang ni phyi'i sa la sogs pa la thim par bltas la bdag nyid kyi phung po lnga ni sangs rgyas lnga dang / skye mched drug ni byang chub sems dpa' drug tu mos par byas la langs nas mos pa'i sbyor ba de nyid kyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas chos 'byung ni nam mkha' dang gzhal yas khang ni phyi'i sa la sogs pa la thim par bltas la bdag nyid kyi phung po lnga ni sangs rgyas lnga dang / skye mched drug ni byang chub sems dpa' drug tu mos par byas la langs nas mos pa'i sbyor ba de nyid kyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: Then, visualize the source of phenomena dissolving into space, and the immeasurable mansion dissolving into the outer earth, and so forth. Contemplate that your five aggregates are the five Buddhas, and the six sense bases are the six Bodhisattvas. Then rise up and abide in that very visualization.

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here it is said:🔽I am the Lord of the Wheel,

original: nga ni 'khor lo'i bdag po dang // nga phung dbang bcas 'khor lo yin //
analyzed: nga ni 'khor lo'i bdag po dang // nga phung dbang bcas 'khor lo yin //
translated: and my aggregates and faculties are the wheel.

original: 'byung ba lnga ni gnas yin zhes //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga ni gnas yin zhes //
translated: The five elements are the abode.

original: yang yang mos shing gnas par bya //
analyzed: yang yang mos shing gnas par bya //
translated: Contemplate this again and again.

original: gzhan yang / ting 'dzin gnas kyang rnam bcas pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ting 'dzin gnas kyang rnam bcas pa //
translated: Moreover,

original: mthong gang de ni gnyis med pa'i //
analyzed: mthong gang de ni gnyis med pa'i //
translated: the concentration that abides in the form of the deity

original: ye shes rgyu mthun ye shes te //
analyzed: ye shes rgyu mthun ye shes te //
translated: is the cause of nondual intuition,

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i mchog tu brtag / ces bshad do //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i mchog tu brtag / ces bshad do //
translated: and is the intuition that is like an illusion, considered supreme.

original: sgrub pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang dkyil 'khor nye bar bsdu ba las gzhan pa 'di dag thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang dkyil 'khor nye bar bsdu ba las gzhan pa 'di dag thams cad bya'o //
translated: The practitioner of yoga should also do all of this, except for the dissolution of the mandala.

original: thun mtshams su yang sgrub pa'i rnal 'byor pas de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi khang par zhugs la 'dug ste /
analyzed: thun mtshams su yang sgrub pa'i rnal 'byor pas de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi khang par zhugs la 'dug ste /
translated: In the intervals, the practitioner of yoga should also enter the chamber of contemplation and sit there,

original: skad cig gis 'byung ba lnga las yongs su gyur pa'i gzhi'i dkyil 'khor de'i dbus ma'i gdan la 'dug pa'i rdo rje sems dpar bdag nyid bsams la mig dang sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: skad cig gis 'byung ba lnga las yongs su gyur pa'i gzhi'i dkyil 'khor de'i dbus ma'i gdan la 'dug pa'i rdo rje sems dpar bdag nyid bsams la mig dang sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: and in an instant transform the five elements into the foundation mandala, and imagine himself seated on the central seat as Vajrasattva, and bless his eyes, body, and so on.

original: mi bskyod pa'i cod pan can rang gi rig ma dang gnyis su med par gyur pa'i rigs kyi rig pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba can dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i cod pan can rang gi rig ma dang gnyis su med par gyur pa'i rigs kyi rig pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba can dmigs par bya'o //
translated: He should visualize himself as having Akṣobhya as his crest jewel, and as united with his consort in nondual union with his family’s knowledge woman.

original: @228a * // sgrub pa chen po'i rnal 'byor pas ni sngar bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyang sku la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams las byung ste /
analyzed: @228a * // sgrub pa chen po'i rnal 'byor pas ni sngar bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyang sku la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams las byung ste /
translated: The practitioner of the great yoga should imagine that the mandala retinue, which was previously gathered, arises from the seed syllables of body, and so forth.

original: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bkod la ci rigs par sku la sogs pas byin gyis brlab pa dang cod pan gyis dbang bskur ba dang / rig pa'i brtul zhugs dang ldan par de rnams mos par byas la sdom pa dang mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba dang bzlas pa la sogs pa yang byas te snga ma bzhin du langs la de bzhin du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bkod la ci rigs par sku la sogs pas byin gyis brlab pa dang cod pan gyis dbang bskur ba dang / rig pa'i brtul zhugs dang ldan par de rnams mos par byas la sdom pa dang mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba dang bzlas pa la sogs pa yang byas te snga ma bzhin du langs la de bzhin du gnas par bya'o //
translated: They are arranged in their respective places, and are blessed with body, and so forth, are empowered with the crown, and are endowed with the conduct of awareness. Having imagined that, one should take the vows, make offerings, praise, taste the elixir, recite the mantra, and so forth, and then arise as before and remain in that state.

original: thun mtshams tha ma la yang rnam pa 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: thun mtshams tha ma la yang rnam pa 'di nyid yin no //
translated: This is the same process in the final session.

original: khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference is this:

original: aom khyed kyis 'gro ba'i don kun mdzad //
analyzed: aom khyed kyis 'gro ba'i don kun mdzad //
translated: oṃ You accomplish all the needs of the world

original: rjes su mthun par dngos grub stsol //
analyzed: rjes su mthun par dngos grub stsol //
translated: and grant spiritual powers in accordance with the practice.

original: sangs rgyas yul du gshegs nas ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas yul du gshegs nas ni //
translated: Having gone to the land of the buddhas,

original: slar yang gshegs par mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: slar yang gshegs par mdzad du gsol //
translated: please return again.

original: aom badzra mu: zhes bya bas ye shes sems dpa' 'am ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra mu: zhes bya bas ye shes sems dpa' 'am ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: With Om Vajra Muh one should request the wisdom being or the wisdom mandala to depart.

original: de nas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor snga ma bzhin du nye bar bsdus la /
analyzed: de nas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor snga ma bzhin du nye bar bsdus la /
translated: Then, one should withdraw the pledge mandala as before.

original: don dam pa byang chub kyi sems chen po mngon sum du byas te 'bad rtsol med par nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa byang chub kyi sems chen po mngon sum du byas te 'bad rtsol med par nyal bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should sleep without exertion, having actualized the ultimate great mind of enlightenment.

original: sad pa'i tshe na yang lha mo bzhi'i glus bskul bar bsams la de nas langs te zhag snga ma bzhin du thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: sad pa'i tshe na yang lha mo bzhi'i glus bskul bar bsams la de nas langs te zhag snga ma bzhin du thams cad bya'o //
translated: When one awakens, one should imagine that one is aroused by the song of the four goddesses, and then one should arise and do everything as before during the day.

original: de ltar nyin re'i thun mtshams sam gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin du de dag thams cad bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar nyin re'i thun mtshams sam gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin du de dag thams cad bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should do all of that in each session or according to the circumstances,

original: tshogs bsags pa la ni thun la sogs pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs bsags pa la ni thun la sogs pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no restriction of sessions, etc. in the accumulation of the stores.

original: nus pa yod na nges pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: nus pa yod na nges pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: If one has the ability, one should do it with restriction.

original: de ni dge ba rnams la rab kyi mthar thug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dge ba rnams la rab kyi mthar thug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is because it is the ultimate of virtues.

original: de ltar goms par byed pa nyid kyi dus su sgom pa'am bzlas pa grub par 'gyur te /🔽grub pa de yang de la dmigs pa ma lus pa shin tu gsal bar snang ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ram lhun gyis grub pa las byung ba'i dga' ba'i shugs rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ram nye bar gyur pa'i sgra gsal ba ma thos pa la sogs
analyzed: de ltar goms par byed pa nyid kyi dus su sgom pa'am bzlas pa grub par 'gyur te / grub pa de yang de la dmigs pa ma lus pa shin tu gsal bar snang ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ram lhun gyis grub pa las byung ba'i dga' ba'i shugs rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ram nye bar gyur pa'i sgra gsal ba ma thos pa la sogs
translated: At the time of cultivating in that way, the meditation or recitation is accomplished.

original: pa'am / le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i rmi lam gyi khyad par rnams kyis yang dag par shes par bya'o //🔽yang dag par shes par byas nas bsgom pa dang bzlas pa'i stobs las ji ltar mtshan ma de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du yun ring po mi thogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes nges par byas la dngos grub nye bar bya ba'i phyir @228b sems
analyzed: pa'am / le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i rmi lam gyi khyad par rnams kyis yang dag par shes par bya'o // yang dag par shes par byas nas bsgom pa dang bzlas pa'i stobs las ji ltar mtshan ma de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du yun ring po mi thogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes nges par byas la dngos grub nye bar bya ba'i phyir @228b sems
translated: That accomplishment should be understood by the signs taught in the fifteenth chapter, such as the clear appearance of the entire object of meditation, the uninterrupted appearance, the uninterrupted stream of the force of joy that arises effortlessly, or the clear sound of the mantra that is not heard nearby.

original: la dpyad pa dang nam mkha'i rdo rje bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: la dpyad pa dang nam mkha'i rdo rje bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having understood that, one should meditate on the space vajra in order to bring about the accomplishment, thinking, “Just as those signs arise through the power of meditation and recitation, in the same way, the accomplishment will occur without delay.”

original: nga'i lus dang ngag dang yid rten dang brten pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du snang ba gang yin pa dag ni nga'i sems tsam ste rang gi sems las gzhan snang ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems la dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: nga'i lus dang ngag dang yid rten dang brten pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du snang ba gang yin pa dag ni nga'i sems tsam ste rang gi sems las gzhan snang ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems la dpyad pa'o //
translated: Whatever appears in the form of the body, speech, and mind, and the supporting and supported mandalas, is only my mind, because it is not reasonable for there to be appearances other than one's own mind. This is the analysis of mind.

original: sems tsam de yang don dam par snang ba tsam gnyis med pa ste /
analyzed: sems tsam de yang don dam par snang ba tsam gnyis med pa ste /
translated: That mere mind is ultimately nondual mere appearance,

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba tsam ni brdzun pa nyid kyis don dam pa mthong ba la nub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rdo rje 'ba' zhig dri ma med pa nam mkha' mtha' yas pa lta bu snang ba med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbye ba tsam ni brdzun pa nyid kyis don dam pa mthong ba la nub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rdo rje 'ba' zhig dri ma med pa nam mkha' mtha' yas pa lta bu snang ba med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: because the mere division into aspects is false, and therefore subsides in the vision of the ultimate. This is the stainless vajra of space, the wisdom of nonappearance, like infinite space.

original: de'i 'og tu ri phug dang dgon pa chen po dang mtsho'i ngogs dang chu'i ngogs la sogs pa skye bo med par rjes su mthun par skye bo dam pa'i grogs dang ldan par gnas la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ri phug dang dgon pa chen po dang mtsho'i ngogs dang chu'i ngogs la sogs pa skye bo med par rjes su mthun par skye bo dam pa'i grogs dang ldan par gnas la /
translated: After that, in a place without people, such as a mountain cave, a great forest, a lake shore, or a river bank, in a place that is suitable, with the companionship of holy beings,

original: bsnyen pa yan lag drug dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i cho ga'i dngos grub kyi mchog gi dbang du byas nas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa yan lag drug dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i cho ga'i dngos grub kyi mchog gi dbang du byas nas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should practice in terms of the supreme feat of the rite of the six-branched service and so forth.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And so it is said:🔽I pay homage to that hero of practice,

original: gang zhig dngos grub mchog gi thabs ni 'di bsgom pa //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos grub mchog gi thabs ni 'di bsgom pa //
translated: who cultivates this means to the supreme feat,🔽the lord of practice, whose mind is unmoved by the rite of service,

original: bsnyen pa'i cho ga nye bar sgrub dang sgrub pa dang // sgrub pa chen pos blo mi 'gyur ba'i sgrub dbang po //
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i cho ga nye bar sgrub dang sgrub pa dang // sgrub pa chen pos blo mi 'gyur ba'i sgrub dbang po //
translated: the rite of approach, the rite of evocation, and the great rite.

original: byang chub rdo rje 'dra blta de la bdag phyag 'tshal //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub rdo rje 'dra blta de la bdag phyag 'tshal // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He who is like the vajra of enlightenment.

original: gang yang lha gzhan dag gi sbyar bas dngos grub kyi mchog 'dod pa de rnams kyi cho ga 'di rnams thams cad nyid byas te /
analyzed: gang yang lha gzhan dag gi sbyar bas dngos grub kyi mchog 'dod pa de rnams kyi cho ga 'di rnams thams cad nyid byas te /
translated: Also, those who desire the supreme feat by means of the application of other deities should perform all these rites.

original: sa bon dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan dang sngags la sogs pa la ni khyad par yod de 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: sa bon dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan dang sngags la sogs pa la ni khyad par yod de 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: There is a difference in the seed, color, insignia, mantra, and so forth. Here is a verse:

original: gzhan gyi sa bon sngags dang rigs //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sa bon sngags dang rigs //
translated: The seed, mantra, and family of another,

original: de nyid rig pa'am rig skyes bu ;
analyzed: de nyid rig pa'am rig skyes bu ;
translated: the knowledge of reality, or the person born of knowledge,

original: / de dag rjes su dpag par bya //🔽gzhan rnams thams cad bshad pa yin //
analyzed: / de dag rjes su dpag par bya // gzhan rnams thams cad bshad pa yin //
translated: One should infer the others.

original: rgyud gzhan las ni bstan pa yi //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan las ni bstan pa yi //
translated: All the others have been explained.

original: sa bon sku mdog rigs la sogs //
analyzed: sa bon sku mdog rigs la sogs //
translated: The seed, color, family, and so forth🔽That are taught in other tantras

original: mtshan ma 'am mtshan ma bzhi po dag / de nyid las ni nges par bzung //
analyzed: mtshan ma 'am mtshan ma bzhi po dag / de nyid las ni nges par bzung //
translated: Are to be ascertained from that very [Hevajra Tantra],

original: gsungs pa'am ma gsungs pa bzhin du //
analyzed: gsungs pa'am ma gsungs pa bzhin du //
translated: Whether they are stated or not.

original: gzhan las sa bon stsogs gzung bya //🔽'dus pa'i cho gas rdo rje rnams //
analyzed: gzhan las sa bon stsogs gzung bya // 'dus pa'i cho gas rdo rje rnams //
translated: The seed, and so forth, are to be taken🔽As stated or from another [source].🔽Since all the vajras are assembled

original: thams cad 'dus pa pa yin phyir //
analyzed: thams cad 'dus pa pa yin phyir //
translated: In the ritual of the assembly,

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor grub pa'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing the mind mandala,

original: 'khor lo can gyi rten gnas kyi //
analyzed: 'khor lo can gyi rten gnas kyi //
translated: The wheel-possessor is the support.

original: gal te rgyal gzhan dbus mar gyur //
analyzed: gal te rgyal gzhan dbus mar gyur //
translated: If another victor is in the center,

original: de yi gnas la mi @229a * //
analyzed: de yi gnas la mi @229a * //
translated: One should not place him in that place.

original: bskyod 'gyur // gang tshe 'khor gtso sangs rgyas 'gyur //
analyzed: bskyod 'gyur // gang tshe 'khor gtso sangs rgyas 'gyur //
translated: When the retinue is the principal buddha,

original: phyung ba de ni bstim par bya //
analyzed: phyung ba de ni bstim par bya //
translated: One should dissolve the emanated [buddhas].

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor gtsor 'gyur //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor gtsor 'gyur //
translated: When the bodhisattva is the principal of the retinue,

original: de yi rigs dag bstim par bya //
analyzed: de yi rigs dag bstim par bya //
translated: One should dissolve his family [members].

original: rgyal ba las gzhan dkyil 'khor pa //
analyzed: rgyal ba las gzhan dkyil 'khor pa //
translated: The mandala members other than the victor

original: gal te 'khor lo gtso bor byed //
analyzed: gal te 'khor lo gtso bor byed //
translated: If the wheel is made primary,

original: dbus ma de yang gzhan nyid de ;
analyzed: dbus ma de yang gzhan nyid de ;
translated: that middle one is also different,

original: / rang gnas su yang gzhan de nyid //
analyzed: / rang gnas su yang gzhan de nyid //
translated: and that very same one in its own place.

original: tshogs rnams bsags pa de dag ni //
analyzed: tshogs rnams bsags pa de dag ni //
translated: Those accumulations of assemblies

original: tshe 'di nyid la grub phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la grub phyir ro //
translated: are for the sake of accomplishment in this very life.

original: skye bo gzhan du grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skye bo gzhan du grub pa'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of accomplishment elsewhere,

original: cung zad bzlas dang bsgom pa 'ang bya //
analyzed: cung zad bzlas dang bsgom pa 'ang bya //
translated: one should also recite and meditate a little.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs gang yin pa de rnams kyi gsang ba ni don dam pa ste rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs gang yin pa de rnams kyi gsang ba ni don dam pa ste rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: As for the Tathāgata, and so on, the secret of all the bodies, speech, and minds of the Tathāgatas is the ultimate, which is Vajradhara.

original: de las byung ba ni gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i rgyud gang yin pa de la dkyil 'khor ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin can gang yin gyi /
analyzed: de las byung ba ni gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i rgyud gang yin pa de la dkyil 'khor ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin can gang yin gyi /
translated: That which arises from that is the tantra called Guhyasamāja, in which the maṇḍala is the nature of the samādhi of all the Tathāgatas,

original: bris pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bris pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: and not the nature of a drawing.

original: de la dkyil 'khor ni snying po yin la de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na dkyil 'khor te chos rnams kyi snying po bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor ni snying po yin la de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na dkyil 'khor te chos rnams kyi snying po bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mandala is the essence, and since it is taken up and held, it is a mandala, meaning the collection of the essences of phenomena.

original: de byin gyis brlabs pa ni sprul pa ste de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ni sgra'i tshogs so //
analyzed: de byin gyis brlabs pa ni sprul pa ste de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ni sgra'i tshogs so //
translated: Its consecration is the emanation, and the chapter that clarifies that is the collection of words.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni thog ma'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni thog ma'o //
translated: The first is the beginning.

original: rdzogs so zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o//
analyzed: rdzogs so zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o//
translated: The end is the conclusion.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa'i bshad sbyar snyim pa'i me tog las le'u dang po'o //
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa'i bshad sbyar snyim pa'i me tog las le'u dang po'o //
translated: This is the first chapter of the Flower in the Lap, a commentary on the Guhyasamaja.

original: / dngos grub mchog la thabs las byung ba ni le'u dang por bstan la /
analyzed: / dngos grub mchog la thabs las byung ba ni le'u dang por bstan la /
translated: The supreme power is taught in the first chapter as arising from the method.

original: de'i thabs ni bsnyen pa dang nye ba'i sgrub pa dang sgrub pa dang sgrub chen po ste bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i thabs ni bsnyen pa dang nye ba'i sgrub pa dang sgrub pa dang sgrub chen po ste bzhi'o //
translated: Its method is the four: the approach, the close approach, the accomplishment, and the great accomplishment.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis le'u 'di nas bzung ste nye ba'i sgrub pa dang / bsnyen pa dang / sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa chen po'i rim gyis le'u lnga pa'i bar du gsungs la /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis le'u 'di nas bzung ste nye ba'i sgrub pa dang / bsnyen pa dang / sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa chen po'i rim gyis le'u lnga pa'i bar du gsungs la /
translated: Moreover, the Lord has taught from this chapter up to the fifth chapter by way of the sequence of the near-practice, the service, the practice, and the great practice.

original: de bzhin du bzhi pa gzhan dag tu yang gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzhi pa gzhan dag tu yang gsungs so //
translated: And so it is taught in the other four chapters.

original: de bas na mthar chags su bklag pa'i rim gyis le'u rnams ji lta ba bzhin gyi rim par bzhag pa de'i don gcig nye bar sdud pa ni rim pa bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de bas na mthar chags su bklag pa'i rim gyis le'u rnams ji lta ba bzhin gyi rim par bzhag pa de'i don gcig nye bar sdud pa ni rim pa bzhin yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the chapters, which are to be read in sequence, is summarized in sequence.

original: gang yang le'u bco brgyad pa las //
analyzed: gang yang le'u bco brgyad pa las //
translated: And it is said in the eighteenth chapter:

original: lnga pa dgu pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: lnga pa dgu pa nyid dang ni //
translated: The fifth and the ninth,

original: bcu gsum pa dang bcu bdun rnams //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa dang bcu bdun rnams //
translated: The thirteenth and the seventeenth,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: de la nye ba'i sgrub pa ni le'u gnyis pa dang drug pa dang / bcu pa dang / bcu bzhi pa rnams su gtor te gnas pa @229b las de dag gi mngon par rtogs pa'i le'u 'dir dang por bsdus te brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la nye ba'i sgrub pa ni le'u gnyis pa dang drug pa dang / bcu pa dang / bcu bzhi pa rnams su gtor te gnas pa @229b las de dag gi mngon par rtogs pa'i le'u 'dir dang por bsdus te brjod par bya'o //
translated: The approximation is scattered throughout chapters two, six, ten, and fourteen, and their realizations are summarized and described here in the first chapter.

original: 'dir yan lag drug gi bsnyen pa nan tan du byas pa'i sgrub pa pos /
analyzed: 'dir yan lag drug gi bsnyen pa nan tan du byas pa'i sgrub pa pos /
translated: Here, the practitioner who is intent on the approximation of the six-branched yoga

original: skye bo med pa'i ri'i phug pa la sogs par gnas bcas te nang par gyi dus su bsam gtan gyi khang par zhugs la /
analyzed: skye bo med pa'i ri'i phug pa la sogs par gnas bcas te nang par gyi dus su bsam gtan gyi khang par zhugs la /
translated: should live in a mountain cave, etc., free of people, and in the morning enter the meditation hut.

original: lam la gnas pa'i bar gyi cho ga rjes su spyad nas snying rje chen po bskyed de /
analyzed: lam la gnas pa'i bar gyi cho ga rjes su spyad nas snying rje chen po bskyed de /
translated: Having performed the rite up to abiding in the path, he should generate great compassion.

original: don dam pa byang chub kyi sems bskyed la /
analyzed: don dam pa byang chub kyi sems bskyed la /
translated: He should generate the ultimate thought of awakening.

original: stod pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs nas chos 'byung ba'i nang du chud pa'i sna tshogs padma'i lte ba la gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte bar gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus ma'i stan la 'dug par bdag nyid mos par bya'o🔽// gal te de mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa'am /
analyzed: stod pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs nas chos 'byung ba'i nang du chud pa'i sna tshogs padma'i lte ba la gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte bar gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus ma'i stan la 'dug par bdag nyid mos par bya'o // gal te de mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa'am /
translated: Having blessed it with the mantra of the exalted wisdom of Akshobhya, one should imagine oneself seated on the seat in the center of the celestial mansion located at the center of the variegated vajra located at the center of the variegated lotus located within the source of phenomena.🔽If one is a practitioner of Akshobhya,

original: de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: or a practitioner of his family,

original: snying ga'i nyi ma dang rdo rje'i dbus su rang gi sems nyid mi bskyod pa'i thugs dang de'i sngags kyi rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: snying ga'i nyi ma dang rdo rje'i dbus su rang gi sems nyid mi bskyod pa'i thugs dang de'i sngags kyi rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: then one should imagine one's own mind in the center of the sun and vajra at the heart as the mind of Akshobhya and in the form of his mantra.

original: sngags de yang yi ge h'um kha dog sngo bar reg bya tsha zhing sgra rtsub mo ste de'i rnam pa'i sems kyis lha thams cad mi bskyod pa'i de kho na nyid du rnam par brtags te /
analyzed: sngags de yang yi ge h'um kha dog sngo bar reg bya tsha zhing sgra rtsub mo ste de'i rnam pa'i sems kyis lha thams cad mi bskyod pa'i de kho na nyid du rnam par brtags te /
translated: That mantra is the syllable hūṃ, blue in color, hot to the touch, and with a harsh sound. With a mind in the aspect of that, one should imagine all the deities as the reality of Akshobhya.

original: sems kyi 'od zer spros pa ni snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems kyi 'od zer spros pa ni snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The light rays of the mind are emitted, which is the samādhi of obtaining light.

original: 'od zer des de'i lha'i bkod pa rnams nam mkha'i ngos la khyab par bltas pa ni snang pa mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'od zer des de'i lha'i bkod pa rnams nam mkha'i ngos la khyab par bltas pa ni snang pa mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The light rays pervade the divine array in the sky, which is the samādhi of increasing light.

original: de nas 'od zer des 'di dag thams cad sems nyid do snyam du bsams te lha'i bkod pa de rnams bkug nas sems la bcug pa ni sngags la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas 'od zer des 'di dag thams cad sems nyid do snyam du bsams te lha'i bkod pa de rnams bkug nas sems la bcug pa ni sngags la dmigs pa ste /
translated: Then, thinking that all of this is the mind itself, the divine array is drawn in with the light rays and placed in the mind, which is the focus on the mantra.

original: de kho na nyid kyi don la phyogs gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don la phyogs gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: That is the samādhi that is one-sided with regard to the meaning of reality.

original: de nas gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa yang med do snyam ste /
analyzed: de nas gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa yang med do snyam ste /
translated: Then, thinking that since there is no apprehended object, there is also no apprehending subject,

original: sems de yang sems ma yin par shes pa ni sems la dmigs pa ste bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems de yang sems ma yin par shes pa ni sems la dmigs pa ste bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: the mind is recognized to be not mind, which is the focus on the mind, the uninterrupted samādhi.

original: de nas sngags yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid mi bskyod pa ni ngag la dmigs pa ste mi bskyod pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: de nas sngags yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid mi bskyod pa ni ngag la dmigs pa ste mi bskyod pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: Then, oneself as Akṣobhya arises from the complete transformation of the mantra, which is the focus on the voice, the enlightenment of Akṣobhya.
