original: mi bskyod pa'i sku de yang aindra n'i la lta bu zhal nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po khro bo rdo rje sems dpas brgyan pa'i ral pa'i cod pan can nyi ma'i 'od dang zla ba'i gdan can rdo rje'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i sku de yang aindra n'i la lta bu zhal nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po khro bo rdo rje sems dpas brgyan pa'i ral pa'i cod pan can nyi ma'i 'od dang zla ba'i gdan can rdo rje'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /
translated: That body of Akshobhya is like sapphire, with a black, white, and red face, wrathful, adorned with Vajrasattva, with a topknot of hair, with the light of the sun and a seat of the moon, seated in vajra posture.

original: phyag gnyis kyis rang dang 'dra ba'i rig ma la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis kyis rang dang 'dra ba'i rig ma la 'khyud pa /
translated: With two hands he embraces a knowledge-woman similar to himself.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis rdo rje dang ral gri dang nor @230a * //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis rdo rje dang ral gri dang nor @230a * //
translated: The remaining hands hold a vajra, sword, jewel,

original: bu dang padma bsnams pa ste /
analyzed: bu dang padma bsnams pa ste /
translated: and lotus.

original: de'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu /
translated: After that,

original: dngos po'i 'di dag ma skyes pas //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'di dag ma skyes pas //
translated: since these things are unarisen,

original: chos rnams med cing chos nyid med //
analyzed: chos rnams med cing chos nyid med //
translated: there are no phenomena and no reality.

original: nam mkha' lta bur bdag med par //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur bdag med par //
translated: Like space, without a self,

original: byang chub tshul ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tshul ni bstan pa'o //
translated: the method of enlightenment is taught.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pas mi bskyod pa'i byang chub rnam par spyad pa ni byang chub kyi sems rags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pas mi bskyod pa'i byang chub rnam par spyad pa ni byang chub kyi sems rags pa'o //
translated: By this verse, the practice of Akshobhya enlightenment is the coarse awakening mind.

original: de'i rjes la sems kyi gnas dang mgo dang mgrin pa'i zla ba rnams la rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma rnams bsams te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la sems kyi gnas dang mgo dang mgrin pa'i zla ba rnams la rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma rnams bsams te /
translated: After that, one should visualize the vajra, wheel, and lotus in the head, throat, and heart moon disks.

original: de dag gi lte ba rnams su h'um dang rig sngags dang a'a: rnams blta'o //
analyzed: de dag gi lte ba rnams su h'um dang rig sngags dang a'a: rnams blta'o //
translated: One should see the letters hūṃ, rikṣa, and āḥ in their centers.

original: de'i 'og tu snying ga'i nyi ma la rdo rje'i lte bar yi ge h'um de'i thig ler h'um phra mo las nas kyi 'bru tshad tsam gyi rdo rje sngon po cung zad gdengs pa bsams te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu snying ga'i nyi ma la rdo rje'i lte bar yi ge h'um de'i thig ler h'um phra mo las nas kyi 'bru tshad tsam gyi rdo rje sngon po cung zad gdengs pa bsams te /
translated: After that, on the sun at the heart, in the center of the vajra, one should visualize the letter hūṃ, and in the drop of that, a blue vajra the size of a barley grain, arisen from a subtle hūṃ, slightly bent.

original: de nyid las mtshan ma'i sprin spros te /
analyzed: de nyid las mtshan ma'i sprin spros te /
translated: From that, one should emanate clouds of insignia.

original: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i tshogs de'i bdag nyid du byas la /
analyzed: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i tshogs de'i bdag nyid du byas la /
translated: One should make the collection of the animate and inanimate world into his own nature.

original: sna tshogs de dag gong bur byas te shin tu phra ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par gyur nas mtshan ma'i dbus su bsdus la /
analyzed: sna tshogs de dag gong bur byas te shin tu phra ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par gyur nas mtshan ma'i dbus su bsdus la /
translated: One should gather that variety into a mass, which becomes the form of a very subtle sun disk, and one should gather it into the center of the insignia.

original: nyi ma der mi bskyod pa'i sa bon mchog tu phra ba bsams pa 'di ni sngags kyis brtag pa dang ting nge 'dzin byang chub sbyor ba ste phra mo'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: nyi ma der mi bskyod pa'i sa bon mchog tu phra ba bsams pa 'di ni sngags kyis brtag pa dang ting nge 'dzin byang chub sbyor ba ste phra mo'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The supreme subtle seed of Akṣobhya is visualized on that day. This is the mantra investigation and the bodhicitta application of meditative concentration, the subtle bodhicitta.

original: de'o 'og tu sems kyi gnas dang mgo dang mgrin pa'i zla ba la gnas pa'i mtshan ma'i yi ge'i rnam pa thugs kyi rdo rje la sogs pa rnams su de'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs par byas te /🔽aom sarba ta th'a ga ta tsitta badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /🔽aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: de'o 'og tu sems kyi gnas dang mgo dang mgrin pa'i zla ba la gnas pa'i mtshan ma'i yi ge'i rnam pa thugs kyi rdo rje la sogs pa rnams su de'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs par byas te / aom sarba ta th'a ga ta tsitta badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham / aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Then, below that, the seed syllables that are the form of the signs abiding in the moon at the head and throat are blessed by their mantras in the heart vajra and so on.🔽oṃ sarva tathāgata citta vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ🔽oṃ sarva tathāgata kāya vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta b'a ka badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta b'a ka badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata vāca vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ

original: de'i 'og tu sngags kyi dam tshig dang dkyil 'khor gyi dam tshig dang byang chub kyi dam tshig ces bya ba'i dga' ba'i mchod pa gsum byas te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sngags kyi dam tshig dang dkyil 'khor gyi dam tshig dang byang chub kyi dam tshig ces bya ba'i dga' ba'i mchod pa gsum byas te /
translated: Then, one should make the three offerings of joy called the mantra commitment, the mandala commitment, and the enlightenment commitment.

original: de la snying gar gnas pa'i mtshan ma phra mo las gti mug dang zhe sdang dang / 'dod chags dang rdo rje rnams mtshan ma phra mor nam mkha' khyab par spros pa ni sngags kyi dam tshig go //
analyzed: de la snying gar gnas pa'i mtshan ma phra mo las gti mug dang zhe sdang dang / 'dod chags dang rdo rje rnams mtshan ma phra mor nam mkha' khyab par spros pa ni sngags kyi dam tshig go //
translated: Therein, the mantra commitment is the emanation of the subtle signs of delusion, hatred, passion, and vajra, from the subtle sign located at the heart, pervading space.

original: de dag bsdus nas shin tu phra ba'i rang gi sngags kyi gdan la rig ma'i dbang phyug tu bcug ste /
analyzed: de dag bsdus nas shin tu phra ba'i rang gi sngags kyi gdan la rig ma'i dbang phyug tu bcug ste /
translated: Having gathered them, one should cause the lord of the knowledge consort to enter into the seat of one's own mantra, which is extremely subtle.

original: de'i steng du rang gi sngags kyi yi ge chags pa ste zhen pas rig ma'i dbang phyug de la chags pa ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du rang gi sngags kyi yi ge chags pa ste zhen pas rig ma'i dbang phyug de la chags pa ste /
translated: One should view the lord of the knowledge consort with passion, that is, with attachment, by the attachment, that is, the fixation, of the syllable of one's mantra on him.

original: zhen pas blta ba 'di ni dkyil 'khor gyi dam tshig go //
analyzed: zhen pas blta ba 'di ni dkyil 'khor gyi dam tshig go //
translated: This is the mandala commitment.

original: de nas rig pa'i dbang phyug las rig pa'i @230b sku'i sprin thams cad spros te slar de nyid du bsdus la /
analyzed: de nas rig pa'i dbang phyug las rig pa'i @230b sku'i sprin thams cad spros te slar de nyid du bsdus la /
translated: Then, one should emanate from the lord of the knowledge consort the clouds of all knowledge consorts' bodies and again gather them into him.

original: de'i steng na gnas pa'i sngags kyi yi ge las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i sprin thams cad spros te /
analyzed: de'i steng na gnas pa'i sngags kyi yi ge las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i sprin thams cad spros te /
translated: Above that, from the mantra syllables, all the cloud-like bodies of the Tathagatas are emanated.

original: slar de nyid du bsdus pa 'di ni byang chub kyi dam tshig go //
analyzed: slar de nyid du bsdus pa 'di ni byang chub kyi dam tshig go //
translated: They are reabsorbed right there. This is the commitment of enlightenment.

original: de nas dga' ba'i mchog de nyid //
analyzed: de nas dga' ba'i mchog de nyid //
translated: Then, that very supreme joy,

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: “Om, I am the nature of the vajra of the love of all the Tathagatas.”

original: zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Thus, one should bless it.

original: de nas snying ga'i sngags kyi 'od zer gyi sgo rnams las mchod pa'i lha mo drug phyung ste /
analyzed: de nas snying ga'i sngags kyi 'od zer gyi sgo rnams las mchod pa'i lha mo drug phyung ste /
translated: Then, from the doors of the light rays of the mantra at the heart, six offering goddesses emerge.

original: de la lha mo lnga las ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i sprin spro'o //
analyzed: de la lha mo lnga las ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i sprin spro'o //
translated: From the five goddesses, clouds of the five sensual qualities are emanated.

original: drug pa las ni mchod pa rnam pa lnga'i sprin sprul te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: drug pa las ni mchod pa rnam pa lnga'i sprin sprul te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par mchod la /
translated: From the sixth, clouds of the five kinds of offerings are emanated, and all the Tathagatas are truly worshipped.

original: mchod pa de nyid /
analyzed: mchod pa de nyid /
translated: That very offering,

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: “Om, I am the nature of the vajra offering of all the Tathagatas.”

original: zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab po //
translated: Thus, one should bless it.

original: le'u 'di'i don gyis gtso bo ni nye bar sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: le'u 'di'i don gyis gtso bo ni nye bar sgrub pa yin te /
translated: The main point of this chapter is the near attainment.

original: de las byang chub kyi sems nyid kyi skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de las byang chub kyi sems nyid kyi skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to open the section on the thought of awakening itself,🔽then, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is stated.

original: sku la sogs pa'i bdag po ni rnam pa kun nas sku la sogs pa dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i bdag po ni rnam pa kun nas sku la sogs pa dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The lord of the body, etc. is the lord of the body, etc. in all aspects, because of the division of the body, etc.

original: mchod pa ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: mchod pa ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: The worship is of the goddesses Rupavajrā, etc.

original: 'di skad ces bya ba ni gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba ni gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshig ste /
translated: This is said is the words of supplication.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad du gsol /
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad du gsol /
translated: O Blessed One, please explain.

original: zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: is the connection.

original: byang chub la rnam par spyod pa'i sems ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: byang chub la rnam par spyod pa'i sems ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The thought of awakening is the thought of awakening to enlightenment.

original: bla ma ni lhag ma ste 'di las bla mar gyur pa'i lhag pa med pas bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma ni lhag ma ste 'di las bla mar gyur pa'i lhag pa med pas bla na med pa'o //
translated: The unsurpassed is the unsurpassed, because there is nothing higher than this.

original: de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: gsang ba ste sku la sogs pa'i gsang ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ste sku la sogs pa'i gsang ba'o //
translated: The secret is the secret of the body, etc.

original: su'i zhe na /
analyzed: su'i zhe na /
translated: Whose?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ste dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ste dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po rnams kyi'o //
translated: Of all the Tathagatas, that is, of the lords of the mandala.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po mchog ste /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po mchog ste /
translated: It is the supreme essence of body, speech, and mind.

original: sku dang / gsung dang / thugs nam mkha' dang mtshungs pas snying po yin la /
analyzed: sku dang / gsung dang / thugs nam mkha' dang mtshungs pas snying po yin la /
translated: It is the essence because of the sameness of body, speech, and mind with space.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba drug dang 'brel pa de bas na /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba drug dang 'brel pa de bas na /
translated: It is related to the six wheel-turning kings.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'di ni rnam pa drug yin la yang rags pa dang phra mo'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'di ni rnam pa drug yin la yang rags pa dang phra mo'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this thought of enlightenment is sixfold, and by the division into gross and subtle, it becomes twelvefold.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /🔽byang chub rnam spyad byang chub sems //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni / byang chub rnam spyad byang chub sems //
translated: Here is a verse.🔽The thought of enlightenment is said to be twelvefold,

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis dag tu brjod //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis dag tu brjod //
translated: in the analysis of enlightenment.🔽The second verse gives the six gross and the six subtle,

original: gnyis pa yis ni rags pa drug / phra mo drug ni drug @231a * //
analyzed: gnyis pa yis ni rags pa drug / phra mo drug ni drug @231a * //
translated: by the six.

original: pas so // sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje ni bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: pas so // sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje ni bsdus pa ste /
translated: The vajra of body, etc., is the collection.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the name Guhyasamaja.

original: mkhyen zhing zhes bya ba ni thugs la bzhag nas so //
analyzed: mkhyen zhing zhes bya ba ni thugs la bzhag nas so //
translated: Knowing, means having placed in the mind.

original: yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni kun du tshol ba'i yid kyis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni kun du tshol ba'i yid kyis brjod pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is the expression by the mind that searches.

original: rnam par rtog pa mnga' bas na yongs su rtog pa ste tshig tu ma brjod par sems kyis rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mnga' bas na yongs su rtog pa ste tshig tu ma brjod par sems kyis rtog pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is the conceptualization by the mind, without verbal expression, of that which is conceptualized.

original: de mkhyen pa ni sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'i mngon par shes pas mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: de mkhyen pa ni sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'i mngon par shes pas mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of that is the knowledge of the superknowledge of the knowledge of the categories of mind.

original: rnam par rtog pa de yang 'dir rnam pa drug ste rgyud gzhan dag las snying gar zla ba'i mtshan ma'i dbus su sngags bkod pa byang chub kyi sems yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin nam zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de yang 'dir rnam pa drug ste rgyud gzhan dag las snying gar zla ba'i mtshan ma'i dbus su sngags bkod pa byang chub kyi sems yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin nam zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang po'o //
translated: That conceptualization is of six kinds here: Is the mantra array in the middle of the moon-mark in the heart, which is the thought of enlightenment in other continuums, also like that here? is the first conceptualization.

original: de ltar na khyad par ci zhig yod nas 'di bla na med pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na khyad par ci zhig yod nas 'di bla na med pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: What is the difference, that this is unsurpassed? is the second.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs yin na ji ltar de de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yin zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs yin na ji ltar de de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yin zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: If it is the body, speech, and mind of a universal monarch, how is it that of all the tathāgatas? is the third.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni sems nyid yin na ji ltar sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid yin zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni sems nyid yin na ji ltar sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid yin zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: How can the mind of enlightenment be the mind itself, the body, speech, and mind?

original: ji ste sngags las skyes pa'i sku gzung ba yin na yang byang chub nyid yin gyi byang chub kyi sems ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: ji ste sngags las skyes pa'i sku gzung ba yin na yang byang chub nyid yin gyi byang chub kyi sems ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: If the body is grasped as arisen from mantra, it is enlightenment itself, not the mind of enlightenment.

original: ji ste yang byang chub la rnam par spyod pa'i sems ni byang chub kyi sems so zhes bya bar 'dod na de ltar na yang sku dang / gsung la byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bas gsung ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ste yang byang chub la rnam par spyod pa'i sems ni byang chub kyi sems so zhes bya bar 'dod na de ltar na yang sku dang / gsung la byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bas gsung ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
translated: If the mind that experiences enlightenment is asserted to be the mind of enlightenment, then the body and speech are called the mind of enlightenment, but speech is not.

original: 'di skad ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i phyir nye bar bshad pa 'dis rnam par rtog pa rnams bsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i phyir nye bar bshad pa 'dis rnam par rtog pa rnams bsal ba'o //
translated: This is the explanation for generating the mind of enlightenment, which removes conceptualization.

original: khyed kyis skyed cig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: khyed kyis skyed cig ces bya ba la /
translated: You should generate it.

original: sems zhes bya ba ni ji ltar grags pa bzhin du snying ga'i zla ba dang mtshan ma'i dbus su sngags kyi rnam pa'i sems skyed cig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba ni ji ltar grags pa bzhin du snying ga'i zla ba dang mtshan ma'i dbus su sngags kyi rnam pa'i sems skyed cig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mind called “mind” is to be generated in the form of the mantra in the middle of the moon and the sign at the heart, just as it is well known.

original: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa dang po bsal to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa dang po bsal to //
translated: This removes the first doubt.

original: lus lta bu zhes bya ni chos gtso bor gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lus lta bu zhes bya ni chos gtso bor gyur pa ste /
translated: The body-like is the Dharma that is the principal.

original: lus kyi sgras ni lus nyid dang lta bu zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ste de dag tu skyed cig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus kyi sgras ni lus nyid dang lta bu zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ste de dag tu skyed cig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “body” is a form of the word “body-like.” Generate them in those, is the meaning.

original: de la nam mkha'i gtos khyab pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba gsum bsdus pa'i sngags kyi lha'i tshogs ni lus so //
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i gtos khyab pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba gsum bsdus pa'i sngags kyi lha'i tshogs ni lus so //
translated: Therein, the body is the assembly of mantra deities, which is the collection of the three secrets of all the Tathāgatas pervading the realm of space.

original: @231b lus nyid kyis te lus kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: @231b lus nyid kyis te lus kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis bskyed pa ste /
translated: By the body itself, by the nature of the body, they are generated.

original: sems kyi 'od zer rnams kyis de dag bkug nas sems la lus rnams bcug pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi 'od zer rnams kyis de dag bkug nas sems la lus rnams bcug pa'o //
translated: Having summoned them with the light rays of the mind, the bodies are placed in the mind.

original: 'di ni sngags la dmigs pa ste gzung ba med pa'i ye shes yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sngags la dmigs pa ste gzung ba med pa'i ye shes yin no //
translated: This is the observation of the mantra, the wisdom of non-apprehension.

original: de la sogs pa'i khyad par bstan pas gnyis pa yang bsal to //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i khyad par bstan pas gnyis pa yang bsal to //
translated: By teaching these and other distinctions, the second [alternative] is also eliminated.

original: sems de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin du mngon par brjod pas de dag gi ngag dang skur yang de 'gyur ba'i phyir gsum pa yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: sems de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin du mngon par brjod pas de dag gi ngag dang skur yang de 'gyur ba'i phyir gsum pa yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: Since that mind is expressed as the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas, it is also eliminated as their speech and body.

original: lta bu ni rang bzhin te sems gnyis pos stong pa'i rang bzhin du skyed cig pa'o ;
analyzed: lta bu ni rang bzhin te sems gnyis pos stong pa'i rang bzhin du skyed cig pa'o ;
translated: The word like [means] nature. Generate the nature empty of the two minds.

original: / gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa yang bkag pa 'di ni sems la dmigs pa ste 'dzin pa med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: / gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa yang bkag pa 'di ni sems la dmigs pa ste 'dzin pa med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The absence of an object also negates the subject. This is the observation of mind, the wisdom of the absence of subject.

original: lus sems kyi rnam pa lta bu zhes bya ba la sems de nyid kyi rnam pa sngags gang yin pa de yongs su gyur pa las sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams nam mkha'i bdag nyid can byang chub kyi mtshan nyid 'khor los sgyur ba'i skur skyed cig ces
analyzed: lus sems kyi rnam pa lta bu zhes bya ba la sems de nyid kyi rnam pa sngags gang yin pa de yongs su gyur pa las sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams nam mkha'i bdag nyid can byang chub kyi mtshan nyid 'khor los sgyur ba'i skur skyed cig ces
translated: The word like [means] the form of the body and mind. Generate the body, speech, and mind, which have the nature of space, as the body of the Cakravartin, the characteristic of enlightenment, from the transformation of the mantra, which is the form of that very mind.

original: bya ba'o // 'di ni ngag la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'o // 'di ni ngag la dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the action. This is the focus on speech.

original: sems tshig tu brjod pa lta bur zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa ste /
analyzed: sems tshig tu brjod pa lta bur zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa ste /
translated: The mind is like speech, as it were. This is the third characteristic.

original: byang chub kyi tshigs su bcad pa brjod nas de'i rnam pa lta bu'i sems kyi byang chub rnam par spyad pa'i sems skyed cig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshigs su bcad pa brjod nas de'i rnam pa lta bu'i sems kyi byang chub rnam par spyad pa'i sems skyed cig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having spoken the verse on enlightenment, the mind that is like that is the generation of the mind of enlightenment practice. This is the meaning.

original: 'dis ni bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa yang bsal te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa yang bsal te /
translated: By this, the fourth, fifth, and sixth are also excluded.

original: 'di ltar 'dir dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyis bsgrubs pa'i sku ni byang chub yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyis bsgrubs pa'i sku ni byang chub yin la /
translated: Thus, here, enlightenment is the body that is accomplished by the three aspects of focus.

original: de la rnam par spyad pa'i sems ni byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bar 'dod pas lus la dmigs pa'i sems dang ngag gi rnam pa dang rnam par spyad pa'i rang bzhin dag yin pa'i phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid do //
analyzed: de la rnam par spyad pa'i sems ni byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bar 'dod pas lus la dmigs pa'i sems dang ngag gi rnam pa dang rnam par spyad pa'i rang bzhin dag yin pa'i phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid do //
translated: Since it is asserted that the mind of practice on that is the mind of enlightenment, it is the body, speech, and mind because of being the mind that focuses on the body, the aspect of speech, and the nature of practice.

original: yang na byang chub de nyid sku dang gsung dang thugs nam mkha' lta bu'i mtshan nyid pas sku dang gsung dang thugs yin la /
analyzed: yang na byang chub de nyid sku dang gsung dang thugs nam mkha' lta bu'i mtshan nyid pas sku dang gsung dang thugs yin la /
translated: Or, since that enlightenment itself has the characteristic of a body, speech, and mind that are like space, it is a body, speech, and mind.

original: byang chub de la rnam par spyad pa'i sems kyang sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub de la rnam par spyad pa'i sems kyang sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes bya'o //
translated: And the mind that experiences that enlightenment is also called a body, speech, and mind.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa bsal to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa bsal to //
translated: Therefore, the fourth misconception is eliminated.

original: sngags las skyes pa'i sku la byang chub sems zhes bya ba ni byang chub nyid yin gyi sems su ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang lus kyi sems la sku dang / @232a * //
analyzed: sngags las skyes pa'i sku la byang chub sems zhes bya ba ni byang chub nyid yin gyi sems su ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang lus kyi sems la sku dang / @232a * //
translated: As for the statement that the body born from mantra is called the mind of enlightenment, it is enlightenment itself, not the mind.

original: gsung dang / thugs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang mi 'dod pas der thar bar 'gyur ba med pas rnam par rtog pa lnga pa dang drug pa yang bsal to //
analyzed: gsung dang / thugs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang mi 'dod pas der thar bar 'gyur ba med pas rnam par rtog pa lnga pa dang drug pa yang bsal to //
translated: Since neither the body nor the mind of the body is accepted as a body, speech, and mind, the fifth and sixth misconceptions are eliminated, since there is no liberation in that.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i 'og tu'o //
translated: Then, after the explanation.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni gang gi sngon du rnam par rtog pa skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni gang gi sngon du rnam par rtog pa skyes pa rnams so //
translated: Those refers to the previously arisen misconceptions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams la yod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ste snying ga'i zla ba dang mtshan ma'i dbus su sngags kyi rnam pa'i sems bskyed par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams la yod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ste snying ga'i zla ba dang mtshan ma'i dbus su sngags kyi rnam pa'i sems bskyed par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The bodhisattvas are those who have that, i.e., the mind generated in the form of a mantra in the middle of the moon and the sign at the heart.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni sngags kyi lha thams cad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni sngags kyi lha thams cad do //
translated: All the Tathagatas are all the mantra deities.

original: de rnams kyi sku la sogs pa'i nam mkha' ni sku la sogs pa'i mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku la sogs pa'i nam mkha' ni sku la sogs pa'i mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Their space of body, etc., is the non-apprehension of body, etc.

original: de rnams dang de lta bu zhes zlas phye la 'khor los sgyur ba'i sku bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang de lta bu zhes zlas phye la 'khor los sgyur ba'i sku bsdu ba'o //
translated: They are like that, i.e., the wheel-turning body is collected.

original: de dag gi sbyor ba ni snying ga'i mtshan mar chud pa'i sems la dmigs pa gsum gyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sbyor ba ni snying ga'i mtshan mar chud pa'i sems la dmigs pa gsum gyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: Their yoga is the yoga of the three perceptions of the mind that has entered the sign at the heart.

original: ched du brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun du bzang po zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi lha thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi sems so //
analyzed: ched du brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun du bzang po zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi lha thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi sems so //
translated: The expression of purpose, etc., is the mind that is the nature of all mantra deities.

original: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje ni dmigs su med pa ste de dang ldan pas rdo rje can no //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje ni dmigs su med pa ste de dang ldan pas rdo rje can no //
translated: The vajra of body and so on is unapprehendable, and he is endowed with that, thus he is the vajra-holder.

original: skye ba med pa'i sbyor ba ni skye ba med pa'i rnam par sems pa'i bya bas sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i sbyor ba ni skye ba med pa'i rnam par sems pa'i bya bas sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application of non-production is the application by the activity of thinking in the aspect of non-production.

original: rab tu bsgrags pa zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pas rnam par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bsgrags pa zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pas rnam par dpyod pa'o //
translated: The utterance is the analysis by the verse.

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mgrin gcig tu byang chub thun mong du rnam par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mgrin gcig tu byang chub thun mong du rnam par dpyod pa'o //
translated: Those are the analysis of the common enlightenment by the bodhisattvas with one voice.

original: byang chub sems kyi thun mong gi mtshan nyid bstan nas //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi thun mong gi mtshan nyid bstan nas //
translated: Having taught the common characteristic of the thought of enlightenment,

original: rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the divisions,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, Then, and so on.

original: tshig drug car la yang dang po'i rdo rje'i sgras ni mtshan ma'i don to //
analyzed: tshig drug car la yang dang po'i rdo rje'i sgras ni mtshan ma'i don to //
translated: In all six phrases, the first vajra-sound has the meaning of sign.

original: gnyis pa ni mi phyed pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mi phyed pa'i don to //
translated: The second has the meaning of indivisibility.

original: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi don to //
analyzed: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi don to //
translated: The third has the meaning of meditative stabilization.

original: gshegs pa'i sgra dang po rnams ni sngags kyi tshig ste sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra bzhin de kho na nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gshegs pa'i sgra dang po rnams ni sngags kyi tshig ste sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra bzhin de kho na nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: The first of the terms “gone” are mantra syllables, like the term “buddha,” which is the realization of reality.

original: drug car la yang bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: drug car la yang bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: And all six are called “Blessed One,” which is Vajradhara himself.

original: de la dang por rdo rje 'dzin pa'i byang chub kyi sems gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la dang por rdo rje 'dzin pa'i byang chub kyi sems gsungs pa /
translated: Therein, first of all, the thought of enlightenment of Vajradhara is stated:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Then, etc. The body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas is Vajradhara.

original: de'i rdo rje 'di la yod pas na de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rdo rje 'di la yod pas na de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Since his vajra is here, he is so called.

original: @232b snying ga'i zla bar padma r'a ga ltar dmar ba'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: @232b snying ga'i zla bar padma r'a ga ltar dmar ba'i sbyor bas so //
translated: By the union of the heart moon with the red like a ruby.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni de'i rdo rje ji lta ba de bzhin du gshegs shing rtogs pa'i sngags 'di la yod pas de bzhin gshegs pa ste mtshan ma'i dbus su de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngags bkod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni de'i rdo rje ji lta ba de bzhin du gshegs shing rtogs pa'i sngags 'di la yod pas de bzhin gshegs pa ste mtshan ma'i dbus su de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngags bkod pa'o //
translated: Just as, etc. Just as his vajra, so also the mantra is gone and realized, and since it is here, it is the Tathagata, the mantra of the Tathagata arranged in the center of the sign.

original: sngags de yang yi ge h'um dkar ba dang bsil ba dang snyan pa'i sgra dang ldan pa de gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i yid tsam yin pas yi ge gsum ste shes bya dang shes pa bsdus te gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngags de yang yi ge h'um dkar ba dang bsil ba dang snyan pa'i sgra dang ldan pa de gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i yid tsam yin pas yi ge gsum ste shes bya dang shes pa bsdus te gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That mantra is the three syllables, which are the mind alone, empty of the apprehended and the apprehender, endowed with the sound of the white, cool, and sweet syllable hūṃ.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni sngags kyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni sngags kyi lha rnams so //
translated: “All tathāgatas” means the mantra deities.

original: de rnams kyi mngon par byang chub pa'i tshul de kho na nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mngon par byang chub pa'i tshul de kho na nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The way of their manifest enlightenment is the vajra-holder of the wisdom of the extremely pure sphere of reality, thatness.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The samādhi that has that as its object is also called that.

original: de nyid ni mi phyed pas na rdo rje'i snyoms par zhugs pa ni dmigs pa gsum gyis mngon du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mi phyed pas na rdo rje'i snyoms par zhugs pa ni dmigs pa gsum gyis mngon du byas pa ste /
translated: That itself is the vajra, because it is indivisible. The meditative absorption is the actualization by means of the three objects.

original: sngags kyi rnam pa'i sems de las kun du 'od zer spros pa ni snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sngags kyi rnam pa'i sems de las kun du 'od zer spros pa ni snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The light rays that radiate from the mind in the aspect of the mantra is the samādhi of attaining illumination.

original: 'od zer de nyid kyis phyogs bcur kun du khyab par bzhugs pa'i sngags kyi lha rnams kyi bkod pa mthong ba ni snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'od zer de nyid kyis phyogs bcur kun du khyab par bzhugs pa'i sngags kyi lha rnams kyi bkod pa mthong ba ni snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The vision of the array of the mantra deities pervading the ten directions with those light rays is the meditative stabilization of the increase of appearance.

original: de rnams des bsdus nas sems kyi nang du bcug pa ni sngags la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams des bsdus nas sems kyi nang du bcug pa ni sngags la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The gathering of those deities and their entry into the mind is the meditative stabilization focused on the mantra.

original: de kho na nyid phyogs gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid phyogs gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: That is the meditative stabilization of one aspect of reality.🔽The knowledge that there is no object of apprehension and the knowledge that there is no subject of apprehension is the meditative stabilization focused on the mind.🔽That is the meditative stabilization without obstacles.

original: gzung ba med par shes nas de la 'dzin pa yang med par shes pa ni sems las dmigs pa zhes bya ba bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems skye ba la bar du gcod par nus pa ni bar chad de de
analyzed: gzung ba med par shes nas de la 'dzin pa yang med par shes pa ni sems las dmigs pa zhes bya ba bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems skye ba la bar du gcod par nus pa ni bar chad de de
translated: The ability to obstruct the arising of the supramundane mind is an obstacle.

original: 'di la med pas na bar chad med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la med pas na bar chad med pa'o //
translated: Since this is not present, it is without obstacles.

original: de nas ngag gi bdag nyid kyis sngags yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje 'dzin pa'i skur bskyed pa ni ngag la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas ngag gi bdag nyid kyis sngags yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje 'dzin pa'i skur bskyed pa ni ngag la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Then, the generation of the mantra deity’s form from the transformation of the mantra through the nature of speech is the meditative stabilization focused on speech.

original: de ltar dmigs pa gsum gyis rdo rje 'dzin pa la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te byang chub kyi sems 'di zhes bya ba la ngag la dmigs pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa ni byang chub yin la /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa gsum gyis rdo rje 'dzin pa la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te byang chub kyi sems 'di zhes bya ba la ngag la dmigs pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa ni byang chub yin la /
translated: Vajradhara, the object of speech, is enlightenment.

original: de la nye bar spyod pa'i sems ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: de la nye bar spyod pa'i sems ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The thought that experiences that is the thought of enlightenment.

original: dngos po med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po med pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi @233a * //🔽yul lo // bsgom pa med ces bya ba la bsgom pa ni dga' ma rnams kyi 'jug pa ste de med pa ni de rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po med pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi @233a * // yul lo // bsgom pa med ces bya ba la bsgom pa ni dga' ma rnams kyi 'jug pa ste de med pa ni de rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As for “non-entity,” etc., non-entity is the domain of the Reality limit.🔽“Non-contemplation” is the engagement of the beloveds; the absence of that is the absence of their domain.

original: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba ni dga' ma rnams te de dag kyang de la bsgom pa ma yin te de dag ni de'i yul can du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba ni dga' ma rnams te de dag kyang de la bsgom pa ma yin te de dag ni de'i yul can du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Contemplation” is the beloveds; they are not the contemplation of that, because they do not exist as its subject.

original: 'di ltar de rnams ni mngon par brjod pas ro tha dad pa yin la de'i brjod du med pas ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bsgom par bya ba bsgom pa min pa dang / de rnams der ro gcig tu gyur pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin ni de nyams su myong ba yin pa de'i phyir dngos po bsgom pa min pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar de rnams ni mngon par brjod pas ro tha dad pa yin la de'i brjod du med pas ro gcig pa'i phyir ro // de ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bsgom par bya ba bsgom pa min pa dang / de rnams der ro gcig tu gyur pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin ni de nyams su myong ba yin pa de'i phyir dngos po bsgom pa min pa dang /
translated: Thus, they are of different tastes due to verbal expression, and of one taste due to its inexpressibility.

original: bde ba chen po'i sems bskyed pa don dam par ma skyes pa dang bsgoms pas rnyed pa ma yin zhing dmigs par gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i sems bskyed pa don dam par ma skyes pa dang bsgoms pas rnyed pa ma yin zhing dmigs par gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus means that because what is to be cultivated is not cultivated, and they become of one taste there, the nature of bliss is experienced. Therefore, the noncultivation of entities, the generation of the mind of great bliss, is not ultimately generated and not attained through cultivation, and is not an object.🔽Cultivation is also negated there.

original: bsgom pa yang der bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyi byang chub rnam par dpyad pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa yang der bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyi byang chub rnam par dpyad pa ste /
translated: This is the analysis of the enlightenment of the vajra holder.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān has said this.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdo rje ni ting nge 'dzin te de la snyoms par zhugs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdo rje ni ting nge 'dzin te de la snyoms par zhugs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The vajra of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas is the samadhi, and he entered into that samadhi.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni snyoms par zhugs pa yin la gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor rnams kyis de bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni snyoms par zhugs pa yin la gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor rnams kyis de bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The word thus means that he entered into the samadhi, and the word gone means that the retinue realized it in the same way.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni //🔽dga' ma rnams ni bsdus pa yis //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni // dga' ma rnams ni bsdus pa yis //
translated: Here is the verse:🔽The bliss of experiencing the dharmadhatu

original: chos dbyings nyams su myong ba bde //
analyzed: chos dbyings nyams su myong ba bde //
translated: is gathered from the consorts.🔽 That is known as the vajra holder's verse,

original: de ni skye med rnyed med du //🔽rdor 'dzin tshigs su bcad pa shes //🔽rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs pa //
analyzed: de ni skye med rnyed med du // rdor 'dzin tshigs su bcad pa shes // rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs pa //
translated: which is obtained as unborn and unobtainable.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni rdo rje 'dzin gyi rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni rdo rje 'dzin gyi rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: The explanation of Vairochana and so forth should be understood following the Vajra Holder.

original: bye brag tu gyur pa rnams 'dir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu gyur pa rnams 'dir bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, the distinctions should be explained.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs ka'i zla ba la 'khor lo dkar po rtsibs brgyad pa'i mtshan ma'i nang du rab sngags bkod de /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs ka'i zla ba la 'khor lo dkar po rtsibs brgyad pa'i mtshan ma'i nang du rab sngags bkod de /
translated: On the moon at the heart of Vairocana, one should arrange the seed syllables in the center of the sign, the white eight-spoked wheel.

original: de yang gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi don du yi ge gsum po 'dis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi don du yi ge gsum po 'dis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, these three seed syllables indicate the meaning of emptiness, the nature of which is primordially unborn.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni ma lus par yang dag par thugs su chud pa ste byang chub las ma gtogs pa med pas ma @233b lus par thugs su chud pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni ma lus par yang dag par thugs su chud pa ste byang chub las ma gtogs pa med pas ma @233b lus par thugs su chud pa yin la /
translated: The realization of all the Tathāgatas is the complete comprehension of everything, since there is nothing apart from enlightenment.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas yang dag pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas yang dag pa ste /
translated: It is real, since it has the nature of emptiness.

original: gdod nas skye ba med pas so //
analyzed: gdod nas skye ba med pas so //
translated: It is primordially unborn.

original: des na gdod nas skye ba med pas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na gdod nas skye ba med pas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement “the mere pristine consciousness that has the nature of emptiness, which is primordially unborn” is this.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to “Vairocana.”

original: dngos po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni rkang pa drug pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni rkang pa drug pa ste /
translated: All things and so forth. This verse has six lines.

original: yi ge bdun dang bdun dang brgyad dang dgu dang brgyad dang drug gi tshig dag go //
analyzed: yi ge bdun dang bdun dang brgyad dang dgu dang brgyad dang drug gi tshig dag go //
translated: There are seven, seven, eight, nine, eight, and six syllables in the lines.

original: dngos po thams cad ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi sngags kyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi sngags kyi lha rnams so //
translated: All things are the external mantra deities.

original: bral ba ni mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba ni mi ldan pa'o //
translated: Free means not endowed.

original: bstan pa 'di'i nye bar bshad pa ni phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te phung po ni sangs rgyas lnga rnams so //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di'i nye bar bshad pa ni phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te phung po ni sangs rgyas lnga rnams so //
translated: The explanation of this is aggregates and so forth. The aggregates are the five buddhas.

original: khams ni spyan ma la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: khams ni spyan ma la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The elements are the five beginning with Locanā.

original: skye mched ni bcu gnyis te sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: skye mched ni bcu gnyis te sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The sense-fields are twelve, the twelve beginning with Kṣitigarbha and the twelve beginning with Rūpavajrā.

original: mdor bsdus na gzung ba ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus na gzung ba ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: In brief, the apprehended is the form aggregate.

original: 'dzin pa ni tshor ba'i phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni tshor ba'i phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The apprehender is the feeling aggregate and so forth.

original: rnam par spangs pa ni rang rig pa tsam gyi phyir te phung po la sogs pa de rnams rang gi sems yin pas so //
analyzed: rnam par spangs pa ni rang rig pa tsam gyi phyir te phung po la sogs pa de rnams rang gi sems yin pas so //
translated: Because of the mere self-awareness of the abandonment of the aggregates, etc.

original: gnyis kyis stong pa 'di la yod pas na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin te stong pa nyid kyis na gdod ma nyid nas ma skyes pa ste skyes nas 'gog pa ma yin pas gdod nas skye ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis kyis stong pa 'di la yod pas na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin te stong pa nyid kyis na gdod ma nyid nas ma skyes pa ste skyes nas 'gog pa ma yin pas gdod nas skye ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Since this has the nature of emptiness, which is the existence of the emptiness of duality, it is primordially unborn, not merely ceased after having been born.

original: chos bdag med par mnyam nyid pa //
analyzed: chos bdag med par mnyam nyid pa //
translated: The equality of the selflessness of phenomena

original: zhes chos rnams ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes chos rnams ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnams so //
translated: The phenomena are the apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: de rnams med pa ni bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams med pa ni bdag med pa ste /
translated: Their nonexistence is selflessness.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: This is the equality of the three times.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni //
translated: Here is a verse

original: sangs rgyas 'khor lo 'dir don med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'khor lo 'dir don med //
translated: The wheel of the Buddha is not meaningless here.

original: de rnams stong pa nyid kyi bdag //
analyzed: de rnams stong pa nyid kyi bdag //
translated: They are the self of emptiness.

original: gdod nas skye med nyid yin zhes //
analyzed: gdod nas skye med nyid yin zhes //
translated: They are primordially unborn.

original: brtag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa shes //
analyzed: brtag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa shes //
translated: This is known as the verse of investigation.

original: mi bskyod pa yis gsungs pa //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa yis gsungs pa //
translated: Akṣhobhya said

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi bskyod pa'i snying gar nyi ma la mtshan ma rdo rje nag po yid tsam gdengs por 'dug pa'i dbus su de'i sngags yi ge h'um kha dog nag po reg bya tsha ba skra rtsub mo //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi bskyod pa'i snying gar nyi ma la mtshan ma rdo rje nag po yid tsam gdengs por 'dug pa'i dbus su de'i sngags yi ge h'um kha dog nag po reg bya tsha ba skra rtsub mo //
translated: Then, etc. In the heart of Akṣobhya, on a sun, is the sign, a black vajra, standing erect, in the center of which is the mantra syllable hūṃ, black in color, hot to the touch, with rough edges.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i stong pa nyid kyi yid yin pas yi ge gsum po 'di ni shes bya dang shes pa nye bar bsdus pas ro gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i stong pa nyid kyi yid yin pas yi ge gsum po 'di ni shes bya dang shes pa nye bar bsdus pas ro gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it is the mind of the emptiness of the duality of subject and object, these three syllables are of one taste, that is, they are the essence of the object of knowledge and the knower.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i mthar thug par bsam gtan lnga pa ste mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i mthar thug par bsam gtan lnga pa ste mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The inexhaustible of all tathāgatas is the fifth contemplation, which is the culmination of the collection, and is the meaning of Akṣobhya.

original: dngos @234a * //
analyzed: dngos @234a * //
translated: The meaning of the rest is self-evident.

original: po 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni mtha' yas pa'i sngags kyi lha rnams kyi ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems la mtha' yas pa'i skye ba med pas rgya che ba dang bral te bsdus pas so //
analyzed: po 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni mtha' yas pa'i sngags kyi lha rnams kyi ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems la mtha' yas pa'i skye ba med pas rgya che ba dang bral te bsdus pas so //
translated: The these refers to the infinite mantric deities.  The unborn refers to the infinite non-arising of the mind in meditative equipoise, and so it is vast and free from because it is inclusive.

original: de lta na ni chos dang chos nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni chos dang chos nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, there would be a dharma and a dharmata.

original: sems 'dzin pas na chos te zhi gnas so //
analyzed: sems 'dzin pas na chos te zhi gnas so //
translated: The dharma is the mind's retention, which is śamatha.

original: chos nyid kyi rnam pa dang ldan pas na chos nyid de lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rnam pa dang ldan pas na chos nyid de lhag mthong ngo //
translated: The dharmatā is endowed with the aspects of dharmatā, which is vipaśyanā.

original: de dag kyang bzlog par bya ste de la chos gsum po bsam gtan dang po dang / chos bzhi po bsam gtan gnyis pa dang chos nyid bzhi ste bsam gtan gsum po dag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang bzlog par bya ste de la chos gsum po bsam gtan dang po dang / chos bzhi po bsam gtan gnyis pa dang chos nyid bzhi ste bsam gtan gsum po dag go //
translated: Those are also to be reversed: the three dharmas are the first concentration, the four dharmas are the second concentration, and the four dharmatās are the third concentration.

original: de bas na chos nyid med pa zhes bzlog par sbyor ro //
analyzed: de bas na chos nyid med pa zhes bzlog par sbyor ro //
translated: Therefore, the reverse compound without dharmatā is used.

original: chos nyid ni de dag bsdus pa'i sngags kyi thig le bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid ni de dag bsdus pa'i sngags kyi thig le bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
translated: The dharmatā is the fourth concentration, the mantra drop that includes those.

original: chos dang chos nyid de dag med pa ni de bsdus pa'i sems kyi thig le dang sngags kyi thig le gcig tu gyur pa'i bsam gtan lnga pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos nyid de dag med pa ni de bsdus pa'i sems kyi thig le dang sngags kyi thig le gcig tu gyur pa'i bsam gtan lnga pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of those phenomena and reality is the fifth contemplation, in which the mind-drop and mantra-drop, which include those, become one.

original: nam mkha' lta bur bdag med pa ni sems zad pas nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur bdag med pa ni sems zad pas nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: The selflessness like space is like space due to the exhaustion of the mind.

original: byang chub tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni byang chub la rnam par dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni byang chub la rnam par dpyad pa'o //
translated: The method of enlightenment is the analysis of enlightenment.

original: brtan pa ni mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni mi phyed pa'o //
translated: Firm is inseparable.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: chos dang blo ni mdor bsdus pa //
analyzed: chos dang blo ni mdor bsdus pa //
translated: The Dharma and the mind are summarized

original: mkha' dang nam mkha' gnyis su med //
analyzed: mkha' dang nam mkha' gnyis su med //
translated: as space and space, non-dual.

original: 'di ni gsang zad zab mo ste //
analyzed: 'di ni gsang zad zab mo ste //
translated: This is the profound exhaustion of secrets,

original: mi bskyod tshigs su bcad pas shes //
analyzed: mi bskyod tshigs su bcad pas shes //
translated: known through the verse of Akshobhya.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyis gsungs pa //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyis gsungs pa //
translated: Ratnasambhava said:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di dang por yang rin chen dpal gyi sgra'i mthar rdo rje'i sgra lta bu'o ;
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di dang por yang rin chen dpal gyi sgra'i mthar rdo rje'i sgra lta bu'o ;
translated: Then, etc. Here, at the beginning, it is like the sound of Ratnaprabha ending in the sound of vajra.

original: / ji ste rdo rje'i sgra med na yang rin chen gyi sgras rin chen 'byung ldan bstan la /
analyzed: / ji ste rdo rje'i sgra med na yang rin chen gyi sgras rin chen 'byung ldan bstan la /
translated: Even if there is no sound of vajra, the sound of ratna indicates Ratnasambhava.

original: dpal gyi sgras mtshan ma bstan te snying ga'i nyi ma la nor bu rin po che ljang gu zur dgu pa de'i dbus su yi ge sv'a'i sngags te /
analyzed: dpal gyi sgras mtshan ma bstan te snying ga'i nyi ma la nor bu rin po che ljang gu zur dgu pa de'i dbus su yi ge sv'a'i sngags te /
translated: The term “glory” indicates the sign, which is the green nine-faceted jewel on the sun at the heart, in the center of which is the syllable svaṃ of the mantra.

original: thams cad ces bya ba sku phra mo dang rdo rje zhes bya ba thugs phra mo dang don gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i gsung phra mo ste /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba sku phra mo dang rdo rje zhes bya ba thugs phra mo dang don gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i gsung phra mo ste /
translated: “ All” refers to the subtle body, “vajra” to the subtle mind, and “following the meaning” to the subtle speech.

original: de rnams ro gcig par gyur pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: de rnams ro gcig par gyur pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni yi ge gsum mo //
translated: The condensed meaning of those is the three syllables.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag med pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid med pa ste de la rang gi mtshan nyid phra mo rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag med pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid med pa ste de la rang gi mtshan nyid phra mo rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The selflessness of all tathāgatas is the absence of general and specific characteristics, and the subtle specific characteristics are the three [syllables].

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni de dag bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni de dag bsdus pa'o //
translated: The general characteristic is their collection.

original: de dag med pa ni ro gcig tu gyur pa ste rin chen 'byung ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag med pa ni ro gcig tu gyur pa ste rin chen 'byung ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Their absence is their oneness, which is the meaning of “Ratnasaṃbhava.”

original: chos rnams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la chos rnams thams cad ni mtha' yas pa'i sngags kyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la chos rnams thams cad ni mtha' yas pa'i sngags kyi lha rnams so //
translated: “ All phenomena” and so on: all phenomena are the infinite mantra deities.

original: de rnams ni dngos po med pa nyid de chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par spangs pa ste chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni dngos po med pa nyid de chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par spangs pa ste chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are non-existent, devoid of the characteristics of phenomena, because phenomena are devoid of their own characteristics.

original: chos bdag @234b med pa ni phra mo rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: chos bdag @234b med pa ni phra mo rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is the three kinds of subtle [selflessness].

original: kun tu 'byung ba gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu 'byung ba gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The arising of the three kinds of subtle [selflessness] is the single arising.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: sngags kyi lha rnams rang dang ni //
analyzed: sngags kyi lha rnams rang dang ni //
translated: The mantras, deities, and their own

original: spyi yi mtshan nyid yongs su zad //
analyzed: spyi yi mtshan nyid yongs su zad //
translated: and general characteristics are completely exhausted.

original: rin chen gsang gsum dam tshig ste //
analyzed: rin chen gsang gsum dam tshig ste //
translated: The three secrets of the jewel are the commitments,

original: rig 'dzin tshigs su bcad pas shes //
analyzed: rig 'dzin tshigs su bcad pas shes //
translated: known by the vidyadhara's verse.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyis gsungs pa //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyis gsungs pa //
translated: Spoken by Amitabha:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snang ba mtha' yas kyi mtshan ma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad kyi dbus su sngags yi ge a'a: dgod de tha snyad nam mkha' lta bu nyid ni yi ge gnyis kyi don yin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snang ba mtha' yas kyi mtshan ma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad kyi dbus su sngags yi ge a'a: dgod de tha snyad nam mkha' lta bu nyid ni yi ge gnyis kyi don yin no //
translated: Then, and so forth. In the center of the eight-petaled lotus of Amitabha's red sign, the mantra syllable Aḥ is placed. The meaning of the two syllables is the conventional space-like nature.

original: ye shes ni sngags thams cad do //
analyzed: ye shes ni sngags thams cad do //
translated: Wisdom is all mantras.

original: de'i 'bar ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rin po che'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bar ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rin po che'o //
translated: Its blazing is the jewel of the wisdom of equality.

original: sgron ma ni de la so sor rtog pa ste snang ba mtha' yas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgron ma ni de la so sor rtog pa ste snang ba mtha' yas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The lamp is the discrimination of that, which is the meaning of Amitabha.

original: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos rnams ni sngags thams cad kyi gsang ba rnams te nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos rnams ni sngags thams cad kyi gsang ba rnams te nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ma skyes pa'o //
translated: As for the unborn, etc., the phenomena are the secrets of all the mantras, which are unborn like space.

original: ngo bo med de zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan te mtshon par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo med de zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan te mtshon par bya ba'o //
translated: They are without essence, which is Ratnasaṃbhava, the object of indication.

original: bsgom pa med ces bya ba ni de'i bsgom pa'ang med de ;
analyzed: bsgom pa med ces bya ba ni de'i bsgom pa'ang med de ;
translated: There is no cultivation, which is the cultivation of that,

original: mtshon par bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽nam mkha'i gnas su sbyar ba yis //
analyzed: mtshon par bya ba'i phyir ro // nam mkha'i gnas su sbyar ba yis //
translated: because of the object of indication.🔽The application in the abode of space

original: zhes bya ba la gsum po bsdus pa ni nam mkha' yin la bzhi po nye bar bsdus pa ni gnas de dag gi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gsum po bsdus pa ni nam mkha' yin la bzhi po nye bar bsdus pa ni gnas de dag gi sbyor ba'o //
translated: is the application of those abodes, which is the combination of the three.

original: de ltar zhes pa ni de'i phyir zhes pa ste dngos po zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni de'i phyir zhes pa ste dngos po zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: As for thus, therefore, the thing is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: rab tu bsgrags zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bsgrags zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The phrase is proclaimed means that [the mantra] is contemplated.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: sngags rnams gsang ba mkha' yin pas //
analyzed: sngags rnams gsang ba mkha' yin pas //
translated: Since the secret of the mantras is space,

original: mtshan bya mtshan nyid ga la yod //
analyzed: mtshan bya mtshan nyid ga la yod //
translated: how can there be a sign or characteristic?

original: de ltar tha snyad mkhar bsdus pas //
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad mkhar bsdus pas //
translated: Thus, by collecting the conventional,

original: ngag bdag tshigs su bcad pas shes //
analyzed: ngag bdag tshigs su bcad pas shes //
translated: the lord of speech is known through verses.

original: don yod grub pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: don yod grub pas gsungs pa /
translated: Amoghasiddhi said:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di'i 'bras bu dang bcas pas na don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di'i 'bras bu dang bcas pas na don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Then, etc. Since this has a result, it is Amoghasiddhi.

original: de'i snying gar nyi ma la mtshan ma ral gri'i dbus su gnas pa sngags kyi yi ge h'a bkod pa ste mgyogs par 'gro ba dang mi g-yo ba ni yi ge gnyis kyi don to //
analyzed: de'i snying gar nyi ma la mtshan ma ral gri'i dbus su gnas pa sngags kyi yi ge h'a bkod pa ste mgyogs par 'gro ba dang mi g-yo ba ni yi ge gnyis kyi don to //
translated: In the heart of that [Amoghasiddhi], on a sun [disc], is the sign, a sword, in the middle of which is the mantra syllable HÃ. The meaning of the two syllables [HÃ] is swift-moving and unmoving.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis zil gyis mnan pa ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis zil gyis mnan pa ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la gnas pa ste /
translated: [Amoghasiddhi] is overwhelmed by all the Tathāgatas, abiding in the mind-streams of all sentient beings.

original: don yod grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don yod grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the name Amoghasiddhi.

original: chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rang bzhin 'od gsal ba ni chos rnams rang bzhin gyis de bzhin nyid de de dri ma med cing 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rang bzhin 'od gsal ba ni chos rnams rang bzhin gyis de bzhin nyid de de dri ma med cing 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As for the statement “the nature of phenomena is clear light,” the nature of phenomena is suchness, and that is said to be “stainless and clear light.”

original: gdod nas zhes bya ba ni de nyid gdod nas dag pa yin gyi gnyen po'i mthus phyis dag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gdod nas zhes bya ba ni de nyid gdod nas dag pa yin gyi gnyen po'i mthus phyis dag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: “Primordially” means that it is pure from the very beginning, not that it is pure later on through the power of an antidote.

original: nam mkha' bzhin @235a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin @235a * //
translated: Like space.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'khrul ba'i dri ma rnams de'i rang bzhin ma yin te glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'khrul ba'i dri ma rnams de'i rang bzhin ma yin te glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The stains of error are not its nature, because they are adventitious.

original: rang bzhin rnam par dag pa ste ji ltar nam mkha' dud pa dang khug rna dang rdul dang sprin la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam par dag pa ste ji ltar nam mkha' dud pa dang khug rna dang rdul dang sprin la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is pure by nature, just as space is not by nature smoke, mist, dust, clouds, and so on.

original: de nyid kyis na byang chub med pa ste don dam par de rnams sbyangs pas dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na byang chub med pa ste don dam par de rnams sbyangs pas dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that very reason, there is no enlightenment, because ultimately they are not purified by the process of purification.

original: mngon par rtogs pa med pa ni dag par byed pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa med pa ni dag par byed pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the non-realization is not the result of the path of purification.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: Here is the verse:

original: 'jig rten rang bzhin 'od gsal bas //
analyzed: 'jig rten rang bzhin 'od gsal bas //
translated: The world is naturally luminous,

original: thams cad du ni sangs rgyas dngos //
analyzed: thams cad du ni sangs rgyas dngos //
translated: Everywhere the reality of the Buddha.

original: byang chub med cing lam yang med //
analyzed: byang chub med cing lam yang med //
translated: There is no enlightenment and no path,

original: thogs med tshigs su bcad pas shes //
analyzed: thogs med tshigs su bcad pas shes //
translated: As Asanga has understood through the verses.

original: 'dir bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad par gyur pa ni /
translated: Here is the verse of summary:

original: dang po'i snying sngags lhag mos gnas //
analyzed: dang po'i snying sngags lhag mos gnas //
translated: The first is the essence mantra, the remainder is abiding in devotion,

original: dmigs pa rnams kyis mngon du bya //
analyzed: dmigs pa rnams kyis mngon du bya //
translated: The visualizations are to be actualized,

original: lus kyi phyag rgya de nyid gang //
analyzed: lus kyi phyag rgya de nyid gang //
translated: The body mudra is that reality,

original: tshigs bcad rnams kyis de dpyad bya //
analyzed: tshigs bcad rnams kyis de dpyad bya //
translated: Which is analyzed by the verses.

original: phyag rgya che dang tshigs bcad rnams //
analyzed: phyag rgya che dang tshigs bcad rnams //
translated: The great mudra and the verses

original: byang chub rags pa'i rnam dpyad yin //
analyzed: byang chub rags pa'i rnam dpyad yin //
translated: Are the analysis of coarse enlightenment,

original: phra mo gnas dang sa bon ni //
analyzed: phra mo gnas dang sa bon ni //
translated: The subtle abode and seed

original: byang chub phra mo'i rnam dpyad do //
analyzed: byang chub phra mo'i rnam dpyad do //
translated: Are the analysis of subtle enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba'i chos nyid kyi de kho na nyid kyi yi ge rnams thob nas zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni 'khor los sgyur ba drug go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba'i chos nyid kyi de kho na nyid kyi yi ge rnams thob nas zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni 'khor los sgyur ba drug go //
translated: All tathāgatas are the six cakravartins.

original: de rnams kyi sku la sogs pa'i gsang ba ste de la dmigs pa gsum gyis bsgrubs pa'i sku ni sku'i gsang ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku la sogs pa'i gsang ba ste de la dmigs pa gsum gyis bsgrubs pa'i sku ni sku'i gsang ba'o //
translated: The secret of their body, etc. is the three aims. The body accomplished by those is the secret of body.

original: sngags ni gsung gi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: sngags ni gsung gi gsang ba'o //
translated: The mantra is the secret of speech.

original: sngags kyi rnam pa la dmigs pa'i sems ni thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi rnam pa la dmigs pa'i sems ni thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
translated: The mind that observes the form of the mantra is the secret of mind.

original: de gsal bar byed pa'i skur bstan pa ni de'i chos so //
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pa'i skur bstan pa ni de'i chos so //
translated: The teaching of the body that illuminates that is its Dharma.

original: de'i de kho na nyid kyi yi ge ni de dag ston par byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i yi ge ste /
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid kyi yi ge ni de dag ston par byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i yi ge ste /
translated: The syllables of its reality are the syllables of the verses that teach those.

original: thos pa ni nges par bzung ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni nges par bzung ba'o //
translated: Hearing is apprehending them.

original: ngo mtshar du gyur pa ni mngon par rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar du gyur pa ni mngon par rtogs pa la'o //
translated: Astonishment is with respect to realization.

original: rmad du gyur pa ni byang chub rnam par bcad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa la'o //
analyzed: rmad du gyur pa ni byang chub rnam par bcad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa la'o //
translated: The marvelous is in the verse on the elimination of enlightenment.

original: ae ma'o sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sku'i gsang pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sku'i gsang pa'o //
translated: The Ah! of Ah! Buddha! is the secret of the body.

original: ae ma ho chos zhes bya ba ni gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba dbyer med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ae ma ho chos zhes bya ba ni gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba dbyer med pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The Ah! of Ah! Dharma! is the secret of speech and mind, which are taught to be inseparable.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir lam gyi chos yin pas na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir lam gyi chos yin pas na'o //
translated: Because here it is the Dharma of the path, and that is the secret of speech and mind.

original: de yang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
translated: And that is the secret of speech and mind.

original: chos bshad pa ni ngo mtshar che //
analyzed: chos bshad pa ni ngo mtshar che //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is marvelous.

original: zhes bya ba chos ni byang chub ste chos thams cad kyi phul du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba chos ni byang chub ste chos thams cad kyi phul du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Dharma is enlightenment, because it is the best of all Dharmas.

original: de @235b bshad pa ni byang chub kyis mis tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de @235b bshad pa ni byang chub kyis mis tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The teaching of that is in the verse on the enlightenment of beings.

original: de bas na go rims ji lta ba bzhin du ngag dang de nyid don dag don te /
analyzed: de bas na go rims ji lta ba bzhin du ngag dang de nyid don dag don te /
translated: Therefore, in order, it is the meaning of speech and reality.

original: sku'i gsang ba ni ming dang mtshan ma'i dri ma nub pa yin pa dang lam ni de kho na nyid kyi yul can yin pa dang tshigs su bcad pa ni yang dag par rtogs par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku'i gsang ba ni ming dang mtshan ma'i dri ma nub pa yin pa dang lam ni de kho na nyid kyi yul can yin pa dang tshigs su bcad pa ni yang dag par rtogs par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The secret of body is the disappearance of the stain of name and sign. The path is the subject of reality. The verse is the expression of perfect realization.

original: sku'i gsang ba la bstod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sku'i gsang ba la bstod pa gsungs pa /
translated: The praise of the secret of body is stated:

original: bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag med pa la dmigs pa'i lam la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag med pa la dmigs pa'i lam la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: In the absence of self, etc. The path that observes the absence of self is so called.

original: byung ba ni de las skyes pa ste rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mi dmigs pa'i lam gyis sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rdzogs pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: byung ba ni de las skyes pa ste rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mi dmigs pa'i lam gyis sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rdzogs pa ma yin pas /
translated: Arisen from that, i.e., born from that, is the path of nonapprehending with conceptual thought, which does not perfect the enlightenment of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub rdzogs mdzad pa ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub rdzogs mdzad pa ;
translated: The perfection of the enlightenment of the Buddha

original: / rnam par mi rtog dmigs su med //
analyzed: / rnam par mi rtog dmigs su med //
translated: is nonconceptual and nonapprehending.

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: This is stated.

original: sku'i gsang ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang mi dmigs pas rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku'i gsang ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang mi dmigs pas rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The secret of body is perfected by nonconceptuality and nonapprehension.

original: gsung gi gsang ba la bstod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsung gi gsang ba la bstod pa gsungs pa /
translated: The praise of the secret of speech is stated:

original: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di nyid ni kun du bzang po ste /
analyzed: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di nyid ni kun du bzang po ste /
translated: The line the one called Samantabhadra and so forth.🔽🔽

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa bon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa bon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The good in Samantabhadra is the seed syllable of all the Buddhas.

original: chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi don de nyid kyi don te 'di'i don yin pas na thams cad don no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi don de nyid kyi don te 'di'i don yin pas na thams cad don no //
translated: The all is the meaning of the reality of all things, and since it is the meaning of this, it is all meaning.

original: zla ba rdo rje'i sbyor bas sa bon bskyed pa ni byang chub sems kyi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba rdo rje'i sbyor bas sa bon bskyed pa ni byang chub sems kyi 'jug pa'o //
translated: The seed is the entry of the Thought of Enlightenment, which is the generation of the seed by the union of the moon and the vajra.

original: de las sgrib pa thams cad 'joms pa ni byang chub rtogs pa ste de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de las sgrib pa thams cad 'joms pa ni byang chub rtogs pa ste de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The destruction of all obscurations is the realization of enlightenment, and for that very reason it is said:

original: byang chub sems ni rab bskor ba //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni rab bskor ba //
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment is fully turned,

original: byang chub spyod pa rdo rje che //
