analyzed: byang chub spyod pa rdo rje che //
translated: the great vajra practice of enlightenment.

original: zhes so // thugs kyi gsang ba la bstod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // thugs kyi gsang ba la bstod pa gsungs pa /
translated: The praise of the secret of the mind is stated:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thugs ni de bzhin nyid rtogs pas gsal ba tsam ste dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thugs ni de bzhin nyid rtogs pas gsal ba tsam ste dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: The mind of the Tathagatas and so on. The mind is the mere illumination by the realization of suchness, and it is connected with of the Buddhas of the three times.

original: dag pa ni rang bzhin te dri ma rnams glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa ni rang bzhin te dri ma rnams glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Pure means natural, because the stains are adventitious.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thabs dang shes rab yang dag par sbyor ba'i sa bon dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thabs dang shes rab yang dag par sbyor ba'i sa bon dang bcas pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is the seed of the union of means and insight.

original: gzung ba rnams thim pas na sku 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba rnams thim pas na sku 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Since the objects are dissolved, it is the holder of the body.

original: 'dzin pa rnams thim pas na thugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa rnams thim pas na thugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Since the subjects are dissolved, it is the holder of the mind.

original: gsung thim pas na gsung 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gsung thim pas na gsung 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Since speech is dissolved, it is the holder of speech.

original: rdo rje can du gyur pas na rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can du gyur pas na rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Since it becomes vajra-like, it is the holder of the vajra.

original: de lta bu'i mngon par rtogs pa'i byang chub tshigs su bcad pas ston par mdzad pa na sangs rgyas byang chub rab ston pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mngon par rtogs pa'i byang chub tshigs su bcad pas ston par mdzad pa na sangs rgyas byang chub rab ston pa'o //
translated: When it teaches the enlightenment of such a realization in verses, it is the teaching of the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: de dag thams cad ni byang chub sems kyi gnas skabs yin pas de bas na tshigs su bcad pa bzhi char la yang byang chub sems kyi sgra sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni byang chub sems kyi gnas skabs yin pas de bas na tshigs su bcad pa bzhi char la yang byang chub sems kyi sgra sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Since all of these are the state of the Thought of Enlightenment, therefore the word Thought of Enlightenment is applied to all four verses.

original: ji ste gang yang theg pa @236a * //
analyzed: ji ste gang yang theg pa @236a * //
translated: If someone should ask, “What is the difference between the Thought of Enlightenment and the enlightenment of the buddhas?”

original: chen po dag las de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang mtshan ma med pa dang don dam pa dang chos kyi dbyings dang chos nyid la sogs pa'i sgra 'di dag gis brjod pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: chen po dag las de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang mtshan ma med pa dang don dam pa dang chos kyi dbyings dang chos nyid la sogs pa'i sgra 'di dag gis brjod pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the terms suchness, reality limit, signlessness, ultimate, reality realm, and reality itself, which are used for the great?

original: stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: They are emptiness.

original: de ni 'gyur ba med pas de bzhin nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de ni 'gyur ba med pas de bzhin nyid du brjod do //
translated: It is called suchness because it is unchanging.

original: zas su chu za'o zhes bya ba de bzhin du de bzhin gyi sgras nges par gzung ba ston pas rtag tu de bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas su chu za'o zhes bya ba de bzhin du de bzhin gyi sgras nges par gzung ba ston pas rtag tu de bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as one says that a person who eats water for food is a water eater, the term suchness is used to indicate ascertainment because it is always suchness.

original: yang dag pa ni de kho na yin te de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni de kho na yin te de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Reality is thatness, suchness.

original: mtha' ni mchog ste de las lhag par gyur pa'i de kho na gzhan med pas 'di la yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mtha' ni mchog ste de las lhag par gyur pa'i de kho na gzhan med pas 'di la yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes brjod do //
translated: The limit is the best, and since there is no other thatness that is superior to it, it is called the reality limit.

original: mi bden par snang ba 'khrul pa yin la de la gang snang ba de ni de'i mtshan ma yin te des yul du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bden par snang ba 'khrul pa yin la de la gang snang ba de ni de'i mtshan ma yin te des yul du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Delusion is the appearance of unreality, and the sign of that is the object of that delusion, because it is the object of that.

original: de las bzlog pa ni mtshan ma med pa ste 'khrul pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mtshan ma med pa ste 'khrul pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The opposite of that is signless, because it is not the object of error.

original: de ni mtshan ma med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That is called signless.

original: dam pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: dam pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The highest is supramundane wisdom.

original: 'di de'i yul yin pa'i phyir 'di la don dam pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di de'i yul yin pa'i phyir 'di la don dam pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Because this is its object, it is called the ultimate.

original: chos ni 'phags pa rnams kyi chos te /
analyzed: chos ni 'phags pa rnams kyi chos te /
translated: Dharma is the dharma of the noble ones.

original: phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is supreme.

original: de nyid la dmigs pas de rnams skye bas chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'di ni chos kyi dbyings su brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid la dmigs pas de rnams skye bas chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'di ni chos kyi dbyings su brjod do //
translated: Because it is the cause of dharmas, since they arise by observing that, it is called the realm of dharmas.

original: de ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos nyid ces kyang brjod do //
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos nyid ces kyang brjod do //
translated: Because it is the nature of all dharmas, it is also called dharmatā.

original: de ltar na ni gang du brtag pa'i phyir sems kyi skye ba ni gsal bar snang ba tsam yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni gang du brtag pa'i phyir sems kyi skye ba ni gsal bar snang ba tsam yin te /
translated: Thus, because it is investigated, the arising of mind is merely the appearance of clarity.

original: dper na rtsig pa zhig pas nam mkha' la sogs pa'i skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de gang zhig ce na der yang sems zhes bya ba'i sgra ni stong pa nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: dper na rtsig pa zhig pas nam mkha' la sogs pa'i skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de gang zhig ce na der yang sems zhes bya ba'i sgra ni stong pa nyid la bya ste /
translated: What is that? In that regard, the term “mind” refers to emptiness,

original: sems kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of mind.

original: ci ste stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la sogs pa mdor bsdus te rnam par gzhag pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la sogs pa mdor bsdus te rnam par gzhag pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “What is the definition of emptiness, etc., that is set forth in brief?”

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said:

original: stong nyid chos rnams thams cad kyi //
analyzed: stong nyid chos rnams thams cad kyi //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena

original: gnyis kyi stong pa gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi stong pa gang yin pa de'o //
translated: is the emptiness of duality.

original: gnyis pa med pa'i mtshan nyid pas //
analyzed: gnyis pa med pa'i mtshan nyid pas //
translated: Since it is the characteristic of non-duality,

original: de ni thams cad ro gcig nyid //
analyzed: de ni thams cad ro gcig nyid //
translated: it is the same taste in all.

original: stong pa nyid phyir dngos po 'ang min //
analyzed: stong pa nyid phyir dngos po 'ang min //
translated: Since it is empty, it is not a thing.

original: de rnams dngos phyir dngos med min //
analyzed: de rnams dngos phyir dngos med min //
translated: Since it is the basis of those, it is not a non-thing.

original: lus dngos yin phyir gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: lus dngos yin phyir gzhan ma yin //
translated: Since the body is a thing, it is not other.🔽Since it is not characterized by otherness,

original: mtshan nyid kyis ni gzhan ma min //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni gzhan ma min //
translated: it is not other.

original: sems kyi chos nyid rtag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid rtag pa'i phyir //
translated: Since the reality of mind is permanent,

original: nam mkha'i byung ba bzhin de brjod //
analyzed: nam mkha'i byung ba bzhin de brjod //
translated: it is said to be like space.

original: de yi brjod byas bsgoms pa las //
analyzed: de yi brjod byas bsgoms pa las //
translated: The conventional is the object of meditation

original: nye bar brjod pa kun rdzob yin //
analyzed: nye bar brjod pa kun rdzob yin //
translated: on the basis of the expression of that.

original: spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyis //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyis //
translated: The wisdom that is free from conceptual elaborations

original: dri ma rtsa nas bton gyur pas //
analyzed: dri ma rtsa nas bton gyur pas //
translated: removes the defilements from the root.

original: glo @236b bur dri ma zad pa na //
analyzed: glo @236b bur dri ma zad pa na //
translated: When the adventitious defilements are exhausted,

original: rang bzhin dag ces dag pa yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag ces dag pa yin //
translated: the natural purity is the purity.

original: gal te phyi rol don med na //
analyzed: gal te phyi rol don med na //
translated: If external objects do not exist,

original: sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag ji ltar snang bar 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag ji ltar snang bar 'gyur zhe na //
translated: how can these blue things and so on appear?

original: bag chags kyi stobs las skyes pa'i mi bden pa'i don gyi don du snang ste rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bag chags kyi stobs las skyes pa'i mi bden pa'i don gyi don du snang ste rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: They appear as objects that are not true on the strength of habitual tendencies, like the consciousness in a dream.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The Bhagavān also said:

original: ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags pa'i //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags pa'i //
translated: The object that is imagined by the childish

original: don phyir de ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: don phyir de ni yod ma yin //
translated: does not exist externally.

original: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
translated: The mind disturbed by habitual tendencies

original: don du snang bar 'gyur ba yin //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: don du snang bar 'gyur ba yin // zhes gsungs te /
translated: appears as an object.

original: bag chags kyis dkrugs pa ni nyams par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyis dkrugs pa ni nyams par byas pa'o //
translated: “Disturbed by habitual tendencies” means “corrupted.”

original: ji ste 'di dag shes pa nyid yin gyi phyi rol gyi don ma yin par gal shes te /
analyzed: ji ste 'di dag shes pa nyid yin gyi phyi rol gyi don ma yin par gal shes te /
translated: If these are consciousness itself and not external objects, how can they be known to be that?

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa nyid don de dang der snang ba bzhin du sad pa nyid na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa nyid don de dang der snang ba bzhin du sad pa nyid na yang ma yin te /
translated: Just as the consciousness of a dream appears as this or that object, so it is in the waking state.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i don nyid snang ba yin la dpe tsam gyi don grub pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i don nyid snang ba yin la dpe tsam gyi don grub pa med do zhe na /
translated: But the object itself, such as blue, appears, and the meaning of the mere example is not established.

original: 'dir brjod par bya ste 'di la gsal ba dang snang ba myong ba dang / bems po ma yin pa dang lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa rnams ni rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ste 'di la gsal ba dang snang ba myong ba dang / bems po ma yin pa dang lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa rnams ni rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: Here we say: In this regard, the characteristics of understanding are clarity, appearance, experience, non-matter, and non-obscurity.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyang nyams su myong ba ni myong ba de ma gtogs pa med de /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyang nyams su myong ba ni myong ba de ma gtogs pa med de /
translated: And the experience of blue, etc. is nothing other than that experience.

original: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa yang rtog pa'i ngo bor grub la de nyid kyi phyir phyi rol gyi ngo bo ma yin par grub ste /
analyzed: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa yang rtog pa'i ngo bor grub la de nyid kyi phyir phyi rol gyi ngo bo ma yin par grub ste /
translated: Therefore, blue, etc. are also established as the nature of thought. For that very reason, they are established as not being external entities,

original: bems po dang snang ba dag la 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bems po dang snang ba dag la 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because matter and appearance are contradictory.

original: 'dir dpyod pa can dag na re don gyi chos gsal ba can yin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis myong bas bden na de yang shes pas byas pa yin gyi shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dpyod pa can dag na re don gyi chos gsal ba can yin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis myong bas bden na de yang shes pas byas pa yin gyi shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the Analysts say: “The fact that the object’s nature is clear is true because it is experienced by itself, but that is done by consciousness, not by the characteristics of consciousness.

original: de bas na de ni don gyi chos yin la de gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu shes pa ni skyes bu'i chos yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: de bas na de ni don gyi chos yin la de gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu shes pa ni skyes bu'i chos yin no zhes zer na /
translated: Therefore, that is the object’s nature, and the cause that makes it clear is the person’s nature.”

original: de yang mi rigs te don gyi rang bzhin ni skyes bu rnams kyi thun mong ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te don gyi rang bzhin ni skyes bu rnams kyi thun mong ma yin te /
translated: That is also illogical because the nature of the object is not common to all persons.

original: 'di ltar snam bu dmar po tshos mkhan nyid la dmar por snang gi gzhan dag la dkar por snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar snam bu dmar po tshos mkhan nyid la dmar por snang gi gzhan dag la dkar por snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, a red cloth appears red to the dyer, but it appears white to others.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: skyes bu thams cad kyi dmar po yin pas 'di ltar gang zhig gis don gyi chos gsal bar byas pa de thams cad kyis mthong bar 'gyur te thams cad kyi snang ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad kyi dmar po yin pas 'di ltar gang zhig gis don gyi chos gsal bar byas pa de thams cad kyis mthong bar 'gyur te thams cad kyi snang ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is red to all persons, whatever makes the object’s nature clear is seen by all because it is the nature of the appearance of all.

original: de bas na thams cad kyis mthong ba med pa ma gtogs pa 'ba' zhig gis don 'ga' zhig mthong ba de thams cad du mthong bar 'gyur ro //🔽gzhan dag na re bems po ma yin pa dang gsal ba ni rig pa'i mtshan @237a * //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad kyis mthong ba med pa ma gtogs pa 'ba' zhig gis don 'ga' zhig mthong ba de thams cad du mthong bar 'gyur ro // gzhan dag na re bems po ma yin pa dang gsal ba ni rig pa'i mtshan @237a * //
translated: Therefore, except for the non-perception of all, some object would be perceived by all.

original: nyid de de nyid ni rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: nyid de de nyid ni rtogs pa yin la /
translated: Others say: Non-matter and manifestation have the characteristic of awareness. That itself is realization.

original: de yang skyes bu'i chos yin gyi chos ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang skyes bu'i chos yin gyi chos ma yin te /
translated: And that is a quality of a person, not a quality of a thing.

original: skyes bu'i shes pa des don gyi phyi rol du rig cing gzung bas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i shes pa des don gyi phyi rol du rig cing gzung bas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: That awareness of a person is aware of and apprehends an external object, so it is realization.

original: de bas na don gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na don gsal ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, an object is manifestation.

original: gsal ba ni shes pas gsal bar byas pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba ni shes pas gsal bar byas pa'o zhe na /
translated: Manifestation is made manifest by consciousness.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te 'di ltar gsal ba'i mtshan nyid sngar bshad pa bzhin nyams su myong ba yin la /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te 'di ltar gsal ba'i mtshan nyid sngar bshad pa bzhin nyams su myong ba yin la /
translated: That is also illogical, because in that case, as previously explained, the characteristic of manifestation would be experienced.

original: de yang sngon po la sogs pa'i chos ma yin /
analyzed: de yang sngon po la sogs pa'i chos ma yin /
translated: And that is not a quality of blue and so on.

original: de dang gsal ba ma yin pas gzhan gyis kyang nus pa ma yin te rang gis gsal ba ma yin pa ni gzhan gyis gsal bar bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang gsal ba ma yin pas gzhan gyis kyang nus pa ma yin te rang gis gsal ba ma yin pa ni gzhan gyis gsal bar bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible for something that is not manifest to be made manifest by another, because it is contradictory for something that is not manifest by itself to be made manifest by another.

original: gsal bar byas pas gsal bar gyur pa dang / gsal ba ma yin pa yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar byas pas gsal bar gyur pa dang / gsal ba ma yin pa yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For if it were made manifest, it would be manifest, and it would also be nonmanifest.

original: ji ste bdag nyid kyis mi gsal ba yang gsal ba pos gsal bar byas pa la skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: ji ste bdag nyid kyis mi gsal ba yang gsal ba pos gsal bar byas pa la skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: But if you say that there is no error in something that is not manifest by itself being made manifest by something that is manifest,

original: de lta na yang gsal bar gyur pa don gyi chos nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gsal bar gyur pa don gyi chos nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then even if it is manifest, it would be the intrinsic reality of an object.

original: des na dpyod pa pa'i lugs khas blangs pa min la de'i skyon yang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: des na dpyod pa pa'i lugs khas blangs pa min la de'i skyon yang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Therefore, we do not accept the system of the logicians, and the error in that has already been explained.

original: de ltar na sngon po la sogs pa ni snang ba'i bdag nyid la snang ba yin pas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam mo zhes bya ba 'dis gnas pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar na sngon po la sogs pa ni snang ba'i bdag nyid la snang ba yin pas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam mo zhes bya ba 'dis gnas pa yin no /
translated: Thus, blue and so on are manifest in the nature of appearance, and therefore this is the position of consciousness only, which is empty of object and subject.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: Here there is a verse:

original: snang ba min pa snang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: snang ba min pa snang mi 'gyur //
translated: That which is not manifest is not made manifest.

original: gzhan gyis kyang ni snang mi nus ;
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang ni snang mi nus ;
translated: And it is not perceived by others.

original: sngon po la sogs snang ba ste //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs snang ba ste //
translated: It is the appearance of blue, etc.

original: de phyir gnyis med shes pa yin //
analyzed: de phyir gnyis med shes pa yin //
translated: Therefore, it is non-dual cognition.

original: gzhan yang snam bu dang re lde dang rtsig pa la sogs pa snang ba 'di dag gcig gam du ma zhig ji ste gcig yin na thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus kyi cha'i bye brag dmigs par mi 'gyur te bye brag med pa la 'gal ba'i phyir
analyzed: gzhan yang snam bu dang re lde dang rtsig pa la sogs pa snang ba 'di dag gcig gam du ma zhig ji ste gcig yin na thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus kyi cha'i bye brag dmigs par mi 'gyur te bye brag med pa la 'gal ba'i phyir
translated: Moreover, are these appearances of cloth, fence, wall, etc. one or many? If they are one, the distinctions of the parts of the beginning, end, and middle would not be perceived, because it is contradictory to be without distinctions.

original: ro // de ltar cha shas rnams kyang so sor gcig tu mi rung bas cha shas med pa'i rdul phra rab 'ba' zhig gnas grang /
analyzed: ro // de ltar cha shas rnams kyang so sor gcig tu mi rung bas cha shas med pa'i rdul phra rab 'ba' zhig gnas grang /
translated: Thus, since the parts are also individually not suitable as one, only the partless subtle atom remains.

original: de yang yongs su bskor ba'i rdul rnams kyis phyogs gcig nas sbyor du mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang yongs su bskor ba'i rdul rnams kyis phyogs gcig nas sbyor du mi rung ste /
translated: Moreover, it is not suitable for the surrounding atoms to join from one side,

original: cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are partless.

original: thams cad kyis kyang mi rung ste rdul phra mo rnams gcig la gcig zhugs pas ri la sogs pa yang rdul phra mo'i tshad tsam du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyis kyang mi rung ste rdul phra mo rnams gcig la gcig zhugs pas ri la sogs pa yang rdul phra mo'i tshad tsam du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also not suitable for all of them, because if the subtle atoms enter each other, it would follow that even a mountain, etc. would be the size of a subtle atom.

original: des na snam bu la sogs pa 'di dag gcig kyang ma yin la du ma yang ma yin te de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag rdul phra mor ba shig na /
analyzed: des na snam bu la sogs pa 'di dag gcig kyang ma yin la du ma yang ma yin te de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag rdul phra mor ba shig na /
translated: Therefore, these such as cloth are neither one nor many. Therefore, when these such as blue are destroyed into subtle atoms,

original: phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin te @237b gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin te @237b gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: external objects do not exist because they are devoid of being one or many.

original: de yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: de yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyi zhal snga nas /
translated: Also, the venerable Vasubandhu says:

original: drug gis cig car sbyar bas na //
analyzed: drug gis cig car sbyar bas na //
translated: When six are simultaneously joined,

original: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
analyzed: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
translated: the subtle atom has six parts.

original: drug po dag ni go gcig na //🔽gong bu rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //
analyzed: drug po dag ni go gcig na // gong bu rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //
translated: When the six are in one place,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: the aggregate is merely the size of an atom.

original: ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol du khas blangs pa la skyon brjod pa 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi sngon po la sogs pa la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol du khas blangs pa la skyon brjod pa 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi sngon po la sogs pa la yang mtshungs te /
translated: The faults stated in the assertion that external objects such as blue exist are similar in the case of blue and so on that are the nature of consciousness,

original: thal bar gyur pa la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal bar gyur pa la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the absurd consequence is the same.

original: don dang rnam par shes pa bye brag tsam gyis ni cir yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dang rnam par shes pa bye brag tsam gyis ni cir yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But the mere difference between objects and consciousness does not make any sense.

original: ji ste don gyi rdul phra rab ni phyogs drug nas bskor ba yin la rnam par shes pa'i rdul phra mo ni phyogs bzhi pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste don gyi rdul phra rab ni phyogs drug nas bskor ba yin la rnam par shes pa'i rdul phra mo ni phyogs bzhi pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the minute particles of the object are surrounded in six directions, and the minute particles of consciousness are in four directions,

original: cha shas dang bcas par mtshungs pa'i phyir des kyang cir yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha shas dang bcas par mtshungs pa'i phyir des kyang cir yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then they are still equal in having parts, and that does not help your case.

original: gcig dang du ma las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po phung po gsum pa gzhan dag kyang med pas sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag ni phyi rol gyi dngos po dang nang gi dngos por ma grub pa brdzun pa nyid do //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po phung po gsum pa gzhan dag kyang med pas sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag ni phyi rol gyi dngos po dang nang gi dngos por ma grub pa brdzun pa nyid do //
translated: Since things cannot be other than one or many, these blue and so on are not established as external things or internal things, and so they are false.

original: gzhan yang 'di ni sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag cig car nyams su myong ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ni sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag cig car nyams su myong ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, these blue and so on are experienced simultaneously.

original: nyams su myong ba de yang rig pa dang gsal ba dang snang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba de yang rig pa dang gsal ba dang snang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: And that experience is called awareness, clarity, and appearance.

original: gsal ba de ni myong ba dang bdag nyid gcig pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gsal ba de ni myong ba dang bdag nyid gcig pa nyid yin la /
translated: That clarity is of the same nature as the experience.

original: gsal ba dang gsal ba ma yin par 'gal ba'i phyir dang gsal ba ni gsal ba kho na'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba dang gsal ba ma yin par 'gal ba'i phyir dang gsal ba ni gsal ba kho na'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because clarity and nonclarity are mutually exclusive, and because clarity is the characteristic of clarity alone.

original: myong ba'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: myong ba'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: It is the nature of experience.

original: de ltar gsal ba tsam yin yang bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i dbang gis med du zin kyang gang zhig gis bdag nyid du snang ste /
analyzed: de ltar gsal ba tsam yin yang bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i dbang gis med du zin kyang gang zhig gis bdag nyid du snang ste /
translated: Even though it is merely clarity in this way, due to the power of being disturbed by latent impressions, it appears as a self, even though it does not exist.

original: bdag nyid de dag ni go rims bzhin du gzhan gyis ma bzhag pa dang / bzhag pa yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa yang yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid de dag ni go rims bzhin du gzhan gyis ma bzhag pa dang / bzhag pa yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa yang yin te /
translated: Those selves are, respectively, not posited by another, and they are posited as real and unreal.

original: gsal ba ni gzhan gyis bzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir brdzun par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gsal ba ni gzhan gyis bzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir brdzun par mi rung ngo //
translated: Because clarity is not posited by another, it is not suitable to be false.

original: gsal ba de yang gsal ba gzhan gyis bzhag pas gsal ba ma yin te thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba de yang gsal ba gzhan gyis bzhag pas gsal ba ma yin te thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That clarity is not clarity because it is posited by another clarity, because it would follow that there would be an infinite regress.

original: de bas na gsal ba 'di ni rang gi bdag nyid kyi mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin te gzhan gyis bzhag pa ni nam mkha' la sgra'i tshogs snang ba bzhin 'khrul pas yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gsal ba 'di ni rang gi bdag nyid kyi mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin te gzhan gyis bzhag pa ni nam mkha' la sgra'i tshogs snang ba bzhin 'khrul pas yin no //
translated: Therefore, this manifestation is a valid cognition of direct perception of its own nature, because the other is established by error, like the appearance of a group of sounds in the sky.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsal ba la gnod par byed pa med pa dang de las lhag pa'i tshad ma 'jig rten na med pa'i phyir ro //🔽sngon po @238a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsal ba la gnod par byed pa med pa dang de las lhag pa'i tshad ma 'jig rten na med pa'i phyir ro // sngon po @238a * //
translated: For that very reason, there is no refutation of manifestation, and there is no higher valid cognition in the world than that.🔽Blue and so on

original: la sogs pa la ni gnod pa yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: la sogs pa la ni gnod pa yod pa kho na ste /
translated: are indeed refuted.

original: 'di ltar sngon po dang ser po dang dkar po dang ljang gu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid phan tshun spangs te snang bas na gcig ma yin la de'i bdag nyid snang ba gcig dang 'gal ba'i phyir du ma nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po dang ser po dang dkar po dang ljang gu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid phan tshun spangs te snang bas na gcig ma yin la de'i bdag nyid snang ba gcig dang 'gal ba'i phyir du ma nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because the characteristics of blue, yellow, white, green, and so on appear mutually exclusive, they are not one, and because they appear to be of the nature of one, they are also not many.

original: ji ste de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de dang 'dra bar gsal ba yang tha dad do zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de dang 'dra bar gsal ba yang tha dad do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that manifestation is also different because it is of their nature,🔽like them,

original: de dag bdag nyid so sor myong ba'i phyir lhan cig myong ba med pas thams cad la gcig tu myong ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bdag nyid so sor myong ba'i phyir lhan cig myong ba med pas thams cad la gcig tu myong ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are experienced individually, they are not experienced together. Therefore, it follows that they are not experienced as one.

original: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa ni gcig dang du ma dang bral bas brdzun pa yin te nam mkha'i ngos la snang ba'i skra'i tshogs bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa ni gcig dang du ma dang bral bas brdzun pa yin te nam mkha'i ngos la snang ba'i skra'i tshogs bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, blue and so on are false because they are free from being one or many, like a mass of hair seen in the sky.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang don 'di //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang don 'di //
translated: The Blessed One also taught this meaning:

original: ji ltar me long la ni gzugs //
analyzed: ji ltar me long la ni gzugs //
translated: Just as a reflection in a mirror

original: gcig dang gzhan pa rnams spangs pa //
analyzed: gcig dang gzhan pa rnams spangs pa //
translated: is free from being the same or different,

original: snang yang de na yod ma yin //🔽de bzhin dngos rnams ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: snang yang de na yod ma yin // de bzhin dngos rnams ngo bo nyid //
translated: it appears but does not exist there.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, entities are empty of inherent nature.

original: 'di ltar gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni gcig la ltos pa ste du ma'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni gcig la ltos pa ste du ma'o //
translated: Here, different means many, in dependence on one.

original: dngos rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi bdag nyid kyi chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dngos rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi bdag nyid kyi chos thams cad do //
translated: Entities refers to all phenomena that have the nature of mere representations.

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid de sngon po'i lam la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid de sngon po'i lam la sogs pa'o //
translated: Inherent nature refers to the characteristic of an entity, such as the blueness of blue.

original: gzhan yang sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba las tha dad dam 'on te tha dad pa ma yin ji ste tha dad pa yin na ni de mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba las tha dad dam 'on te tha dad pa ma yin ji ste tha dad pa yin na ni de mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, is the manifest such as blue different from the manifestation or is it not different? If it is different, it would not appear.

original: gal te tha dad pa ma yin na ni ;
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa ma yin na ni ;
translated: If it is not different,

original: de rnams gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pas gcig tu gyur pa'am de yang de rnams dang tha mi dad pas du mar gyur pa des na lhan cig myong ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pas gcig tu gyur pa'am de yang de rnams dang tha mi dad pas du mar gyur pa des na lhan cig myong ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then since it is the nature of the manifest, it would be one. Or, since it is not different from them, it would be many. Therefore, it would not be experienced simultaneously.

original: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba las tha dad pa dang / cig shos kyi rang bzhin dang bral bas me long gi nang du byung ba'i gzugs brnyan bzhin du brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir yang /
analyzed: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba las tha dad pa dang / cig shos kyi rang bzhin dang bral bas me long gi nang du byung ba'i gzugs brnyan bzhin du brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir yang /
translated: Therefore, since the manifest such as blue is different from the manifestation and is devoid of the nature of the other, it is false, like a reflection appearing in a mirror.🔽Thus it is said:

original: ji ltar me long la ni gzugs //
analyzed: ji ltar me long la ni gzugs //
translated: Like a reflection in a mirror,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: etc.

original: phyogs 'di la ni gcig dang gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la ni gcig dang gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: In this context, “the same or different” means “different or not different.”

original: ji ste sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag lhan cig myong ba'i phyir gcig yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag lhan cig myong ba'i phyir gcig yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that they are one because they are experienced simultaneously,

original: ma yin te tha dad par nyams su myong ba'i phyir dang tha mi dad par nyams su myong bar mi nus pas so //
analyzed: ma yin te tha dad par nyams su myong ba'i phyir dang tha mi dad par nyams su myong bar mi nus pas so //
translated: no, because they are experienced as different, and it is impossible to experience them as not different.

original: ji ste yang sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag lhan cig nyams su myong bas ji ltar nyams su myong ba de ltar gcig yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste yang sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag lhan cig nyams su myong bas ji ltar nyams su myong ba de ltar gcig yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that they are one as they are experienced, because they are experienced simultaneously,

original: tha dad pa nyid tha dad pa ma yin no zhes legs par smras par 'gyur ro //🔽ji ste @238b blo'i rnam pa yang sngon po la sogs pa ni rang nyid la 'khrul pa mi rigs pas brdzun pa ma yin la /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid tha dad pa ma yin no zhes legs par smras par 'gyur ro // ji ste @238b blo'i rnam pa yang sngon po la sogs pa ni rang nyid la 'khrul pa mi rigs pas brdzun pa ma yin la /
translated: then you have stated well that difference is not difference.🔽But if you say that the aspects of consciousness are not false, because it is not reasonable that they themselves are mistaken with respect to blue and so on,

original: rang gi snang ba phyi rol gyi don ma yin pa la sngon du mngon par zhen pas bzhag pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni brdzun pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi snang ba phyi rol gyi don ma yin pa la sngon du mngon par zhen pas bzhag pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni brdzun pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and that blue and so on are false, because they are posited through prior adherence to the appearance of what is not an external object,🔽then you have stated well that difference is not difference.

original: 'o na ni rang gi snang ba la mngon par zhen pa yin pas de rnam pa thams cad du shes pa nyid du zhen par 'gyur gyi don du ni ma yin te de don ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /🔽'khrul pa de nyid dpyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni rang gi snang ba la mngon par zhen pa yin pas de rnam pa thams cad du shes pa nyid du zhen par 'gyur gyi don du ni ma yin te de don ma yin pa'i phyir ro // de nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pa yin no zhe na / 'khrul pa de nyid dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: But if it is the appearance of consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, then it is consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, not external objects.🔽But if it is the appearance of consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, then it is consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, not external objects.🔽But if it is the appearance of consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, then it is consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, not external objects.🔽But if it is the appearance of consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, then it is consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, not external objects.🔽But if it is the appearance of consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, then it is consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, not external objects.🔽But if it is the appearance of consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, then it is consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, not external objects.🔽But if it is the appearance of consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, then it is consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, not external objects.

original: ji ste don la mngon par zhen pa yin na ni de'i don rnam pa thams cad du yod par 'gyur bas don med pa bzhin du zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste don la mngon par zhen pa yin na ni de'i don rnam pa thams cad du yod par 'gyur bas don med pa bzhin du zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is the appearance of consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, then it is consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, not external objects.

original: de bas na don la yang zhen pa ma yin la shes pa la yang ma yin no //🔽'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na don la yang zhen pa ma yin la shes pa la yang ma yin no // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But if it is the appearance of consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, then it is consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, not external objects.🔽But if it is the appearance of consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, then it is consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, not external objects.🔽But if it is the appearance of consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, then it is consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, not external objects.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i snang ba ldog pa'i lus gtso bor gyur pa tsam ni brdzun pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i snang ba ldog pa'i lus gtso bor gyur pa tsam ni brdzun pa yin no //
translated: But if it is the appearance of consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, then it is consciousness itself that is conceived of as external objects, not external objects.🔽But if it is the appearance of consciousness

original: de yang nyams su myong ba'i phyir dang blo med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang so so'i bdag nyid du myong ba'i phyir blo'i bdag nyid yin la don mngon par zhen pas don du gyur pa yin gyi don yod pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang nyams su myong ba'i phyir dang blo med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang so so'i bdag nyid du myong ba'i phyir blo'i bdag nyid yin la don mngon par zhen pas don du gyur pa yin gyi don yod pas ni ma yin te /
translated: Because it is experienced, because it does not occur without mind, and because it is experienced as individual, it is of the nature of mind. It is an object because it is the apprehension of an object, not because it is an existent object.

original: don med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it occurs even when there is no object.

original: de las kha cig ni don rnam par 'jog pa yin te don dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las kha cig ni don rnam par 'jog pa yin te don dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Some of it is the positing of an object, because it is related to an object.

original: de bas na gang yang sgra rnams ni dngos su dngos po'i don can du mi rigs te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na gang yang sgra rnams ni dngos su dngos po'i don can du mi rigs te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that words directly have the meaning of an entity, because that is contradictory.

original: brdzun pa'i don can de ni ji ltar grags pa bzhin rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brdzun pa'i don can de ni ji ltar grags pa bzhin rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: They have the meaning of a falsity, and that is posited according to what is known, not according to reality.

original: de yang gsungs pa /🔽de la ngo bo phyi rol dang // gcig lta gzhan las log lta bur //
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa / de la ngo bo phyi rol dang // gcig lta gzhan las log lta bur //
translated: That is also stated:🔽The appearance of an external entity,🔽like one thing seen differently by others,

original: snang ba gang yin brtag pa yi //
analyzed: snang ba gang yin brtag pa yi //
translated: is an imputation,

original: yan lag med phyir de nyid min //
analyzed: yan lag med phyir de nyid min //
translated: because it lacks the parts of reality.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: Again it is said:

original: sgra don 'di ni yod min kyang //
analyzed: sgra don 'di ni yod min kyang //
translated: This meaning of the word does not exist,

original: ji ltar grags pa bzhin du brjod //
analyzed: ji ltar grags pa bzhin du brjod //
translated: but is expressed just as it is known.

original: yang ci'i phyir brdzun par snang zhe na //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir brdzun par snang zhe na //
translated: Again, why does it appear as false?

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of its identity.

original: 'o na ji ltar bden pa dang brdzun pa 'gal bar gyur pa dag / de'i bdag nyid du rung /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bden pa dang brdzun pa 'gal bar gyur pa dag / de'i bdag nyid du rung /
translated: But how can truth and falsity, which are mutually exclusive, be identical?

original: gsal ba las tha mi dad pa'i phyir rnam par brdzun pa yang dngos por gyur pa 'am snang ba brdzun pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir gsal ba yang brdzun du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba las tha mi dad pa'i phyir rnam par brdzun pa yang dngos por gyur pa 'am snang ba brdzun pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir gsal ba yang brdzun du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Because of non-difference from the manifestation, the false aspect becomes a real entity; or because of non-difference from the false appearance, the manifestation becomes false.

original: gang yang ji ltar bden pa dang // brdzun pa 'gal bar gyur pa dag / de'i bdag nyid du rung ba zhes bya ba yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang yang ji ltar bden pa dang // brdzun pa 'gal bar gyur pa dag / de'i bdag nyid du rung ba zhes bya ba yang mi rigs te /
translated: And it is not reasonable to say, “How can truth and falsity, which are mutually exclusive, be identical?”

original: bdag nyid kyi dngos por gyur na 'gal bar 'gyur gyi brdzun pa la ni ma @239a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dngos por gyur na 'gal bar 'gyur gyi brdzun pa la ni ma @239a * //
translated: If it were an entity by its own nature, it would be mutually exclusive, but not in falsity.

original: yin no // de bas na brdzun pa'i dbang gis snang ba yang brdzun yin la /
analyzed: yin no // de bas na brdzun pa'i dbang gis snang ba yang brdzun yin la /
translated: Therefore, the appearance is false by virtue of falsity.

original: brdzun pa des de'i bdag nyid kyang yin pa la 'gal ba ci yod brdzun pa yang ji ltar grags pa bzhin du rnam par mi gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brdzun pa des de'i bdag nyid kyang yin pa la 'gal ba ci yod brdzun pa yang ji ltar grags pa bzhin du rnam par mi gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: What is the contradiction in saying that it is also the nature of the false? And the false is not posited in a way that is not in accordance with what is commonly recognized.

original: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste gzhan du 'khrul pa rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste gzhan du 'khrul pa rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This must be accepted without doubt, otherwise error would be endless.

original: de nas nges pa dang 'jug pa dang phan tshun rtsod pa dang bcings pa dang grol ba la sogs pa med pas thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas nges pa dang 'jug pa dang phan tshun rtsod pa dang bcings pa dang grol ba la sogs pa med pas thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then there would be no certainty, no engagement, no mutual dispute, no bondage, no liberation, and so on.

original: de bas na gang yang gsal ba las tha mi dad pa'i phyir snang ba brdzun yang dngos por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di la /
analyzed: de bas na gang yang gsal ba las tha mi dad pa'i phyir snang ba brdzun yang dngos por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di la /
translated: Therefore, the argument that “the appearance, although false, would be a thing because it is not different from the manifestation”

original: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin du tha mi dad do zhe na /🔽gtan tshigs ma grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin du tha mi dad do zhe na / gtan tshigs ma grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: is not established if it is not different from the nature of a thing.

original: 'on te tha dad pa tsam gtan tshigs yin na ni ma nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa tsam gtan tshigs yin na ni ma nges par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is merely different, the reason is not established.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid la sogs pa la de med par gtan tshigs yod pas so //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid la sogs pa la de med par gtan tshigs yod pas so //
translated: Because the reason exists for the non-existence of that in the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, etc.

original: de nyid kyis gsal ba yang rnam par brdzun pa de la tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis gsal ba yang rnam par brdzun pa de la tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang bshad zin to //
translated: And just by that, the manifestation is also false in that it is not different from that, etc.

original: yang dbu ma pas smras pa /
analyzed: yang dbu ma pas smras pa /
translated: Again, the Madhyamika says:

original: kho bo'i ltar na thams cad brdzun yin pa'i phyir dngos po cung zad kyang yin pas gtan tshigs 'di bsgrub bya med par yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: kho bo'i ltar na thams cad brdzun yin pa'i phyir dngos po cung zad kyang yin pas gtan tshigs 'di bsgrub bya med par yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: For us, since everything is false, there is not even the slightest existent thing. Therefore, this reason does not exist without the probandum.

original: de dag gi ltar na yang bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pas ldog pa the tshom za ba'i ma nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na yang bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pas ldog pa the tshom za ba'i ma nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: But for them, since there is no valid cognition that contradicts the opposite, the reversal is doubtful and thus the reason is inconclusive.

original: gzhan yang thams cad brdzun pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang thams cad brdzun pa nyid yin na /
translated: Moreover, if everything is false,

original: de'i tshe gag gis kyang ci la yang sgro btags pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gag gis kyang ci la yang sgro btags pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time, nothing would be superimposed by anything,

original: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no distinction.

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa rgyun chad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa rgyun chad par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, error would be interrupted.

original: sgro ma btags pa la gnod pa byed pa med pas gang gis kyang ci yang brdzun par ma grub po //
analyzed: sgro ma btags pa la gnod pa byed pa med pas gang gis kyang ci yang brdzun par ma grub po //
translated: Since there is no harm in not superimposing, nothing is established as false by anything.

original: gzhan yang gal te thams cad stong pa nyid kyang brdzun pa yin na don dam par bya ba gang la yod na ci ste de ni tshad mas grub pas brdzun pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te thams cad stong pa nyid kyang brdzun pa yin na don dam par bya ba gang la yod na ci ste de ni tshad mas grub pas brdzun pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Moreover, if emptiness itself is false, then since it is established by valid cognition, how could it be false?

original: 'o na mi gsal ba yang brdzun du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na mi gsal ba yang brdzun du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Well then, the unclear would not be false either,

original: tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i gsal ba ni thams cad kyi nyams su ma myong bas grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i gsal ba ni thams cad kyi nyams su ma myong bas grub ste /
translated: Thus, the clarity of blue and so on is established by the experience of all,

original: de yang rig pa la 'khrul pa mi dmigs pas mngon sum nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang rig pa la 'khrul pa mi dmigs pas mngon sum nyid yin no //
translated: and that is direct perception itself, since error is not observed in awareness.

original: sngon po la sogs pa myong ba ni 'khrul pa yin la de dag de las ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur te ji ltar bstan pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa myong ba ni 'khrul pa yin la de dag de las ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur te ji ltar bstan pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The experience of blue and so on is error, and they are different in nature from that, because the harm explained earlier exists.

original: sngon po dang gsal bdag ni shin tu dbyer med de bye brag @239b mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po dang gsal bdag ni shin tu dbyer med de bye brag @239b mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Blue and the nature of manifestation are not at all different, because no difference is perceived.

original: de'i tshe tha dad pa med pa tsam du sgrub na ni 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe tha dad pa med pa tsam du sgrub na ni 'grub pa yin no //
translated: If you are proving mere non-difference, then you are successful.

original: 'on te dngos po nyid kyi tha dad pa med pa sgrub na ni ma nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te dngos po nyid kyi tha dad pa med pa sgrub na ni ma nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you are proving that the entities themselves are non-different, then it is inconclusive.

original: de bas na gsal ba'i bdag nyid yang dag pa yang gzhan yin la sngon po la sogs pa brdzun pa yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gsal ba'i bdag nyid yang dag pa yang gzhan yin la sngon po la sogs pa brdzun pa yang gzhan yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of manifestation is real, and blue, etc., are false.

original: gzhan yang thams cad brdzun pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang thams cad brdzun pa nyid yin na /
translated: Moreover, if everything is false,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes nam yang skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes nam yang skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the supramundane non-conceptual intuition would never arise,

original: rtag tu brdzun pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir dang bden pa las so sor rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu brdzun pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir dang bden pa las so sor rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would always experience the false and because it would be associated with the discernment of the real.

original: kha cig na re sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes so zhes zer na de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: kha cig na re sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes so zhes zer na de yang mi bden te /
translated: Some say that the cessation of mind and mental factors is supramundane correct pristine wisdom. That is also not correct.

original: 'di ltar shes rab la sogs pa 'gog pa na shes pa nyid kyang 'gags na yang dag pa'i ye shes lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab la sogs pa 'gog pa na shes pa nyid kyang 'gags na yang dag pa'i ye shes lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Thus, when wisdom and so on cease, consciousness itself also ceases, so what need is there to mention correct pristine wisdom?

original: kho bo'i ltar na brdzun par snang ba 'gags nas gnyis su med par gsal bar myong ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes skye ba'i phyir nyes pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: kho bo'i ltar na brdzun par snang ba 'gags nas gnyis su med par gsal bar myong ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes skye ba'i phyir nyes pa ci yang med do //
translated: According to me, there is no fault because supramundane pristine wisdom arises, having ceased the appearance of falsity and having experienced nonduality.

original: de'i phyir thams cad brdzun par smra ba ni rtsod pa la mkhas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad brdzun par smra ba ni rtsod pa la mkhas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who advocate that everything is false are not skilled in debate.

original: 'dir brdzun pa ni ngo bo med pa'i phyir btags pa'i yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir brdzun pa ni ngo bo med pa'i phyir btags pa'i yod pa'o //
translated: Here, falsity is imputed existence because it lacks entityness.

original: gsal ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir rdzas su yod pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir rdzas su yod pa'o //
translated: Clarity is substantial existence because it is dependently arisen.

original: de gnyis kyis stong pa ni don dam par yod pa ste yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis stong pa ni don dam par yod pa ste yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness of those two is ultimate existence, because it is the object of correct pristine wisdom.

original: de nyid kyis na sngon po la sogs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir skye bar yang mi 'gyur la 'gag par yang mi 'gyur te 'khrul pa'i dus na ni snang la 'khrul pa log na ni mi snang bar zad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na sngon po la sogs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir skye bar yang mi 'gyur la 'gag par yang mi 'gyur te 'khrul pa'i dus na ni snang la 'khrul pa log na ni mi snang bar zad do //
translated: Therefore, blue and so on do not arise and do not cease because they are essenceless. When there is error, they appear; when error is reversed, they simply do not appear.

original: de skad du yang slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas //
analyzed: de skad du yang slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas //
translated: Thus, the master Nāgārjuna says:

original: dngos rnams skye ba yod med cing //
analyzed: dngos rnams skye ba yod med cing //
translated: Things do not have existence or nonexistence.

original: 'gag pa gang na yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'gag pa gang na yod ma yin //
translated: Where could arising and cessation exist?

original: rkyen nyid 'di rnams kho na ni //
analyzed: rkyen nyid 'di rnams kho na ni //
translated: These conditions themselves

original: skye zhing 'gag par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: skye zhing 'gag par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: are what arise and cease.

original: 'byung ba che la sogs bshad pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba che la sogs bshad pa //
translated: The elements and so on that are explained

original: rnam par shes su yang dag 'du //
analyzed: rnam par shes su yang dag 'du //
translated: are completely included in consciousness.

original: ye shes kyis ni de bral na //
analyzed: ye shes kyis ni de bral na //
translated: When they are separated by pristine wisdom,

original: log par rnam brtag cis ma yin //
analyzed: log par rnam brtag cis ma yin //
translated: why are they not taken to be false imputations?

original: gal te de lta na rnal 'byor spyod pa dang de dag tu bye brag ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na rnal 'byor spyod pa dang de dag tu bye brag ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If that is so, what is the difference between the Proponents of Mind Only and the Proponents of the Middle?

original: dbu ma pa kha cig dag ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid de yang dpyad mi bzod pas med par khas len na /
analyzed: dbu ma pa kha cig dag ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid de yang dpyad mi bzod pas med par khas len na /
translated: Some Madhyamikas claim that even the nature of manifestation cannot withstand analysis and so is nonexistent.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /🔽sgro ma btags par mngon sum gyis grub par gyur pa /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te / sgro ma btags par mngon sum gyis grub par gyur pa /
translated: This is not a correct approach.

original: spros @240a * //
analyzed: spros @240a * //
translated: The nature of manifestation, which is established by direct perception without reification,🔽is the basis for the refutation of all conceptual elaborations.

original: pa thams cad log par gyur yang rjes su 'brang ba'i gsal ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dpyod pa'i rgya mtsho las rgal ba cig tu dpyad bzod pa'i bdag nyid can yin te /
analyzed: pa thams cad log par gyur yang rjes su 'brang ba'i gsal ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dpyod pa'i rgya mtsho las rgal ba cig tu dpyad bzod pa'i bdag nyid can yin te /
translated: Even though all conceptual elaborations have been refuted, the nature of manifestation that follows is something that can withstand analysis, for it transcends the ocean of mundane and supramundane analysis.

original: gnod pa thams cad ni sgro btags pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa thams cad ni sgro btags pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because all forms of refutation are based on reified objects.

original: gang gis de la gnod pa byas par gyur na de'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir nyam chung bar 'gyur ba'am des gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis de la gnod pa byas par gyur na de'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir nyam chung bar 'gyur ba'am des gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to refute that, it would be as if one were to undermine the very foundation of one’s own position.

original: yang kho bo ni dngos po thams cad gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis bden la /
analyzed: yang kho bo ni dngos po thams cad gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis bden la /
translated: We, on the other hand, maintain that all things are real in the sense that they have the nature of manifestation.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis mi bden pa ni dbu ma nyid kyi lam yin par smras te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis mi bden pa ni dbu ma nyid kyi lam yin par smras te /
translated: The identity of blue, etc., is not true, and that is the path of the Madhyamaka itself.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa 'di ltar 'dod pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa 'di ltar 'dod pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: The Yogacaras assert this, and

original: n'a ga rdzu na'i zhal snga nas kyang bzhad de /
analyzed: n'a ga rdzu na'i zhal snga nas kyang bzhad de /
translated: Nagardjuna also says the same thing.

original: grub pa'i mtha' 'di ni gcig pa yin la /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' 'di ni gcig pa yin la /
translated: This is the one philosophical system,

original: tha dad par 'dod pa gzhan dag ni kha na ma tho ba med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par 'dod pa gzhan dag ni kha na ma tho ba med pa ma yin no //
translated: and those who assert it to be different are not faultless.

original: shin tu spros pas chog go //
analyzed: shin tu spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this extensive discussion.

original: 'di ni thams cad du gnas par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni thams cad du gnas par gyur pa ste /
translated: This is the way of all things:🔽Thus, all things are appearances, and one should believe that they are mind only, like body and speech, because they are free from the subject-object dichotomy.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad snang ba sems bskyed pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag dang bral bas lus dang ngag bzhin du sems tsam nyid du mos par byas la rnam pa de dag brdzun par rig nas snang ba med par rtogs pa'i sbyor bas spangs te snang
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad snang ba sems bskyed pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag dang bral bas lus dang ngag bzhin du sems tsam nyid du mos par byas la rnam pa de dag brdzun par rig nas snang ba med par rtogs pa'i sbyor bas spangs te snang
translated: Having understood that those aspects are false, one should abandon them by the practice of realizing their non-appearance.

original: ba med pa'i zhi gnas 'di bskyed la /
analyzed: ba med pa'i zhi gnas 'di bskyed la /
translated: One should generate this non-appearance, which is calm abiding.

original: de nyid gsal bar mthong ba'i lhag mthong dang zung du 'jug pa'i bsgom pa rdzogs pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar mthong ba'i lhag mthong dang zung du 'jug pa'i bsgom pa rdzogs pa ni /
translated: The perfection of the meditation which combines this with the insight which clearly sees thatness is

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi bdag nyid can 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes snang ba med cing spros pa thams cad dang bral ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi bdag nyid can 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes snang ba med cing spros pa thams cad dang bral ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the supramundane intuition which has the nature of serenity and insight, which is free from all conceptual elaborations and is non-apprehending.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa gsum yin te /🔽bden min gnyis su rtogs pa yis //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa gsum yin te / bden min gnyis su rtogs pa yis //
translated: Here there are three verses:🔽The mundane intuition is eliminated

original: 'jig rten shes pa rnam par bcas //
analyzed: 'jig rten shes pa rnam par bcas //
translated: by the non-apprehension of the two in the non-existence of the two.

original: rnam pa dag ni brdzun pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam pa dag ni brdzun pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the aspects are false,

original: de ni rnam pa med par brjod //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa med par brjod //
translated: it is said to be without aspects.

original: 'phags pa bden min mi rtog pas //
analyzed: 'phags pa bden min mi rtog pas //
translated: The noble ones, not conceptualizing the non-existence of the two,

original: ye shes gnyis med rnam pa can //
analyzed: ye shes gnyis med rnam pa can //
translated: have the intuition of non-duality.

original: bden min rnam pa spangs nas su //
analyzed: bden min rnam pa spangs nas su //
translated: Having abandoned the non-existence of the two,

original: mnyam nyid ting 'dzin lhag mthong bcas //🔽'jig rten las 'das ye shes ni //
analyzed: mnyam nyid ting 'dzin lhag mthong bcas // 'jig rten las 'das ye shes ni //
translated: they have the meditative concentration of equality, along with insight.🔽The supramundane intuition

original: rnam pa dag ni nub gyur nas ;
analyzed: rnam pa dag ni nub gyur nas ;
translated: is the arising of the non-appearance of the principal,

original: / spros pa med par gnyis med pas //
analyzed: / spros pa med par gnyis med pas //
translated: which is non-dual and free from conceptual elaborations,

original: gtso bo snang ba med pa skye //
analyzed: gtso bo snang ba med pa skye //
translated: after the disappearance of the aspects.

original: byang chub kyi sems gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ni byang chub sems kyi le'u ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ni byang chub sems kyi le'u ste /
translated: The chapter that clarifies the thought of awakening is the chapter on the thought of awakening.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa'i bshad sbyar snyim pa'i me tog las le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa'i bshad sbyar snyim pa'i me tog las le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter of the Blossoming Lotus, a commentary on the Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: // / mchog gi bsnyen pa ni le'u gsum @240b pa dang bdun pa dang bcu gcig pa dang bco lnga pa ste le'u bzhi rnams su gtor te gnas pa la sa de'i mngon par rtogs pa ni le'u gsum pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: // / mchog gi bsnyen pa ni le'u gsum @240b pa dang bdun pa dang bcu gcig pa dang bco lnga pa ste le'u bzhi rnams su gtor te gnas pa la sa de'i mngon par rtogs pa ni le'u gsum pa'i don yin la /
translated: The supreme approximation is divided into four chapters: the third, seventh, eleventh, and fifteenth. The realization of that stage is the meaning of the third chapter.

original: de bas na 'di'i dang por de nyid re zhig mdor bsdus te brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di'i dang por de nyid re zhig mdor bsdus te brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, first of all, that will be summarized and explained.

original: 'di sgrub thabs kyi dbang du byas pa'i sngags pa tshogs bsags pa'i mtshan ma thob pas me tog dang 'bras bu dri zhim po phun sum tshogs pa gtsang zhing nye bar 'tshe ba med pa'i ri sul la sogs par gnas bcas te sgrub pa'i grogs bzang po dang
analyzed: 'di sgrub thabs kyi dbang du byas pa'i sngags pa tshogs bsags pa'i mtshan ma thob pas me tog dang 'bras bu dri zhim po phun sum tshogs pa gtsang zhing nye bar 'tshe ba med pa'i ri sul la sogs par gnas bcas te sgrub pa'i grogs bzang po dang
translated: The mantra practitioner who has attained the signs of having accumulated the collections in terms of the perspective of the means of achievement should live in a place such as a clean, uninhabited mountain valley that is endowed with abundant fragrant flowers and fruits.

original: lhan cig tu mchog gi bsnyen pa rtsom par 'dod pas tho rangs kyi dus su langs la /
analyzed: lhan cig tu mchog gi bsnyen pa rtsom par 'dod pas tho rangs kyi dus su langs la /
translated: One who wishes to perform the supreme service together with the consort should rise at dawn.

original: lam la brten pa'i bar gyi cho ga nas nyams su blangs te /
analyzed: lam la brten pa'i bar gyi cho ga nas nyams su blangs te /
translated: Having practiced the rite up to the path,

original: sems can thams cad la snying rje mngon du byas nas snang ba med pa'i byang chub kyi sems lhag par mos par byas la /🔽aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snying rje mngon du byas nas snang ba med pa'i byang chub kyi sems lhag par mos par byas la / aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: one should manifest compassion for all sentient beings and imagine the bodhicitta free of appearances.🔽One should bless oneself with the mantra:

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab po //
translated: “Oṃ śūnyatājñāna vajra-svabhāvātmako ’haṃ.

original: de'i rjes la chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya'i nang du tshud pa'i khang bu brtsegs pa bsgoms pa /🔽gal te rnam par snang mdzad dam /
analyzed: de'i rjes la chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya'i nang du tshud pa'i khang bu brtsegs pa bsgoms pa / gal te rnam par snang mdzad dam /
translated: After that, one should meditate on the celestial mansion situated within the mudrā of the source of phenomena.🔽If one is a yogin of Vairocana

original: de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pa yin na //
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pa yin na //
translated: or his family,

original: de'i dbus su gdan zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rab bsngags kyi yi ge zla ba ltar dkar ba bsams la /
analyzed: de'i dbus su gdan zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rab bsngags kyi yi ge zla ba ltar dkar ba bsams la /
translated: in its center, on a moon maṇḍala seat, one should imagine the syllable bhrūṃ, white like the moon.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis nam mkha' khyab pa'i sngags kyi lha rnams bsdus te de nyid du bstims pa las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis nam mkha' khyab pa'i sngags kyi lha rnams bsdus te de nyid du bstims pa las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should meditate on the Bhagavat Vairocana arisen from the gathering of the mantra deities pervading the sky by means of his light rays and dissolving into him.

original: mdog dkar po nag po dmar po'i zhal can //
analyzed: mdog dkar po nag po dmar po'i zhal can //
translated: He has a white, black, and red face.

original: rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis rang gi 'od zer gyi rig ma la 'khyud cing ma mchu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis rang gi 'od zer gyi rig ma la 'khyud cing ma mchu 'dzin pa /
translated: With his two principal hands he embraces his light ray knowledge goddess and bites her lower lip.

original: phyag g-yas gnyis kyis 'khor lo dang ral gri 'dzin cing /
analyzed: phyag g-yas gnyis kyis 'khor lo dang ral gri 'dzin cing /
translated: With his two right hands he holds a wheel and a sword.

original: g-yon gnyis kyis rin po che dang padma bsnams pa zla ba'i gdan dang / zla ba'i 'od can /
analyzed: g-yon gnyis kyis rin po che dang padma bsnams pa zla ba'i gdan dang / zla ba'i 'od can /
translated: With his two left hands he holds a jewel and a lotus. He sits on a moon seat and has the luster of the moon.

original: rdo rje'i skyil krung dang / zhi ba'i nyams dang ldan pa ral pa'i cod pan la mi bskyod pas brgyan pa /
analyzed: rdo rje'i skyil krung dang / zhi ba'i nyams dang ldan pa ral pa'i cod pan la mi bskyod pas brgyan pa /
translated: He has a vajra posture and a peaceful expression. He is adorned with Akṣobhya on his topknot.

original: mgo bo dang / mgrin pa snying ga rnams su zla ba rab bsngags dang / a'a: dang h'um gis byin gyis brlab cing 'od zer kha dog sna lnga las de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs spros pas nam mkha'i ngos g-yogs par bsam mo //
analyzed: mgo bo dang / mgrin pa snying ga rnams su zla ba rab bsngags dang / a'a: dang h'um gis byin gyis brlab cing 'od zer kha dog sna lnga las de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs spros pas nam mkha'i ngos g-yogs par bsam mo //
translated: One should bless the head, throat, and heart with the moon, the syllable oṃ, and the syllable āḥ, and imagine that the assembly of tathāgatas emanated from the five-colored light rays covers the surface of the sky.

original: de'i rjes la sbyor ba'i yan lag drug po byas te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la sbyor ba'i yan lag drug po byas te /
translated: After that, one should perform the six-branched yoga.

original: ji skad du le'u bco brgyad pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du le'u bco brgyad pa las /
translated: As it is said in the eighteenth chapter:🔽The supreme practice is the performance

original: bsnyen pa'i yan lag drug tshul du //🔽byas pa mchog ni bsgrub par bya //🔽gzhan @241a * //
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i yan lag drug tshul du // byas pa mchog ni bsgrub par bya // gzhan @241a * //
translated: of the six-branched yoga in the manner🔽of the approach.

original: dag tu ni bsgrubs gyur na //
analyzed: dag tu ni bsgrubs gyur na //
translated: If one practices elsewhere,

original: dngos grub mchog tu mi 'gyur ro //🔽so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // srog rtsol de bzhin 'dzin pa dang // rjes su dran dang ting 'dzin dang // sbyor ba'i yan lag drug ces bya //
analyzed: dngos grub mchog tu mi 'gyur ro // so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // srog rtsol de bzhin 'dzin pa dang // rjes su dran dang ting 'dzin dang // sbyor ba'i yan lag drug ces bya //
translated: there will not be supreme spiritual power.🔽The six branches are called the branches of yoga:🔽withdrawal, meditative concentration,🔽vital energy control, likewise retention,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: recollection, and meditative stabilization.

original: de las 'byung ba chen po lnga bsdus pa ni nam mkha' bsams nas de'i dbus su 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dbang po lnga bsdus pa'i rdo rje bsam mo //
analyzed: de las 'byung ba chen po lnga bsdus pa ni nam mkha' bsams nas de'i dbus su 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dbang po lnga bsdus pa'i rdo rje bsam mo //
translated: From that, the five great elements are collected, and having contemplated space, one should contemplate the vajra in the middle of that, which is the collection of the five sense organs that arise from the elements.

original: de'i lte bar chos kyi dbyings kyi zla ba'i gdan la gnas pa'i sna tshogs pa bsams la shes pa dang shes bya de dag tha dad kyi sbyor ba dang bral bas gdan sna tshogs pa dag dbyer med pa'i nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lte bar chos kyi dbyings kyi zla ba'i gdan la gnas pa'i sna tshogs pa bsams la shes pa dang shes bya de dag tha dad kyi sbyor ba dang bral bas gdan sna tshogs pa dag dbyer med pa'i nges par bya'o //
translated: In its center, one should contemplate the variegated seat, which is the abode of the moon of the realm of phenomena. One should ascertain that the variegated seats are inseparable, since consciousness and the objects of consciousness are free from the application of difference.

original: de'i rjes la sna tshogs pa'i gdan zla ba las zla ba dang nyi ma'i rnam pa gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams rim bzhin du rdo rje nor bu'i sgo nas byung bas padma'i nang du dbus dang / shar dang / lho dang nub dang byang gi cha rnams su bkod la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la sna tshogs pa'i gdan zla ba las zla ba dang nyi ma'i rnam pa gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams rim bzhin du rdo rje nor bu'i sgo nas byung bas padma'i nang du dbus dang / shar dang / lho dang nub dang byang gi cha rnams su bkod la /
translated: After that, from the moon of the variegated seat, one should arrange the forms of the moon and sun, and the forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and textures, respectively, which arise from the door of the vajra jewel, in the interior of the lotus, in the middle, east, south, west, and north.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid la sangs rgyas lnga'i sngags kyi rnam pa aom h'um sv'a a'a:h'a /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid la sangs rgyas lnga'i sngags kyi rnam pa aom h'um sv'a a'a:h'a /
translated: On the variegated seat, the forms of the five buddha mantras are oṃ, hūṃ, sravā, aḥ, and ha.

original: zhes bya ba rnams spros te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnams spros te //
translated: These are elaborated.

original: de dag tu bkod nas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang rang la rtag pa dang mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen dbang po dang / ngag gi dbang phyug dang / don yod grub pa rnams rang gi rigs mtha' yas pa dang lhan cig tu 'ongs te bstim mo //
analyzed: de dag tu bkod nas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang rang la rtag pa dang mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen dbang po dang / ngag gi dbang phyug dang / don yod grub pa rnams rang gi rigs mtha' yas pa dang lhan cig tu 'ongs te bstim mo //
translated: Having arranged them, the respective Akshobhya, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, Amoghasiddhi, and Vairochana, together with their own infinite families, come and dissolve into them.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor lnga'i bdag nyid ji srid 'dod kyi bar du bsgom mo //
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor lnga'i bdag nyid ji srid 'dod kyi bar du bsgom mo //
translated: Thus, one meditates on the nature of the five mandalas for as long as one wishes.

original: de'i rjes la sna tshogs pa'i rang gi gdan la sangs rgyas lnga'i gdan lnga bsdu /
analyzed: de'i rjes la sna tshogs pa'i rang gi gdan la sangs rgyas lnga'i gdan lnga bsdu /
translated: After that, on a multicolored seat, one gathers the five seats of the five buddhas.

original: bdag nyid la ni sangs rgyas lnga po bsdu ba 'di ni so sor sdud pa zhes bya ba'i yan lag dang po'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid la ni sangs rgyas lnga po bsdu ba 'di ni so sor sdud pa zhes bya ba'i yan lag dang po'o //
translated: The gathering of the five buddhas into oneself is the first branch called withdrawal.

original: de'i rjes la sna tshogs pa las pang  mo'i lte ba'i grva gsum du 'khor lo dang padma dang rdo rje rnams spros pa ni bsam gtan dang po rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la sna tshogs pa las pang  mo'i lte ba'i grva gsum du 'khor lo dang padma dang rdo rje rnams spros pa ni bsam gtan dang po rtog pa zhes bya'o //
